loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun H., 47, is married with six children and works as a housewife, cleaning and cooking food for her entire family, while her husband is employed as a soldier, earning US$ 2 each day. Some of her children work as security guards; some work at a factory, and one is a student.

Mrs. Lun H. would like to open a laundry to generate additional income for her family, but she faces financial constraints. She would like to request a loan to purchase a washing machine to use to operate her business so as to improve their financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine to use to operate a laundry business

loans.name: Noemi Esther

texts.es:
Noemí belongs to the Las Águilas community bank located on Jr. Leoncio Prado 237, Calleria, Ucayali. She is 68 years old, separated, and the mother of 7. Her children all currently live on their own, but continue to support their mother. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos totaling 300 sols, she decided to invest in a small restaurant.

Currently she owns a shop that makes and sells a variety of sandwiches throughout the region. She wakes up at 7 in the morning to make breakfast and then get to work.

With the loan valued at 1,300 sols ($450), to be paid back in 5 months, she will purchase 1 sack each of starch, rice and sugar, 5 crates of eggs, 1 box of oils, etc.

Noemí is happy to be healthy and to have received support from Manuela Ramos because they have allowed her to increase her labor capital and consequently improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Noemí pertenece al banco comunal Las Águilas, ubicado en el Jr. Leoncio Prado 237, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 68 años, es separada y madre de 7 hijos, todos ya independientes, pero no dejan de apoyarla. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de preparación y venta de diferentes tipos de bocaditos de la región. Se levanta a las 7 de la mañana para preparar su desayuno y luego comienza con su trabajo. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de almidón, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 casilleros de huevos, 1 caja de aceites, etc. Noemí se siente contenta por la buena salud y por el apoyo que recibe de Manuela Ramos ya que ello le ha permitido ampliar su capital de trabajo y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use:
To purchase ingredients (starch, rice, sugar, eggs, etc.)

Compra de insumos (almidón, arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc)

loans.name: Bibihol

texts.en:
M. Bibihol is 30 years old. She is married with one child.

Bibihol is a seamstress. She sews the national dresses for women and girls. She has been working in the tailoring shop for the last 12 years. The fabrics required for sewing, she purchases by herself in the market. Bibihol is a very popular seamstress and has lots of orders. The business is stable, generating the considerable income for the family.

Bibihol is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 1,000.00 Somoni (300.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months for purchasing a sewing machine. Bibihol thanks everyone supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio lives on Viscachani Street in the Alto Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife and two children, and works in construction and also selling CDs throughout the streets of the city.

The loan would be invested in the purchase of more CDs for his business so he can increase his earnings for his family.

This is his first credit with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregorio vive en la calle Viscachani de zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos,; trabaja como constructor y también se dedica a la venta de CDs por las calles de la ciudad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de más CDS para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase more CDs for his business.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is 26 years old and is single. She takes care of one person, who is 18 years old. Shida owns a small shop, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 20pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Teddy Namazzi's Group

texts.en:
Teddy leads a group of four members. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Their ages are 18, 16, 14, 11, 5, and 3, and they all go to school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban and surrounded by slums.

She has been selling local brew for 15 years in Nakulabye, one of the busy suburbs of Kampala. She collects the brew from the village and sells it to residents of the nearby slums. She must deal with stiff competition.

She has been able to increase her business and contribute to the day-to-day running of her home. She would like to buy a plot of land in order to construct a house.

Teddy has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 25 years old and is an unmarried young woman. She has been selling sugar for the past 5 years. She obtains her supply of sugar from wholesalers and retails it to her customers, who are mostly food vendors like porridge sellers, coffee and tea makers, and bread bakers. She wants to use her loan to buy sugar in bulk to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to further her education, since she could not continue due to financial difficulty. Fati is a member of the group called Blessing. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken during her group meeting.
Fati is pictured in the photo with brownish hair.

loans.use: To buy sugar in bulk

loans.name: Ba

texts.vi:
Mrs Ba is poor and the government helped build her a home. She herself is old and unable to do labor work, so she stays home and take care of her grandchildren, Her family does not have any land to farm, so their livelihood depends on her children working for others. However, it does not mean every child has stable employment. Her grandchild was born without a father, so the grandmother and his aunts and uncles help take care of the child. Even though they have a hard life, she was determined to educate her youngest son, and he is working hard to win a scholarship from the VN Plus program. Her family needs the loan to expand their business of raising chickens. Average income 10 USD per person.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

thuộc diện hộ nghèo được nhà nước xây nhà tình thương. Bản thân chủ hộ tuổi già sức yếu không lao động được, ở nhà nội trợ và chăm sóc cháu ngọai. Gia đình không có đất canh tác, cuộc sống chủ yếu là làm thuê của mấy đứa con. Tuy nhiên công việc không phải đứa nào cũng có thường xuyên. Cháu ngọai sinh ra không có cha nên chịu sự đùm bọc của bà ngọai và cậu, dì. Tuy cuộc sống còn nhiều khó khăn nhưng người mẹ vẫn nhất quyết cho đứa con trai út đi học và cháu đã cố gắng nhiều để được nhận học bổng của dự án VN Plus. Gia đình cần sự giúp vốn để phát triển chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân 159.000 đ/người

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Guillermina Leonor

texts.es:
Miss Guillermina Leonor is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She studied medical assistant. She doesn’t practice her profession because she has a 26-year-old special child, who suffers from convulsions and has to take care of him. Her 19-year-old youngest son studies information technology. She lives in the District of Paiján in the Province of Ascope, at the Department La Liberad. First, she obtained a job teaching basic literacy in the countysiD., but she moved back because she had to take care of her child. In order to be in a better economic situation, she started selling Ebel cosmetic products, soda drinks, sweets, adornments for gifts six years ago. A friend recommended her to the Communal Bank “ HONESTY AND CONFIDENCE ”, now she has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. With the first loan of $300, she bought ceramic adornments, screens, cups, and glasses. With this loan of $1800 that she will repay over a period of 6 months, she plans to invest this money in buying pictures, perfumes, cookies, chocolates. The partner wish is to buy equipment for her business and a tv set for her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Guillermina Leonor, tiene 53 años, está casada, tiene 02 hijos, estudió secretariado médico, no ejerce su profesión porque tiene un niño especial D. 26 años, que sufre D. convulsiones y tiene que cuidarlo, su hijo menor D. 19 años actualmente estudia computación, vive en el Distrito D. Paiján en la Provincia D. Ascope en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Primeramente consiguió un trabajo D. alfabetización en las campiñas, pero se retiró porque tenía que cuidar a su niño. Posteriormente para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 06 años a vender productos cosméticos D. Ebel, gaseosa, golosina, adornos para regalos. Una amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “HONESTIDAD Y CONFIANZA”, ahora tiene 03 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró adornos D. cerámica, pantallas, tazas, vasos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1800.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. cuadros, perfumes, galletas, chocolates. La socia sueña con seguir adelante, y comprar 01 equipo, 01 televisor para su casa.

loans.use:
Buy pictures, perfumes and sweets
.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi V. is 37 years old and has been a TYM member since 2002. She borrowed the first loan worth VND 1 million to raise pigs. Up to now as they become more experienced in animal raising, she also raises buffalos to generate more income for the family. What is more, she buys and sells wholesale lemon. Her businesses are going on well and bring about VND 3 million/month. Besides, her husband is a builder and also earns money for the family. For the next cycle, she applies for VND 12 million to fix breeding facilities and buy one more buffalo to raise.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng A., age 35, is married and lives with her three children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has sold fish to earn a living, and she is able to make $6 per day. Her husband has business running a motor-taxi, making $4 per day. 

She said that selling fish is no longer as lucrative a business as it had been before, because of the illegal fishing and high rate of inflation. She said that sometimes it is hard to purchase fish from a fisherman and, more importantly, the fish price has increased by up to 60 percent. Due to the huge price increases, people have turned to meat, instead of fish. 

She also described the difficulties of her husband's business, such as the high price of gas and the number of competitors. The high price of gas has put many motor-taxi drivers off of the road. 

Mrs. Chheng A. would like to borrow $300, which she will use, along with her savings, to purchase a motorbike for her husband, so he can operate his motor-taxi business. 

Mrs. A.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in used clothing to retail in the community.

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto E. lives in San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela where most of the residents are his relatives. He is married and his wife works as a domestic helper abroad leaving him with their two children, Christian, 12, a graduating elementary student and Crisel Joy, four years old.

Crisanto would like to request a loan amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325) that he can use in cultivating his half-hectare rice field and 0.9 hectare corn field. He has been working these fields for almost 10 years. He is striving hard in order to provide a better life for his family especially to support his children's educational needs. Crisanto does not want to depend on the remittances of his wife for he believes that, as the head of the family, he should be the one responsible for giving them a good life.

Crisanto also hopes that his wife will become successful and he always prays for her good health. They sacrificed to be away from one another to improve their lives, to achieve their dreams and to support the studies of their children until college.

loans.use: To support his rice and corn cultivation.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro M. es padre de familia y por el momento en la casa donde vive esta pagando renta.
Como desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su esposa y sus hijos los cuales todavía están en edad escolar. Esta tramitando una vivienda por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental) pero el valor de la casa es superior al crédito que le pueden otorgar ya que su sueldo es muy bajo.
Trabaja en una compañía de repartidor de documentos a diferentes partes de la ciudad. Cuando se tomó la fotografía no se encontraba el señor M., sólo estaban la señora Marilu Maximina y sus dos hijos.  
Solicita un préstamo para poder completar y así adquirir su vivienda y poder darle un lugar seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro Mendez is the head of a household and at the moment lives in a house where he is paying rent, but hopes to own a secure home for his wife and school-age children. He is in the process of applying for a home through Infonavit, a government housing agency, but the house costs more than the credit he is eligible for given his low salary. He works for a company which delivers documents to different parts of the city. The photo above is of Ramiro's wife Marilu Maximina and their two children, as Ramiro was not at home when the photo was taken. He is seeking a loan in order to complete the financing and acquire the house, so he can provide a secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a house through Infonavit, a government housing agency

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Luciana V. de 44 años, se separó de su esposo hace 10 años , el matrimonio duró 12 años y en ese tiempo tuvieron cinco hijos, quienes quedaron bajo su responsabilidad, encargándose orgullosamente de sus cuidados, alimentación, estudios etc., que ella lo llevo adelante sin problema hasta la fecha.


Dos de sus hijos está estudiando en la universidad, el mayor está en el cuarto año de Odontología y el otro en segundo año de Administración de Empresas, los tres restantes de 18, 15 y 9 años están en la primaria y secundaria.

La señora Luciana se inició en la elaboración de tortas, alfajores, hace 10 años después de quedarse sola, hoy día le provee con sus sabrosos productos  a varios negocios de la ciudad, además realiza trabajo sobre pedido para acontecimientos sociales como cumpleaños, casamientos, y otras actividades. 

Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, tiene clientela  formada y cada vez está aumentando sus pedidos y por ende sus ingresos, que le permite de esta forma seguir costeando los estudios de sus hijos y su ideal es que todos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, manteca y huevos y así poder cumplir con todos los pedidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luciana V. is 44 years old and separated from her husband 10 years ago. During the 12 years they were married, they had 5 children. Luciana proudly takes responsibility for their care, nutrition, studies, etc, and she has moved forward with no problems. Two of her children are university students, the oldest is in his fourth year of Dentistry school and the other a sophomore studying Business Administration. Her other three children, 18, 15, and 9 years old, are still in high school and elementary school. Ten years ago, when Luciana separated from her husband, she began making cakes and alfajores (soft cookies filled with caramel). Today she sells her delicious products to several businesses in the city as well as filling individual orders for social events like birthdays, weddings, and other parties. Thanks to the high quality of her products, she has many customers and her orders are increasing. As her income increases, she is able to continue paying for her children’s studies. Her goal is for all of them to be able to complete a college education. She is asking for this loan to buy flour, sugar, butter and eggs in order to complete her customer’s orders.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 27 años, vive en la casa de su madre. Ella fabrica ladrillos en su propio horno desde hace 2 años, comenzó con este negocio gracias a sus padres, quienes le cedieron un terreno de suelo arcilloso óptimo para la fabricación de ladrillos. En la actualidad se encarga de  buscar compradores para su producción de ladrillos, es por ello que su trabajo consiste  en  dar a conocer su producto y también buscar proveedores. Con esta actividad económica Gloria es independiente económicamente y puede solventar sus estudios,  tiene planes de seguir trabajando en su fábrica y también concluir su carrera. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las personas de más confianza en su banco comunal y siempre  ha sido puntual en sus pagos, además el trabajo que desempeña en su grupo es muy grato para ella. La cantidad que está solicitando la invertirá en la compra de aserrín y arena, además de contratar personal para que la ayude en su fábrica.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old and lives in her mother's home. She has been making bricks in her own oven for the past two years. She started her business thanks to her parents who gave her land with clay soil perfect for making bricks. She is currently looking for buyers for her brick-making business, which is why her work entails advertising her product and finding suppliers. Thanks to this business, Gloria is financially independent and can pay her tuition. She plans to continue working in her enterprise and finishing her studies. This is her third loan with MFP. She is one of the most trusted members of her community bank and has always been punctual with her repayments. In addition she finds the group work very pleasant. She will invest the loan in buying sawdust and sand as well as in hiring people to help her in her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Diana J.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Diana S., a 20-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is married, and she has a 1-year-old child.

Since 2005, Diana has been operating a clothing-sales business. In particular, she purchases clothes at wholesale prices and then sells the clothes at retail prices for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. By doing so, Diana earns approximately $120 per month from her business. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Diana thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothing in bulk

loans.name: La Union De Los Vecinos 2 Group

texts.en:
The members of the La Union de los Vecinos 2 (The Neighbors' Union) Bank of Hope are starting their entrepreneurship endeavor with Esperanza International with this first loan. They hope this micro loan will help them inject some capital in their businesses to make them more stable, or to expand into complimentary activities. 

Miriam R. is the group representative. She is a single mom with a seven year old child. As her primary activity she sells clothing, but she also runs a small cafeteria in her home. Her loan will be used equally in both her businesses; she plans to buy some clothing items that her customers have specially requested, and also expand her cafeteria. 
Miriam finds one of her biggest challenges is to keep her savings in storage and not spend them frivolously. She knows that savings are important in order to become financially independent, which is her ultimate goal. 
Please help us support this new group of entrepreneurs. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase clothing and food to sell.

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony is 28 years old and his wife Loverlyn is 17 years old.  They are newly married and living a simple and happy life in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with a handsome baby boy named Mark Albert.  Both of them only finished their high school level due to poverty but despite this, they promise to do their best in order to give their child a better education someday. 

In order to earn a living for his family, Mark Anthony uses his tricycle to transport passengers from their village to their town.  He also works as a farmer on their small farm where he plants vegetables for extra income.  Mark Anthony is having difficulties supporting his family but never surrenders because of his love for them.  He wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for the maintenance of his tricycle.  He believed that he will be able to increase his income through the support of the lenders.  He also mentioned that patience and sacrifices are the keys to success.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин и его жена занимается откормом скота в домашних условиях. Ему 53 года. Имеет 3 детей. Мухиддин работает в колхозе, но заработная плата небольшая и поэтому занятие животноводством дает хорошую прибавку к семейному бюджету. Мухиддин собирается немного расширить свой маленький бизнес, и поэтому подал заявку на займ на КИВА. На этот займ он собирается приобрести бычка и немного отремонтировать сарай для содержания скота. На фото вы видите жену Мухиддина.
texts.en:
Muhiddin and his wife fatten livestock at their home. He is 53 years old and has 3 children. Muhiddin works at a collective farm, but his salary is not big and this is why raising livestock adds a nice addition to the family budget. Muhiddin plans to grow his small business a little bit and this is why he has applied for a loan on Kiva. He plans to use this loan to purchase a bull and to repair the cowshed a little bit. In the photo you can see Muhiddin’s wife.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bull and repair cowshed

loans.name: Rusembe 2 East Kunihira Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty K. is 26 year old business lady. She is married with three kids and one dependent, who are all in school. She has had a retail shop for over three years but her profits have decreased because of insufficient capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase items such as bags of maize flour, sugar, salt, ground nuts, and tea leafs for her shop in bulk in order to meet her customer demand.

Her dream is to build a bigger house than the one she is staying in.

loans.use: To purchase food items in bulk.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan T. is currently in the business of selling sorghum and maize. She is requesting a loan to stock more sorghum and maize to sell. Juan is 29 years old and is married, with a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum stock to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles O. is 46 years old. He is married and has four children—two are in school and two have completed school. Charles enjoys selling and has been supplying tomatoes to his customers for 15 years to support his family. He treks to farming communities to buy his stock of tomatoes from the farmers. This saves him from the middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to him at a higher price. Charles wants to use the loan to buy tomatoes in bulk to meet the daily demands of his customers. He hopes to use part of his profit to support his last two children in school.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Télou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est né à tsévié, il est venu à Lomé en 2005 et pour subvenir à ses charges,il a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois. Etant un homme à exercer ce commerce, il  réussit à attirer les clients. La pluie a endommagé une partie de son stock, il veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons et assurer le transport.
texts.en:
This gentleman was born in Tsévié. He came from Lomé in 2005. To support himself, he started doing commerce in charcoal. Being a man working in this business, he is successful in attracting customers. The rain has damaged part of his stock. He wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal and to cover the transportation costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is 51 years old and is the mother of three children. Her business is rice farming. Up to now, she still helps her husband get everything done on the farm to ensure that they will reap a bountiful harvest.

Erlinda requested a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She intends to use the loan to purchase a quart of herbicide and a quart of insecticide.

Now, she actively participates in CEVI cluster meetings. She is very pleased with CEVI services, especially that they are offering the lowest interest rates among MFI's in the Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase a quart of herbicide and a quart of insecticide

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en:
After twenty years in the industry, Patrice and her husband decided to open their own furniture showroom. Patrice says that the biggest challenge to her business has been not being able to display a wider variety of furniture in her showroom.

She recently learned about ACCION USA on the internet, applied for a loan, and has been approved. With their loan, Patricia and her husband are buying different varieties of furniture to make a unique and flavorful showroom, hopefully increasing their sales.

Patrice says that her greatest success in business is being able to offer her clients "no credit check" financing options, which has been very helpful during the economic downturn. They currently have two employees, but their goal is to increase business and one day make their store a household name.

loans.use: adding to their inventory of furniture

loans.name: Precious Group

texts.en:
Olivia is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to support her husband and help him to provide for the family. Olivia is the leader of a trust bank group called "Precious." 

The members of the group all work hard. They are engaged in commercial activities, such as selling food, groceries, and clothing. Some of them sell their products door-to-door ("hawking") while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They buy their goods in Kumasi and nearby towns. They have acquired a great deal of experience over the years and they want to expand their businesses, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. 

The group leader, Olivia, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Semona

texts.es:
Semona tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Carlos de 15, Miguel de 12 y Jhosep de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas Semona sale junto a su triciclo a vender el rico jugo de quinua que prepara (jugo caliente hecho a base de quinua licuada, maicena y manzana), la bebida caliente que prepara es muy solicitada, ya que las bajas temperaturas que hay por las mañanas en su región incitan a las personas a tomar algo caliente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede tomar los vasos de jugo que desea cuando tiene hambre, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que despertarse temprano y salir a las frías calles a para vender. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y atender mejor a sus clientes. 
Este es el segundo préstamo de Semona con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, ya que es una persona muy alegre. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar el delicioso jugo de quinua que vende.
texts.en:
Semona is a very hardworking 45-year-old woman who lives in her own home with her three children: Carlos, 15; Miguel, 12; and Jhosep, 10. Her children are the reason behind her efforts. Every morning Semona goes out with her three-wheeled cart to sell delicious quinoa juice (hot juice made from liquidized quinoa, cornstarch, and apples) that she makes herself. The hot beverage is in great demand because in this region temperatures are cool in the mornings, which encourages people to drink something warm. What Semona likes most about her work is that she can drink the glasses of juice she wants when she's hungry. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and believes that the hardest part is having to wake up early and go out in the cold streets in order to sell. In the future she longs to have a store where she can work with greater ease and better serve her customers. This is Semona's second loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma) and she feels very confident that she will be able to make her payments on time. She doesn’t want to cause any problems with her community bank where she is beloved for being such a happy person. She will use the 600 Peruvian soles (US$225) to buy more ingredients in order to make the delicious quinoa juice that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make juice

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: O. Honorine est née le 01 Décembre 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée, Honorine est mère d’un enfant. Honorine a abandonné très tôt les études pour diverses raisons et s'est lancée dans le commerce de divers (produits de toilettes, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, tomates, piments, etc.). Honorine possède une grande baraque où elle vend ces divers articles. Honorine achète la plupart de ses produits à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. C'est dans l'intention de renforcer son activité en vue de mieux satisfaire ses clients, que Honorine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Honorine O. was born on December 1, 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and has one child. She quit school very early for various reasons and began selling assorted products (toiletries, pasta, canned goods, tomatoes, peppers, etc.). Honorine owns a large stand where she sells these goods. Honorine buys most of her products in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She is requesting a loan through Alidé to bolster her business and meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander T. is married with one child. He sells plumbing equipment at a hardware market in Berdyansk town. Alexander has been in this business for 8 years.

Alexander is a very talented entrepreneur. He attracts clients with good quality products and affordable prices. Many clients come back which helps Alexander to develop his business further. 

Alexander would like to borrow 15000 UAH to increase his working capital. 

With the loan he plans to purchase more inventory and increase his sales. His business goal is to start a second location.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase manure for growing and harvesting corn

loans.name: Badamgarav

texts.en: Badamgarav H. is 47 and lives with her husband and her two children in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest daughter is 24 and a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and her youngest son is 6 and goes to a local secondary school. Badamgarav rents a small stall in the Altan-Eh shopping center, one of the town's large shopping centers. She has been selling various food products at her rental stall since 2008. Her retail business has grown fast and her business capital has expanded from 1,000,000 MNT to 4,300,000 MNT ($1 = 1,450 MNT) in a year. She would like to expand her growing business and purchase necessary equipment. She says that she needs to purchase a fridge with a glass cover for selling ice cream and other frozen products. She requests a loan to purchase a fridge and increase her working capital for her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Ahliman

texts.en:
Ahliman A. is a 42-year-old trader who sells different types of electrical appliances, such as vacuum cleaners, kettles, and meat choppers. He has 15 years of experience selling electrical goods. His business is the only source of income for his family. Ahliman is married and has three children. His dream is to provide his children with best education and pass his business to one of his two sons. 

Ahliman would like to expand his business so he applied for a $1600 USD loan to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more appliances to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites, 37, owns a piggery, a rice farm and a sari-sari (general) store. With these simple ways of living, she supports her 2-year-old child as well as her family. She needs additional capital to help grow her businesses. She requested a loan from Kiva's partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc., worth 12,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the amount to buy fertilizers, farm supplies and groceries for her store.

loans.use: Farm supplies and groceries

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sao O., 36 years old, is the representative of the loan group, which consists of eight people. She lives in Prey Phnhi village in Takeo province. She is married with five children. One of her children is a silk weaver, three are students in the local school and one is just three years old. Mrs. Sao O. and her husband, Mr. Ly Hean, are farmers who own a piece of land used to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, they are silk weavers. Since their business is going well, Mrs. Sao O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silks for weaving. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more silks

loans.name: Kava Raity Group

texts.es: The Women Entrepreneurs Committee of Benjamin Aceval Chaco is in its first loan cycle.  Many of the clients sell clothing, whereas others sell food, perfumes, linen goods, and baked goods.  Thanks to the loan obtained trough Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva these women are able to get ahead in life.
texts.en:
The Women Entrepreneurs Committee of Benjamin Aceval Chaco is in its first loan cycle. Many of the clients sell clothing, whereas others sell food, perfumes, linen goods, and baked goods. Thanks to the loan obtained trough Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva these women are able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make baked goods, purchase fruit, vegetables, and linen goods

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en: Evelyn S. is from the village of Masin, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 38 years old and is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Evelyn is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita L. is from the village of Zone II, Tariji, Tarlac. She is 45 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing beauty salon services in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Conchita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius D. O. is 40 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is a quiet man full of confidence in his voice. Julius lives in Malanga, Nambale, Busia district. He deals in second hand clothes. He started this business in January 2010. Julius is also a preacher at one of the local churches.

Julius would like a loan of KShs. 20,000, which will go into expanding his stock and creating a kitty for the business. His future plan is to expand his business into ready-made clothes.

loans.use: To expand his stock

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras R. De Teja Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del Banco Comunal de la Aldea Rancho de Teja del municipio de San Francisco el Alto, del departamento de Totonicapán, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desde hace más de veinte años, este grupo está conformado por once integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza de animales, confección de ropa, venta de canastillas.

Las integrantes del grupo decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia ya que estas personas son de escasos recursos y es de gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital de negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The women of "Aldea Rancho de Teja" (Village of Rancho de Teja) Village Bank, in San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán, have all known each other well for more than twenty years. The group consists of eleven members, women engaged in a variety of businesses, including raising animals, making clothing, and selling small baskets. The members decided to seek a loan with ASDIR in order to improve quality of life for themselves and their families. They are people of meager resources and it's immensely helpful for them to grow their working capital, improve their sales, and increase their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has a business venture in the agriculture sector selling crops — primarily rice and corn grains. She has been engaged in her business for over three years  earning approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rizalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rizalyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rizalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco S. de 45 años de edad, reside en el Cantón San José, ubicado en el municipio de San Francisco Gotera. Desde hace varios atrás que él se dedica a atender su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos varios como productos para el hogar, para uso personal y productos alimenticios, debido a que vive en una zona semi rural, no posee competencia, lo cual es muy beneficioso para él debido a que es el único que vende en el lugar. Juan vive en su hogar junto a su compañera de vida, la cual le ayuda a atender el negocio, ambos trabajan con muchos deseos de salir adelante y así mismo de mejorar y su negocio, surtiéndolo con todos los productos posibles para obtener más ganancias. Juan solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la tienda comprando productos como: pan, medicinas, golosinas, diferentes tipos de bebidas, detergentes, granos básicos y muchos productos más los cuales son primordiales en un negocio como este, ya que son los que más se solicitan. Juan desea mucho poder prosperar en su negocio, sobretodo porque es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco S., age 45, lives in Cantón San José, located in the municipality of San Francisco Gotera. For several years, he has dedicated himself to running his own business, a shop selling various items such as household goods, personal care products, and foods. Since he lives in a semi-rural zone he doesn’t have competition. This is very beneficial for him since he is the only one who sells in his location.

Juan lives in his home with his life companion who helps him attend to the business. They both work with a great desire to get ahead and to improve the business, stocking it with as many products as possible in order to increase earnings.

Juan is applying for a loan in order to invest in the store by purchasing products such as bread, medicine, sweets, different kinds of drinks, detergents, bulk grains, and many more products which are essential in a business like this since they are what most people ask for. Juan very much wants to succeed in his business, especially since it is his only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for his shop.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 29 years old, married with two children who are 3 and 6 years old.  Alice owns a shop where she sells cosmetic goods and this is her 5th successful year in this business.  Alice's shop hours are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Alice needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and she hopes that it will allow her to expand her shop through purchasing additional cosmetics and starting selling foodstuffs as they are highly desired by a large number of her customers.  If she experiences success with this loan, Alice will start saving and keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: Additional cosmetics and start selling foodstuffs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora T. is from the village of Bayug, Hinaplanan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Nora is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nora operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making ground pork into a sorizo or home-made sausage and selling it in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Nora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rwobusisi Bakyara Tukolerehamwe, Rukungiri. Group

texts.en: B. Godfrey is the leader of this lending group in Rukungiri. He is 37 years old and married with 3 children, all in primary school and he also takes care of other dependents. Godfrey is a boda boda (bicycle taxi) cyclist in Rukungiri, operating from the Bus Park stage for over 5 years. Most of his customers include district officials, local residents and school children. With this clientele, he is able to earn approximately 250,000 UGX as monthly profits, which help with his children’s school fees and general upkeep. Godfrey also has a banana plantation and he is able to sell his produce to merchants. He also has a retail shop that is mostly managed by his wife. He says that it has not been an easy road as he was a security guard before venturing into business. He is such a hardworking and dedicated man and he now owns three motorcycles with the help of loans. He needs a loan to help with upgrading his banana plantation and restocking his retail shop.

loans.use: Upgrading his banana plantation and restocking his retail shop

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua K. is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She has no educational background.

Ekua sells charcoal at Takoradi both in small and larger quantities. She uses the income from her sales to support her husband in providing the basic needs of her family such as feeding, clothing and educating her children.

Ekua will use the loan to acquire additional bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia G. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize flour and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour and some bags of charcoal to sell.  Cicilia is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building a store and stock more bags of maize flour, beans etc to sell.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan J.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling fruits and vegetables in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Susan has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Iveth Carolina

texts.es:
Iveth de 30 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó a comprar víveres para venderlos a sus vecinos, pero como necesitaba mas ingresos tubo que gastar sus ahorros en enlatados y así tener mas ingresos. Trabaja con ayuda de su hija desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Para seguir con su negocio ya que su casa es de caña y quiere mejoras necesita comprar bebidas, entados y arroz para así tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Iveth, 30, has a small store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a neighborhood called "Duran," on the outskirts of the city where the natural ecology is fast disappearing.  

To help with the family expenses, she started to buy groceries to sell to her neighbors, but she had to spend her savings on canned goods so that she could have a better income.  She works with the help of her daughter from 6am until 10pm.  

To continue with her business, since her house is made of cane and in need of repair, she needs to buy drinks, canned goods and rice so that she can increase her income.  In the future she wants to expand her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Suubi Lya Mukama Women's Group 1-Lugazi

texts.en: Deborah N.'s first business was poultry. That was approximately five years ago, before she came up with the idea of setting up her current retail business in Kitigoma-Lugazi. She sells a variety of general merchandise like sugar, posho, cooking oil, and soap. Her weekly profits are up to 150,000 shillings. Deborah belongs to Suubi lya Mukama women’s group-Lugazi. She also farms and has a poultry business, though at a smaller scale than before. She is requesting this loan to purchase more general merchandise for resell at her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail merchandise such as sugar, salt, soap, maize flour, and cooking oil, for resell at her shop.

loans.name: Maria Bate

texts.pt:
Maria Bate M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 6 filhos de 2 aos 26 anos de idade, três destes vão a Escola. Fez 2ªclasse não concluiu porque seu pai obrigava lhes a passar a maior parte do tempo trabalhando na machamba. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.
Maria vivia numa localidade do mesmo Distrito (Mandevo) que dista 10km da vila sede, devido a guerra teve que mudar se para a vila Sede onde vive ate então. Após sua chegada começa a fazer negócio de pequena escala vendendo pastéis nas esquinas da escola, mas com ajuda do seu marido consegue arranjar uma banca no Mercado Central onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como (tomate, cebola, cenoura e arroz) tem gastado uma média de 5.000.00mt nas compras e tendo de lucro 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e da obra. Para além vender faz refeições no Mercado (sopa) diariamente consegue ter 350mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Maria na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (tomate, cebola, cenoura, arroz e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seus produtos. O anterior crédito de 5.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade. 
Pagou com muito sucesso e esta confiante que fará o mesmo neste segundo para aceder a mais empréstimos pois gostaria tanto de ajudar sua filha.
texts.en:
Maria Bate M. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She has six children between the ages of 2 and 26.  Three of them go to school.  Maria finished second grade but did not continue with school because her father made his children spend most of their time working on the machamba (small family farm).  She lives in her own house and does not support anyone other than her family.

Maria lived in a part of the District (Mandevo) about 10 kilometers from the town of Sede.  Because of the war, she had to move to Sede, where she has lived ever since.  After her arrival, she began a small business selling pies at the corners of the school, but with her husband's help she acquired a stall at the Central Market where she sells staple goods such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and rice.  She spends on average 5,000 meticais on her purchases and makes a profit of 3,000 meticais, which she uses for household needs and construction expenses.  She also makes meals (soups) to sell daily at the Market and earns 350 meticais.

This is Maria's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products (tomatoes, onions, carrots, rice, etc.) to increase her inventory.  The previous loan of 5,000 meticais was used for the same purpose.

She paid off the loan easily and is confident that she will do the same with this second loan.  She hopes to have more loans because she would like to help her daughter.

loans.use: Purchase products (tomatoes, onions, carrots, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is 29 years old, married, and lives in Saida in the South of Lebanon. His main source of income is from his work as a painter, which he began in 2004. This is the first time that Akram has taken a loan with Al Majmoua and he is asking for $1000 USD to repair the vehicle he uses for work. He has gained a lot of experience in his trade and hopes to expand his business, becoming better known and generating more customers.

loans.use: Vehicle Repair

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She works as a beautician who has developed her business in her home. She works independently on her business and she lives on her own. She has been involved in this business for almost 20 years. She offers different types of beauty services to her clients such as make up, manicure, pedicure etc.  With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will invest in purchasing new beauty supplies.  She said that with the help of the loan, she will expand her work operation significantly and increase her overall profit. She is able to serve a wide range of clients from her home.

loans.use: To purchase new beauty supplies

loans.name: Samakarr Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Samakarr” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Adama T..  Adama was born in the town of Magburaka forty-two years ago. She is married and has four children – three in secondary school and one in college.

Adama is in the business of selling rice, groundnuts, salt, ginger, etc. She has been in this business for twelve years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in larger quantity to add to her current stock. This will eventually lead to improvement in sales and increase in profit for Adama. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy rice, groundnuts, salt, ginger, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta, de 43 años, convive con Gabino, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero cuida de dos de ellas, Felicita, de 24 y María, de 6 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Hace 20 años que se dedicó a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de frutos como piña, y cítricos. Todas las mañanas junto a su esposo Gabino trabajan arduamente para poder sacar adelante sus cultivos; los que cada fin de semana venden en el depósito de frutas que se ubica en la ciudad, donde los intermediarios constantemente llevan a diferentes lugares del Perú. Pero como Antonia tiene que mandar constantemente dinero a la capital, donde su hija Felicita, estudia Contabilidad en una universidad reconocida; abrió hace tan solo 2 años una tienda de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de su localidad, es así que ella quiere seguir trabajando arduamente para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y según menciona está contenta, con el trabajo que cada mes hace con los integrantes de su banco comunal, donde aprender a salir adelante. Con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado surtir su negocio de comestibles, y si el dinero le alcanza podrá invertir en la compra de algunos sacos de abono orgánico que le falta para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 43 years old.  She lives with her partner, 44 year-old Gabino.  They have three children but currently only look after two of them: 24 year-old Felicita and 6 year-old María.  They live together in their own home which is located in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Antonieta has been working in agriculture for 20 years.  Her main crops are fruit such as pineapples and citrus fruits.  Every morning she works hard, together with her husband Gabino, to grow their crops.  Every weekend they sell their produce in the fruit wholesalers in the city from where middlemen constantly transport the fruit to different places in Peru.  However, as Antonia has to constantly send money to the capital city, where her daughter Felicita is studying accountancy at a well-known University, 2 years ago she also opened a grocery store where she sells essentials to the residents of her town.  She would like to continue working hard so that she can get her children ahead in life.

This is Antonieta's ninth loan with MFP and she says that she is happy with the work that she does with the other members of her community bank  every month, where she learns to get ahead.  Antonieta plans to use this loan to stock her grocery store business and, if the money reaches far enough, she will invest in buying some sacks of organic fertilizer that she needs for her crops.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store and to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn G. is 37 years old, married and has five children, all of whom attend school.  She is a farmer who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She plants and harvests rice crops. She rents a stall in the market to sell her harvest. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizers for her rice farm.  Emelyn hopes to be a successful entrepreneur. She wants to be able to provide for all her family's needs. She wishes for bright futures for her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cirilo; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerdos, el socio tiene un lugar grande donde cría y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cerdos. El  socio solicita el préstamo comprar animales como cerdos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Women in Action" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

His name is Cirilo; he is 56 years old and married, with 6 children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling pigs. He has a large space where he raises the pigs, and later he sells them at various local markets. He would like to expand his pig-selling business. He is requesting the loan to buy animals such as pigs. 

The borrower is happy about the loan, and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buying animals such as pigs

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert C. and his wife, Cece, produce “The Wedding and Quinceañera Planner,” a book offering checklists in English and Spanish that help ease the stress of ceremony planning.  It includes tips and tools for handling a variety of tasks, from ordering flowers to creating registries, even offering a final wedding day checklist for the maid of honor.

Albert explains that the planner isn’t meant to cover every contingency, but serve as a point of reference.  “If this were a complete list, then this would be a cookie-cutter event, and you’d sign up for a color and a date, and we’d crank you through.  But it’s not supposed to do that.  This is supposed to be your great day.  You’ve never done this before, so you need a starting point. This is your starting point.”

Publishing the book is a team effort. Albert handles advertisement sales and the book’s distribution.  Cece does editing and advertisement design.  All of the firms that advertise in “The Wedding and Quinceñeara Planner” distribute copies of the book to their customers.  Cece and Albert print an updated copy of “The Wedding and Quinceañera Planner” every 6 months.

Albert and Cece provide the “The Wedding and Quiceañera Planner” free to customers because they generate revenue through advertisements.  Unfortunately, this year some of the advertisers were late with their payments.  “We had been expanding until about a year ago, when we had a few advertisers decide not to renew their contracts. This fall, we had more that decided not to renew, and I had a hard time collecting the money.”  Because publishing requires up-front payment, this put them in a bind. “We decided we needed to do something to get the books printed so we’d have them to hand out at the wedding fair.  We went to the bank and didn’t quite meet their criteria, but she recommended ACCION to us.”

The loan provided Albert and Cece the funds needed to publish the planner in time for the semi-annual wedding fair, their biggest business event.  Without this loan, Albert and Cece would have had to refund what advertising revenues they had collected and would not have been able to publish the book.  Albert and Cece advise other business owners to “Keep an eye on your receivables.  Don’t expect it (money) to automatically flow in.”

Albert and Cece believe in the long-term potential of their business as much as they believe in the product they offer.  Albert says that business is picking up again, and that he and Cece are continuing to receive positive feedback from customers.  “One couple told me, ‘I bought a formal planner, but it hasn’t been nearly as informative as your book’… That’s rewarding.  Knowing that a couple is sampling from your publication and they’re on the right feet.”

Albert and Cece started this business six years ago, after family friends started a similar business in another city.  They saw that Corpus Christi didn’t have an equivalent service, and decided to create one based on their friends’ recommendation.  Albert and Cece and their five children are supported by this business.  To learn more about Albert and Cece’s business, visit their website http://www.coastalbendweddings.com/.

loans.use: To publish a catalog/book for wedding and quinceañera planning

loans.name: Santos Francisca

texts.es: Santos Francisca tiene 44 años, por lo que esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos ya que los ha utilizado en su negocio. Ella se dedica a una panadería. Ella tiene 5 hijos pero solamente 3 están a su cargo. Con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando su inventario y fue realizando la elaboración de su delicioso pan, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan en busca de la mejor calidad de pan. Actualmente Santos solicita este financiamiento para la compra de huevos, harina, mantequilla, queso, leña, bolsas entre otros productos. Ella sueña con que sus hijas logren finalizar sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Santos Francisca is 44 years old and this is not her first experience obtaining financing. She has applied them to her bakery business.  She has 5 children but only 3 are under her care.  As time has passed, she has expanded her inventory and has been baking her delicious bread.  The majority of her clients come in search of the best quality of bread.  Santos is requesting the loan to purchase: eggs, flour, butter, cheese, firewood,  and bags among other things.  She dreams of her daughters finishing school and becoming prosperous people.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables and tomatoes, which are all sold locally. He also owns a motorbike that provides transport services to the local people.

Mark is 43 years old and married with seven children whose ages range between 4 and 20. Six of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family and pay for the education of his children. He hopes to expand his farming activities in the next five years and expand his market coverage as well.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor S. is married and resides with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day, while his wife sells vegetables, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to operate the business more efficiently

loans.name: Lonito

texts.en:
Lonito V. is from the city of Guingona Ozamiz City. He is 48 years old. Lonito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lonito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  vegetables and squash for sale. Lonito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lonito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lonito is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lonito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase addtional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Tin A., a 37-year-old merchandise trader in the busy local market for over five years, sells items such A. cooking materials and groceries, earning US$10 a day. The mother of a young school-aged child dependent on her income, Tin wA. married but divorced her husband many years ago.

Customer patronage of Tin A.’s business is growing steadily, so in order to meet customer demand she is requesting a loan of US$ 600 from Kiva to purchase additional cooking supplies and grocery items.

loans.use: to buy additional cooking supplies and grocery items.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 36 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad los cuales viven en la casa de su suegra. Su casa esta ubicada en una zona urbana del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz 

Juana se dedica a la venta de tubérculos  como papas, camotes y cebollas en un puesto en el mercado Mochoqueque, Juana cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia en el mercado menorista, con muy buenos resultados.  Ella se ha dado cuenta de la ampliación de su negocio y de la gran cantidad de clientes que ha ido captando, por eso necesita ampliar su negocio para cumplir con la demanda de su público.

Juana esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de s/. 1500  nuevos soles, para que pueda implementar su negocio con nuevas clases de tubérculos, esto le ayudará a tener una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, abastecer a pequeños distribuidores y convertirse posteriormente en una distribuidora mayorista.

Juana es cliente de nuestra institución y a lo largo de todo este tiempo a demostrada responsabilidad y puntualidad   en todo momento.
 Juana es una mujer luchadora que  aspira a  cumplir sus sueños con entusiasmo y esfuerzo
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old, married and has 2 young children.  They live with her mother-in-law in an urban zone in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz.  

Juana sells tubers such as potatoes, sweet potatoes and onions from a stand in the Mochoqueque market. She has been working in the retail market for 6 years and has had very good results. She realizes that expanding her business will attract a large number of customers and for this reason she needs to expand to meet the demand.  

Juana is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for s/.1500 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] so that she can increase her business by carrying new types of tubers.  This way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, supply small distributors and subsequently, become a wholesale distributor.  
 
Juana is a client of our institution and over time she has demonstrated that she is responsible and punctual at all times.  Juana is a hard-working woman that aspires to fulfill her dreams with enthusiasm and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase tubers (potatoes and onions) in large quantities to expand her business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 24, 23, 19 años, Mercedes se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas, carne en un triciclo por las calles del distrito de San Juan Bautista. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, frutas, carne, para surtir su mercadería. Mercedes comenzó con éste negocio hace 7 años, porque su esposo no le ayudaba y tenia que mantener a sus hijos. Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta porque le enseñaron a valorarse a trabajar, le dan préstamos para trabajar, pasa bonitos momentos con sus compañeras del banco estando en FINCA educo a su hija que termino enfermería técnica. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y vender en su casa, construir el segundo piso de sus casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella community bank.  She is married and has three children aged 24, 23 and 19.  Mercedes sells fruit, vegetables and meat from a three-wheeled vehicle in the streets of San Juan Bautista district.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying fruit, vegetables and meat with which to stock her business.  Mercedes started this business seven years ago because her husband didn't help her and she needed to support her children.

Mercedes joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing borrower.  She likes it because they have taught her to value work and given her loans so that she can work.
