She enjoys spending time with the other members of her community bank and she has managed to educate her daughter who has finished a nursing course.  Mercedes' dream is for her business to continue prospering and to be able to sell from home.  She would also like to build a second level on her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia is a palm oil extractor at Abura. She has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to produce more oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to produce more oil for sale.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 48 years old, married, and has three children.  They live in Baalbeck. Randa works in preparing and selling Mouneh, in addition to sewing wool and cotton jackets, shirts, and baby dresses.  She has been in this business since 2005. 

Randa loves her work a lot, and her customers are loyA. to her, because when it comes to the Mouneh business (Mouneh is food that is stored for later consumption, such as pickles, jams, tomato paste, etc.)they prefer fulfilling their needs from her because cleanliness is a must in such a business, and they trust her for that.
 
Randa is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy necessary products to prepare requested autumn-winter Mouneh products that are available in this summer season, in addition to buying new wool colors to prepare new winter baby designs. Randa hopes to open a baby clothes shop, all made from her handmade designs, in the future.

loans.use: To purchase necessary products to prepare requested autumn-winter Mouneh products

loans.name: Keilor Mauricio

texts.es:
Keilor Mauricio, tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El con el dinero pretende realizar la compra de un caballo para el trasporte de café en la próxima cosecha. El cuenta con el lugar apto para tener el animal en buenas condiciones de vida y los implementos para su mantención. El quiere poder tener disponible un animal de este para el trasporte de fácil de sus cosechas. Una de sus metas es tener un fácil transporte de su café al recibidor.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Keilor Mauricio, 20, is single living with his parents.  He intends to use the money to buy a horse to transport the coffee from his next harvest.  He has a place that’s suitable to keep the animal in good living conditions and the tools for its upkeep.  He wants to have an animal available for the easy transport of his harvests.  One of his goals is to have an easy way to transport his coffee to the receiver.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, está  casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos D. ellos ya independientes.  Lucila estudió hasta 3ro D. secundaria.
Trabaja desD. hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio D. venta al por mayor D. granos.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir.  Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, comprará 150 casacas D. todas las tallas.  Nos cuenta que compra sus productos en Desaguadero y los venD.  en el mercado D. Yunguyo y Juliaca.  Su esposo se encarga D. venderlas en la ciudad D. Lima.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio, aumentar más su mercadería y así obtener más ingresos económicos, con ello podrá comprar su casa.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Lucilia is a member of the “Virgen D. la Asunción” communal bank, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department.  She is 45 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are on their own.  She has a 9th graD. education.

Lucilia has been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for four years and her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to invest into her business of selling bulk grain.  Now she sells clothing and she will use the money from this 2,500 PEN ($925) loan to buy 150 coats of various sizes.  She tells us that she buys her products in Desaguadero and sells them in the “Yunguyo y Juliaca” market in Lima.

Her greatest dream is to improve her business, increase her inventory of merchandise, and in this way increase her income so that she can buy a house.  What she likes most about the communal bank in the ease of obtaining loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy coats for resale

loans.name: Salostiano

texts.en:
Salostiano is 29 years old and married with a four-year-old child. For the past eight years, he has been a rice farmer. He also owns a carabao (water buffalo) to help till his land. Salostiano works hard to support his family and save for his child’s future.

Salostiano is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. He hopes to improve his family’s living conditions through his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Nop, 56, lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. She lives with Leng, 61, shown in the picture, and their five children. Nop cares for her family and provides a good education for her children. She works hard in the fields, planting rice, corn and bananas on her own land. She’s been in this farming business for 16 years.

During harvest, her children help her and she hires day workers to harvest and transport the crops. The crops are transported a certain distance, where they are picked up by motorized vehicles for further transportation. She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily effort, she sees her farming business developing and making a good profit.

She says certain months while farming, the population of insects is very high and they damage the crops. She requests a loan from Kiva to purchase natural fungicides and sacks of manure to fertilize her lands and make them productive. This is his 4th loan, and and a small one to reach her objectives, so she is naturally predisposed to repay it punctually.

loans.use: to purchase natural fungicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Azhuu

texts.en:
Azhuu is 41 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His two eldest children are college students and the youngest one is a high school student. His wife manages a soft drink producing factory. 

Azhuu operates car repair center. He has been repairing cars since 2004. During the summer season, he hires two employees and pays them each 200,000 MNT as a salary. 

He is remodeling his garage and he is planning to upgrade and improve his equipment and technology. 

He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "The demand of car repair service is less during the winter. It is almost impossible to repair cars outside during the winter season. Thus, I want to expand my garage and repair cars in winter." 

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and new equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials and new equipment.

loans.name: Iveth

texts.es: Iveth  de 48 años de edad, vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 23 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde vende papelería, útiles escolares y artículos de oficina. Este negocio inició hace menos de 2 años, después de que Iveth trabajara por 18 años en una papelería donde logró acumular su gran experiencia, que finalmente tradujo en una microempresa, con la que genera ingresos importantes para apoyar la gestión de su hogar . Su primer capital lo obtuvo de sus ahorros y de un crédito que hizo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; organización de la que ha recibido 3 financiamientos, con los cuales incrementó su capital, se dio a conocer en el mercado y ha logrado una gran autonomía. Su meta ahora es agregar una sala de internet, para ofrecer servicios de telecomunicaciones y lograr suficiente capital para hacer compras que la conviertan en mayorista de los pequeños negocios. Mientras todo esto lo consigue Iveth con su trabajo persistente, maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 30 días, una rotación de inventarios de 17 días, y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no inferior a un 30%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su inversión exitosa con la cual comprará en mayor volumen papelería, útiles educativos y también acondicionará su vivienda, ubicando su almacén  de manera independiente a su medio ambiente familiar y con ello trabajará por su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Iveth is 48 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and three children, who range in age from 20 to 23. She has business where she sells stationery, school supplies, and office supplies. Iveth started this business less than two years ago after having worked at a stationery shop for 18 years. After accumulating a wealth of experience, she finally established her own business which now generates important income for maintaining her household. Her first source of capital was her savings and a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Iveth has now received three loans from the organization and the money was used to increase her capital. As a result, she has become known in the marketplace and has achieved a great deal of autonomy. Her present goals are to add an Internet café where she can provide telecommunication services and to acquire sufficient capital so that she can become a wholesaler to small businesses.

In the meantime, Iveth continues to be persistent in her work. She manages an accounts receivable period of 30 days, an inventory turnover period of 17 days, and sales profitability of no less than 30%. These financial indicators point to a successful investment. She will use this loan to buy stationery and school supplies in bulk, as well as remodel her home. Iveth hopes to have a space for her store that is separate from her family’s living quarters. This will allow her to work in order to reach her growth potential.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, school supplies, and office supplies in bulk and to remodel her home so that she can have a separate space for her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 71 and married to John, a farmer, is the mother of a 40-year-old. For the past ten years her primary business has been farming, earning her a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member, Jane is applying for her first loan in order to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will venture into pig-keeping. Her dreams are to breed pigs in large quantities and be the distributor of pork in her home area so as to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхон более 4 лет работает водителем такси. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он очень старательный и трудолюбивый человек. Амирхон любить свою семью и хочет содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Чтобы получить дополнительный доход он дома занимается откормом скота и имеет хорошую условию для них. Амирхон хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Амирхон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота и ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Amirkhon works as a taxi driver for more than four years. He is married and is a loving father of three children. He is very diligent and hardworking man. Amirkhon loves his family and wants to support them in good living conditions. To receive additional income he does animal husbandry at home and has good conditions for this. Amirkhon wants to expand his business and maximize his profit. He wants to get a loan in the amount of $1000 USD to buy cattle and repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy cattle and repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s scrap business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap, like plastic bottles, used papers, etc., in order to increase his sales and profits. Zeenat's husband has been operating his business for the past 10 years and handles a good clientele base.  

Zeenat is a mother of three sons and a daughter. Her elder son is illiterate and does not work, while her younger son does work with his father. The youngest works in a motor workshop. Her daughter reads in 8th standard. 

Zeenat herself is a talented lady who operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income for her family. She receives orders from her community clients and earns a good income by completing them on time. 

Zeenat is confident that the investment will take her husband's business to a more profitable position and improve the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: to buy scrap for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Desde pequeño Carlos Enrique aprendió de su padre las labores del campo, y hoy a sus 68 años de edad sigue desempeñando esta labor para tener una fuente de ingresos económicos debido a la difícil situación económica, Carlos tiene una vaca lechera y algunas gallinas y todos los días desde muy temprano se va a ordeñar a su vaca y a coger los huevos para luego comercializar estos productos, sin embargo las ventas no siempre son buenas, y la producción no es la esperada, por lo que hoy Carlos Enrique ve la necesidad de comprar otra vaca que le permita generar mas utilidades, pues a su edad Carlos Enrique sólo sueña con tener una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que sigue trabajando con gran dedicación para lograrlo, y así tener una vida mas tranquila al lado de su esposa y sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
From a young age Carlos Enrique learned from his father about farm work and today at 68 years of age he continues carrying out this work in order to have a source of income during this difficult economical time. 

Carolos has a dairy cow and some chickens and very early every day he milks the cow and collects the eggs to sell later. However, sales are not always good, and the yield not as much as he hoped for, which is why Carlos Enrique sees the necessity of buying another cow that would allow him to increase his profits. 

Well, at his age his only dream is to improve his quality of life, and to continue working with dedication to achieve it, and thus to have a more peaceful life at the side of his wife and his five children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de 58  años, está casado y vive con su esposa  e hijo  que son su prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia y la semilla para sembrarla. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo además de varios años de experiencia en el manejo de maíz. El quiere sembrar un área establecida de condiciones favorables para el buen desempeño de la plantación, y además tener los insumos necesarios para su buena fertilización y mejorar del cultivo. El con esta siembra pretende generar el máximo de ganancias para mejorar su nivel de vida y su bienestar familiar. También piensa con la ganancias generadas saldrá con los pagos establecidos del crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, 58, is married and lives with his wife and a son who are his priority.  He will use the loan to buy farm supplies and seed.  He has a plot of land that’s suitable for this crop and he also has several years’ experience growing corn.  He wants to plant in a settled area with favorable growing conditions for this crop and also to have the necessary supplies on hand for fertilizing and improving the crop.  He expects to generate the maximum profits possible with the crop to improve his standard of living and his family’s wellbeing.  He also believes that profits generated will allow him to repay the loan.  This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur gave him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ariuntuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariuntuul, 29, is a taxi driver and has been running her business for a half-year. She lives with her husband in Kherlen, a western boundary town of Mongolia. She and her husband used to have their own livestock, but they sold all of them and bought a car to start the taxi business. It is going on successfully and according to her plan.
 
She and her husband have now decided to start another business, a grocery store downtown, because the earnings from the taxi business isn't a large enough income source for their family. Initially she needs 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) for building working capital, such as food commodities for sale. Therefore the loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the food commodities from the market for her new grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase the food commodities from the market for her new grocery store sales.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El sr. Cristóbal es artesano se dedica a la fabricación de manualidades según a la temporada ahora esta realizando adornos navideños por estas fiestas de fin de año  se  dedica a la venta y costura de corbatas y campanas por mayor, el tiene cuatro hijos que son todavía dependientes de la familia, su esposa de dedica  a labores del hogar, el Sr. Cristóbal y toda su familia se dedica a las artesanías ya que el también vende en alasitas  entrega al por mayor y según pedido sus adornos con el crédito otorgado comprara tela gamuza por mayor para la fabricación de adornos navideños, el Sr. Cristóbal es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, su deseo es poder ver algún día a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Mr. Cristóbal is a craftsman. He makes seasonal crafts, and is now making Christmas decorations for the end of the year. He makes and sells ties and bells wholesale. He has four children who are still dependent on him. His wife takes care of the housework. Cristobal and his whole family make crafts, and he also sells in the Alasitas market [a traditional Bolivian craft market]. He provides crafts wholesale and on order. With this loan, he will purchase suede fabric wholesale for making Christmas ornaments. Cristobal is a very kind and hard-working man. He wants to see his children become professionals one day.

loans.use: to buy suede wholesale

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama âgé de 34 est chauffeur depuis 2001 .Il est marié  et père d’un enfant.
Avec le crédit il veut acheter un demi-moteur pour sa voiture de 32 places.
Adama est responsable et gère sa famille. Il arrive à satisfaire les besoins de sa femme et de ses enfants
texts.en:
Adama is 34 years old, married and the father of a child. He has been a driver since 2001 and is requesting a loan so that he can buy a half engine for his 32-seat van.

Adama is a responsible man who takes care of his family and his income allows him to meet the needs of his wife and child.

loans.use: to buy a half engine.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is 25 years old and married, although he is not yet blessed with children. He has been active in farming for four years and currently produces maize and beans, which he sells locally. He also trades in timber for additional income.

Zablon has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the venture will earn him more income due to the ready demand for milk. He wants to make farming the source of his family's livelihood. He hopes to be a large-scale farmer in five years.

Zablon says a network of poor roads and rampant diseases are the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian Esperanza

texts.es:
Lilian es una mujer casada de 28 años, tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de edad, viven en la ciudad de Ibarra, Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. Lilian es una persona responsable en su trabajo y muy amigable.

Lilian trabaja en la crianza de pollos, negocio que le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. lilian necesita incrementar su animales (pollos) ya que por la temporada navideña hay una gran cantidad de clientes y quiere aprovechar esto para poder obtener buenos ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por eso que realiza su cuarto crédito en Fodemi para comprar pollos y criarlos.

El sueño de Lilian es tener una casa propia y en su negocio que crezca y poder distribuir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lilian, 28, is a married woman; she has a four-month-old son and lives in the city of Ibarra, Imbabura Province in northern Ecuador.  Lilian is a person who is very friendly and responsible in her work.

Lilian works raising chickens, a business that allows her to help her husband with family expenses.  Lilian needs to increase the number of her animals (chicks) because during the Christmas season the number of customers increases and she wants to avail herself of this to earn good income and improve her quality of life.  Because of this, she hopes to get her fourth Fodemi loan to buy chicks to raise.  Lilian’s dream is to have a house of her own and that her business grows so that she can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Silvina quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ya que vio en este una gran oporunidad de progreso y desarrollo, gracias al cual podrán salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.

La sra. Silvina esta casada con el Señor Jorge hace 22 años,  tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, quienes ya son independientes.  Ella comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa, gracias a la cual pudo mantener a sus hijos y darle todo para que no pasen por privaciones. Desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide la ayuda de fundacion paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, comestibles y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Nos cuenta que su meta es poder tener una tienda para vender helados.
texts.en:
The present committee was organized by Silvina, who invited her friends and made the necessary arrangements to join the Mujeres Emprendedoras program. She saw this program as an opportunity to make progress and support each other.

Silvina has been married to Jorge for 22 years. They have four adult children who are already independent. She has a small store. Thanks to it, she was able to take care of her children and give them everything they needed. She is asking for support because she wants to expand her business. With this loan, she will buy drinks, milk products, food and other essential items to stock up and meet her clients' demands. Her goal is to have an ice cream parlor.

loans.use: To buy drinks, milk products, food, among other things.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 33 years-old, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She shreds coconut meat and grinds rice into flour to sell in order to generate income for the family. Her husband is a Khmer traditional singer who sings at wedding ceremonies. Additionally, he is a motor taxi driver. In order to improve her family livelihood, Sina is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 in order to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. By doing so, she would have a new business and will generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her child to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business stock

loans.name: Miri

texts.en: Miri is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Lachin region and now lives in Beylagan. After facing many hardships, he started the business of breeding and selling cattle. In order to accomplish this, Miri borrowed $400 from the Normicro Beylagan branch. Now he wants to increase the number of cows and to build a bigger shed.

loans.use: To increase the size of his herd build a shed

loans.name: Opeta

texts.en: Opeta and her husband using fishing nets to  catch fish and other sea shells. The couple is fully committed to their business, as this is the only source of income for the family. She earns $120 per day from selling fish and other sea products to the public and people of her village. Both Opeta and her husband work together not only to making sure that the business is successful, but also to do all other family chores. Opeta is planning to buy another new fishing net, and to renovate their home once she gets her loan from SPBD.  She is a very talented and dedicated woman.

loans.use: To buy a new fishing net and fishing gear, and to renovate her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. specializes in making peanut butter and roasted peanuts. She is a forty-year-old mother of five children and a widow. She recently obtained a stall in a government-owned market in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).

Mary is the sole bread winner for her family and works hard to see that her children go to school. As Mary is dealing with a seasonal crop, she is requesting a loan of $175 to purchase ten more bags of peanuts and store them to be able to meet the demand during the period of scarcity in August and September. The loan will enable her expand her business and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase stock for the off-season

loans.name: Nedy Suyapa

texts.es:
My name is Nedy Suyapa. My main job is sales. I have my own business selling used clothing, located in my house. It allows me to take care of my family and generates income to help out with household expenses. I have been working in this business for several years, and thanks to it we are able to give an education to our children. We have also improved our income and standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Nedy Suyapa, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, ubicado en mi casa de habitación. El que me permite atender a mi famia y me genera ingresos para aportar con los gasto de mi hogar, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio y gracias a ello podemos dar educación a nuestros hijos, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida.

loans.use: To buy an inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.en:
Ysidora is 46 years old and has five children. All her children go to school in nearby El Seybo. She is married and her husband is an agricultural worker in the surrounding farms.

She plans to use her loan to build a little structure, adding on to her house for a small beauty salon. She currently runs her business out of her house, offering services such as doing hair and nails for local women. The name of her salon is “Salon Liza”, after her oldest daughter, who is 17.

Ysidora belongs to a group of four other women, who are taking out the loan collectively. The name of her women’s collective (composed of 5 loan groups) is “Esperanza y Fe” – “Hope and Faith”. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

This is Ysidora's fifth loan from Esperanza, each loan being for 5000 pesos, so she can progressively build her beauty salon adjacent to her house. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts.

NOTE: As stated above, this $750 loan will fund Ysidora's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To build a space for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: INCREASE HER INVENTORY IN HER SMALL STORE, BETTER PREPARING FOR THE HIGHER DEMAND OF THE HOLIDAY SEASON.  THIS SINGLE MOTHER WANTS TO CONTINUE GROWING HER BUSINESS SO THAT SHE CAN TAKE CARE OF HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi A. was born in 1958 in Bè. She is married and is the mother of 8 children. Her husband is jobless and somewhat elderly, so he is not able to support his family. Selling tooth picks as a street peddlar is the business activity that brings in the meager income the family lives off of.

Faced with this situation, Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of US$ 200 so that she can purchase in larger quantities and become a wholesaler of tooth picks. Being able to do this will increase her income, since it is a flourishing business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mme Ablavi A. est née en 1958 à Bè. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants, son mari est chômeur et il est un peu âgé donc il n’arrive pas à supporter toutes les charges du ménage. Le commerce de cuire dent est son activité qui lui procure le peu de revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

>Devant cette situation, elle sollicite un montant de $200 pour s’approvisionner en quantité de cuire dent et devenue grossiste. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera ses revenus car c’est un commerce très florissant.

loans.use:
Sale of tooth picks

Approvisionnement en cuir dent

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon A. is 30 years old. He is married and has four children; the oldest is ten, and the youngest is only two years old.

Abdurahmon manufactures carved wooden doors, window frames, and partitions in the national oriental style. He has been in this business for 14 years already. Abdurahmon also works 30 hectares of land, where he grows potatoes and carrots. During the planting season, his hardworking family helps him. In spite of his young age, he is recognized as a good workman in his neighborhood. Abdurahmon works hard and dreams of improving the living conditions of his family.

Today Abdurahmon is requesting a loan of 4,160 somoni ($1,200 in US dollars) to purchase wood products, such as bold timber and plank timber, for his manufacturing. He managed his previous loan without violations, and he promises to pay the current one on time.

loans.use: To purchase wood products for manufacturing carved wooden doors, window frames, and partitions

loans.name: Sodziné

texts.fr:
Sodzine Ekoué is married and the mother of three. She is 42 years old and has owned a dressmaking shop in the busy part of town for seven years. The income from this business pays for family expenses because her husband lacks a steady income. This is her second loan, now that she has promptly repaid her first. The present loan is going to enable her to acquire two extra sewing machines and to recruit apprentices in order to meet the growing customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Sodzine Ekoué est mariée, mère de trois enfants,âgée de 42ans est propriétaire d’un atelier de couture dans le quartier populaire de la ville depuis 7 ans. Le revenu de cette activité finance les charges familiales du fait que le revenu de son mari est irrégulier .Elle à son deuxième crédit après avoir payé promptement son premier crédit. Le présent crédit va lui permettre d’acquérir deux machines à coudre supplémentaires et recruter des apprenties afin de faire face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle

loans.use: To acquire two sewing machines and to bolster her dressmaking shop

loans.name: Sokor Marie

texts.en:
Sokor is 55 years old and married to 2 wives with 11 children. Sokor and the wives grow vegetables and rice for family consumption, but could experience hunger during certain periods of the year.

Sokor had a previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) that allowed him to start the expansion of his farming operations. He needs an additional loan from Kiva to continue that growth.

With his loan, Sakor hired labourers and purchased vegetable seeds and fertilizer. The family had a 50% increase in their production. Sokor repaid the loan with the profit from selling the vegetables, and purchased zinc sheets for building a family house with the profit from selling the rice. The wives are very happy and would like to expand their farm activities further. Sokor is therefore requesting for loan of Le.1,000,000.

loans.use: To expand his vegetable farm

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đào Thị Huê, 30 years old. She is a 7th year TYM member. She raises pigs and brews rice wine. Her husband, Mr Đảm, owns a retail business in animal feed so it is very favorable situation for Mrs Huê. She has a dozen of pigs, each weighing about 100 kg. Her family income is 230-250 USD a month. They are able to provide good education for their 2 children. She has never been late in her payment during 7 years. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand her business: she will buy more piglets and feed for the herd.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Huê, 30 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc của chị là chăn nuôi lợn kết hợp với nấu rượu. Anh Đảm, chồng chị, chuyên kinh doanh thức ăn gia súc, gia cầm nên công việc của chị Huê càng thêm thuận lợi. Đàn lợn hơn chục con của chị Huê con nào cũng trên dưới 1 tạ. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình 230-250USD. Kinh tế phát triển, hai con của anh chị luôn được tạo điều kiện học hành chu đáo. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia chưa bao giờ chị Huê chậm trễ trong việc hoàn trả tuần. Vòng vốn này chị Huê xin vay 1200USD để đầu tư mở rộng chăn nuôi. (mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc)

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Mrs. Bosede I. is 50 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells women's bags. She learned her trade from her sister and has been in business since 1996. She is requesting a loan of $700.00 to buy more bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's bags to sell.

loans.name: Woedi Agoe Group

texts.fr:
The WOEDI Agoè Assocation was created in 2006 in the Avédzi neighborhood of Lomé. The members of this association are involved in small business activities. The goals of the four women in the association are self-help and profit-seeking opportunities. They are married and mothers with families. They are very talented in business practice, having over ten years of small business experience. WOEDI Agoè Association is in its third loan cycle and is seeking a loan to buy 34 bolts of fabric, one bag of corn, four bags of rice, and a crate of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

L’Association WOEDI Agoè est créée en 2006 dans le quartier d’Avédzi à Lomé. Les activités des membres de cette association sont les petits commerces. Les quatre femmes de cette association ont pour objectif l’entraide mutuelle et la recherche du profit sur leurs activités. Elles sont mariées et mères de famille. Elles sont douées dans l’exercice de leur activité car ayant des expériences de plus de 10 ans dans le petit commerce. L’association WOEDI Agoè est à son 3ème cycle de près et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 34 pièces de pagne, 1 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs de riz, un carton de boîte de tomates.

loans.use: Purchase basic goods merchandise

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie S. is a 52-year-old woman who is married with six dependent children. She is requesting this loan to help with her household expenses. Thus, she plans to sell palm oil, honey and lemon juice.

She plans to repay the loan in a single payment in six months.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Marie S. est une femme de 52 ans, mariée et avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour assurer ses charges familiales. Elle projette donc de vendre de l’huile de palme, du miel et du jus de citron.

Elle compte faire le remboursement au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and reselling of palm oil, honey, and lemon juice

loans.name: Héctor José

texts.es:
Héctor is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe located in the city of Managua. He has two children with his life partner who works taking care of their home and kids. Héctor is a farmer by trade. On his land he cultivates pineapples and pitahayas (cacti bearing edible fruit), and with those crops he is able to support his family. When he was young he learned about agriculture and he hopes to be able to teach his children from his experience so that one day they can continue to run the business.

The plan that Hector has for his family is to be able to give them a better quality of life and a more decent home. For that reason he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to begin to make home improvements like reparing the roof that is currently in very bad condition.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Héctor tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 2 hijos con su compañera de vida, quien se dedica al cuido del hogar y de los hijos. Don Héctor es de oficio agricultor, en sus tierras cultiva piñas y pitahayas y son con esas cosechas como él consigue el sustento para su familia. Desde pequeño aprendió el oficio de la agricultura, y espera poder transmitir las experiencias a sus hijos para que éstos algún día sigan con este negocio. Los planes que Héctor tiene para su familia es poder darles una mejor condición de vida y una vivienda más digna, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y empezar las mejoras en su vivienda como es la reparación del techo, que se encuentra en un muy mal estado.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to repair the roof of a private home

loans.name: Mwanajuma's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, 38 years old and married with three children aged 21, 15 and 8, has run her own shop since 2003. Working everyday from 6 a.m. to 6.30 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanajuma is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanamrisho, who has a business selling fish, cassava and juice.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Mrs. Tep C. is a villager in Chan Teab Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who can make some money because she owns a small rice field. She is a 40-year-old widow and has a child who is 21-years-old and works as a laborer. Since her family is very poor, Mrs. Tep C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and resale

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: JHONY TIENE 2 HIJOS A QUIEN MANTIENE EL ES CASADO Y SU ESPOSA ESTA EN ESPAÑA, TIENE CASA PROPIA DONDE VIVE CON SUS HIJOS.........EL SE DEDICA  A LA EXTRACCION Y VENTA DE PESCADOS DE RIOS, EL CLIENTE YA LLEVA 12 AÑOS EN ESTA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, EL CLIENTE ATRAPA PESCADOS Y LOS VENDE A LOS RESTAURANES ESPECIALIZADOS EN ESTE TIPO DE ALIMENTOS................ TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE LA PESCA ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE GENERA MUY BUENOS INGRESOS, PERO TAMBIEN HAY QUE TENER MUCHO CONOCIMIENTO DE ESTA ACTIVIDAD ....................... EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA COMO CAPITAL DE OPERACION PARA LA COMPRA DE ARTICLOS DE COSMETOLOGIA YA QUE SU HIJO ESTA ABRIENDO UNA TIENDA DE ESTE TIPO DE PRODUCTOS DON JHONNY MECIONA QUE EL DINERO ES PARA SU HIJO Y SU YERNA YA QUE DESEA AYUDARLOS EN LA APERTURA DE UNA TIENDA. LOS PRECIOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS SON VARIADOS YA QUE COMPRO VARIOS TIPOS DE PRODUCTOS.................. ES SU CUARTA OPERACION Y TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO ES SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS Y SOLO TIENE CREDITO EN AGROCAPITAL.SE HACE NOTAR QUE EL SEÑOR JHONNY NO SE ENCONTRABA EN LA TIENDA POR LO QUE SE TOMO LA FOTO A LA YERNA.
texts.en:
Jhonny has 2 children whom he supports. He is married and his wife is in Spain. He owns his own home where he lives with his children. He works fishing and selling freshwater fish. This client has been in this business for 12 years, catching fish and selling them to restaurants specializing in this type of food. Fishing is a very competitive business because it generates good income, but it also requires much knowledge. The loan will be used as start-up capital in the purchase of cosmetic products as his son is opening a store to sell such products. Jhonny mentions that the money is for his son and his daughter-in-law as he wants to help them open their store. The products sell for a variety of prices as he has bought many different kinds of products. This is his fourth loan; he has a proven track record with his previous loans and he has taken loans out only with Agrocapital. Please note that because Jhonny was unavailable, it is his daughter-in-law in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to be invested in a variety of cosmetic products

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a father of three children and a responsible husband to Luzviminda. Their children are: Franklin – 28 years old, college graduate, married and presently working as a security guard in Manila. Second is Jennifer, a computer course graduate and also working and the youngest is Francisco Jr., also a college graduate and working as a computer technologist.  Through their farming business, they were able to send their children to school and luckily gained college diplomas.  

Francisco is managing a one hectare field equally divided for their tobacco and rice farming. Every harvest, he is generating an estimated amount of PHP15,000 which is not enough to use as capital for the next planting season due to the increased cost of farm inputs.  He, therefore, requests a loan of PHP11,000 to be able to buy the needed farm inputs like fertilizer, seeds, etc.  Also, if the loan would be granted to him, he would not borrow from traders who collect higher interest rates. 

Francisco and his family are living a simple life in the community.  They maintain close family ties and hope that their bond will stay forever even when their children already have their own families.  He also prays that they will always be blessed with good health and able to overcome the challenges and calamities that may happen in their business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Toeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Toeurn H. is a villager from Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a rice mill which he can hire out for an income. Aside from this business, he is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectares where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Since his field is infertile, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Kin Yoem, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family.

Mr. Toeurn H. is 59 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a farmer while another one is a pig breeder and the youngest one is a construction worker. His wife is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia vende menús en su casa, ella dedica a este trabajo por su cuenta. Es madre soltera, y su hija, junto con sus dos nietos, vive con ella, así que parte de sus ganancias están invertidas en el cuidado de su familia.

Anteriormente Claudia trabajaba fuera de casa. Durante dieciocho años estuvo vendiendo comida en el ferrocarril, y luego en un stand que tenía en Chosica. Pero hace dos años se fracturó el pié y tras esta lesión tuvo que empezar a realizar  trabajo en su casa.

A sus cincuenta y ocho años, su objetivo es mejorar el ambiente de su hogar y eso intenta hacerlo a través de los préstamos. El último quería invertirlo en una pensión para los obreros que actualmente se encuentran realizando una pista en Huarochirí, pero eso no funcionó así que todavía tiene el préstamo ahorrado.
texts.en:
Claudia sells menus in her house. She dedicates herself to this work on her own. She is a single mother, and her daughter, together with her 2 grandchildren, live with her. Accordingly, part of her earnings are spent on caring for her family. Previously, Claudia worked outside of her house. For 18 years she sold food on the railway and later in a stand that she had in Chosica. However, 2 years ago she broke her foot and because of this wound she had to learn to find work in her house. At her 58 years, her goal is to improve the environment of her home. She will try to do this through her loans. She wanted to invest her last loan in a boarding house for the workers that are currently building a road in Huarochirí, but this did not work so she still has the loan saved.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To turn her house into a restaurant

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana lleva pocos meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pero empezó a dedicarse a su negocio, la venta de cosméticos, ocho meses.
Anteriormente trabajaba de empleada en una tienda de ropa, aproximadamente durante cinco meses, pero cuando quedo en cinta de su ultima hija de dos años y medio dejó el trabajo y se quedó en casa para cuidar la niña.
Su pareja es obrero de construcción y con su ganancias la apoya en los gastos del hogar y de la niña. No obstante, a sus 22 años, Diana se dio cuenta que, para garantizar un futuro mejor a su hija, necesitaba más ingresos. Por esta razón empezó con su negocio de cosméticos, y también le pidió a su mamá que venga a vivir con ella para cuidar a la niña, así Diana puede conseguir un trabajo más estable. En estos días empezará a trabajar en la empresa Telefónica, gracias al empleo que le consiguió una amiga. 
A pesar de que conseguir un negocio propio sea más difícil que conseguir un empleo en alguna empresa, a Diana le gustaría en un futuro abrir una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Diana has had loans for just a few months with EDAPROSPO, but she began working at her business, selling comsetics, eight months ago. Before that she worked as an employee in a clothing store for about five months, but when she became pregnant with her youngest daughter, now two and a half years old, she left her job and stayed at home to care for the baby. Her partner is a construction worker and with his income he helps Diana with the expenses of the household and the child. Even so, at 22 years, Diana realized that in order to guarantee a better future for her daughter she needed more income. This was the reason she began her cosmetics business and also asked her mother to come to live with her to care for the girl, so Diana could get a more stable job. Shortly she will begin to work in the business Telefonica, thanks to a friend who got her the job. Despite the fact that starting your own business is more difficult than getting a job in some business, in the future Diana would like to open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Use it to pay a pending bill and for her stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Ana Corita

texts.en:
Ana Corita N. is 48-year-old widowed mother of four. To earn a living, she runs a sari sari shop and raises pigs.

"Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds." Sari sari shops sell an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities. The stores are usually operated out of the owner's home, are neighborhood watering holes, and sell items in small units -- single cigarettes, for example. Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.

Ana Corita only recently opened her sari sari store, after learning the tricks of the trade from her daughter-in-law. She intends to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her shop, and to buy two piglets to raise. She hopes to earn enough to be able to help support her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a small general store and to purchase two piglets.

loans.name: La Union De Los Vecinos 3 Group

texts.en:
The members of Group 3 on the "Union de los Vecinos" (The Neighbors' Union) are requesting their first loan with Esperanza International. They hope this loan will help them establish their businesses and generate better profits to improve their living conditions.  In San Pedro de Macoris, the employment opportunities are not abundant due to the sugar cane industry collapse and the town's proximity to the capital. (For some industries it's not profitable to establish operations in San Pedro de Macoris, and some people cannot commute to Santo Domingo to work every day due to transportation costs).  

Ramon C. is the group coordinator. He is an electrician and decided to start making power inverters. This generates good profits because power outages are common in the Dominican Republic. Inverters are charged with batteries (the same kind you use in cars), and allow you to run some appliances for a reasonable amount of time. He will use this loan to buy wires and generator parts that are necessary to make inverters. Right now, he works out of his home but his hope is that profits from his sales will allow him to set up his own workshop, and eventually, build a new house of his own.   

Please help support these new entrepreneurs' initiatives with a Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase electrical parts to assemble power inverters.

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie D. is 37 years old and the mother of three children: Gizelle - 17 years old, a college student; Angie - 10 years old and Eljay 8 years old, both at the elementary level.

Ammie is a vegetable vendor in their village while her husband Efren works as a tricycle operator. They are living in the simple village of San Roque Centro, Enrile, Cagayan. With their tricycle transport and vending, the couple is able to earn money for their daily expenses, allowances, and for the tuition fees of their children.

In order to improve their businesses, Ammie is requesting to borrow PHP 7,000 to maintain her vending business and for the registration fee of their tricycle. They started their small enterprises in 1998 and still dream of making their businesses grow.

Ammie will be very thankful if her request is granted for it will really help her family and the realization of their dreams in life.

loans.use: To maintain her vending business and for the registration fee of their tricycle

loans.name: Rani Maqsood Masih Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is married to M. M. and they live in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi food. Rani baji is a hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and relatives. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. Her husband is a blacksmith who buys iron and makes iron rods to sell to customers. He has been in this business for the past six years. Rani baji is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of four other women in her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Nazneen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron to make iron rods

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, C. is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children who are of school age. The house where they live is their own. She works selling fresh fish in a stall at the market. She gets up very early, at 2 am, to buy at the fish store where the fishermen bring the fish. Later she sells this in the market until 11 am. C. has a number of clients who eat her fish and continually visit her stall. She is happy with her work because each day she finishes selling all the fish she brings. She will use the loan money to grow watermelon on her own farmland and to purchase more fish to sell. The other borrowers who have joined this loan are:
Mrs. T., a grocery seller, who is looking for a loan to expand her business size.
Mr. P. who will use the loan to grow crops during the farming season.

All borrowers live in Kampong Chhnang Province.

loans.use: To grow watermelon and buy more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bulk inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old, married, and a mother with one child. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their future. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana.

Alice is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. In selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With her three years experience in her business, she wants to add other stuff like maize, eggs and others things that are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes

loans.name: Mouri

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle souhaite commencer le commerce de cartes de recharges c’est pour ça qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 50 cartons de cartes de recharges TOGOCELL, 7 cartons de cartes MOOV et 5 cartons de cartes ILLICO.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This woman began to sell groceries in 2007. She hopes to begin selling phone cards and that is the reason why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 50 cartons of phone cards for TOGOCELL, 7 cartons of cards MOOV, and 5 cartons of cards of the ILLICO brand.

She is married and the mother of one child. With the earnings from her business, she helps support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Lugedo Nakitadwe Sylvia Group

texts.en: N. Sylvia is a young businesswoman of twenty-six representing the Lugendo women's group. She is married and  blessed with two children. She has been in the clothing business so far for three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase variety of clothing to increase her stock and add capital to her business to meet her customer demand. She is an active businesslady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To expand clothing store inventory

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena V. V. is 52 years old and is married with six children.  Milena has two businesses, a vegetarian restaurant and a stand in the Bellavista market, a massive, chaotic street marketplace located near the center of the city of Pucallpa.  Milena sells spices and condiments (chili sauces, etc.) from her stand, which is named “Nutrisoya.”  Milena works together with her husband, who sells condiments wholesale, in both of her business ventures.  

Milena has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in purchasing condiments for her stand.  With this loan of 2300 soles Milena will buy a glass exhibitor window to display some of the foods she offers at her restaurant.

Milena has enjoyed working with Manuela Ramos.  In particular, she feels that she learns a lot about business from the educational sessions given by Manuela Ramos loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.  Milena’s goal is to add a soda fountain to her vegetarian restaurant.

loans.use: Glass exihibitor window to display food.

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of the Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is  44 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2  children. Her children are 22 and 17 years old.

Jane has owned a cafe business selling food for 5 years, she works  12  hours and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jane`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities to her cafe business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jane hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Elizabeth is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount  of 200,000 In order to expand her vegetable business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like rice, wheat, cooking oil  for cafe

loans.name: Alimo

texts.en: Alimo J. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking flour.  Alimo is 42 years old and is Widowed.   She has 6 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase baking flour

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe A. is 36 years old and married to Alejandro A. who is a 37-year-old rice farmer. The couple has three very young children who range in age from 1 to 11 years old. The family lives in the village of Brgy. Ayungon, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. Her fondest dream is to improve her family's standard of living, to earn enough to sustain the needs of her family and to send her children to school.

Ma Fe knows and understands so well that her husband strives hard to earn for them but it is still not enough because as a farmer he earns a seasonal type of income, rice being harvested only after 3 to 4 months of planting. That’s why Ma Fe looked for another source of income so that she could help her husband increase the household income. Using some of her husband's income from the farm as capital, she put up a small general store adjacent to their house selling basic household commodities that her neighbors needed. She just revolved the income she earned to buy new stocks to sell, until 2003 when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access more capital to expand her operations. As she paid off each loan, she was able to borrow bigger amounts effectively increasing her income capacity. It now earns a net profit of PHP 3,000 per month, which is a big help to this young household. Being a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon has also helped in their rice production as she has used some of the loans to purchase fertilizer for her husband's rice farm, also improving the yield at harvest time.

For her previous 13th cycle loan, she borrowed Php 13,000 as additional working capital for her general store and for the rice farm. She paid all her weekly installments in full and on time without any delays. Now she is borrowing for her 14th cycle, a loan of Php 15,000 to be used as additional capital for her general store and to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. The income from this loan will be saved for the education of her children and part will be used to pay for their household expenses.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store and rice farm

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 52 years old, single and has owned a local car-repair shop since 1975. He is well known in nearby villages because of his experience in this field. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy new tools. This will allow him to do a better job of serving his customers.

loans.use: to buy new tools for a car repair shop

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 4 and 10. All her children go to school. She owns a four-room house where she lives with eight people. Gertrude takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets three meals a day.

Gertrude incurs transportation costs to and from buying food from Kalerwe market. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop in Ndeeba where she works at tailoring. She buys her clothing materials from Kiyembe shops in Kampala city, using public transport to and from shopping there.

Gertrude works seven days a week, receiving an average of twenty customers a day. She sells to women only. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of clothing material and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works in a muddy place.

Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, feeding the family and medication. She has been in this business for over five years and with MCDT for ten years, now servicing her twentieth loan and working with the same group mates. Gertrude joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more bolts of cloth. She is hopeful of seeing her business grow bigger, and would like to start a tailoring school..

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S., 49, and her husband, Mr. Ra Sok, 54, were married in 1978 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, two have full-time employment, one daughter assists her mother in the business and the youngest daughter attends school. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Srey has been selling vegetables in Phnom Penh for 10 years. She does not have her own motorbike to transport vegetables to sell, so she is asking for a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike  to carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Francis Jaqueline

texts.es:
la señoa Francis Jaqueline B. A. tiene 37 años de edad es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus hermanos, se dedica al comercio vende todo tipo de productos para damas de uso personal, su negocio lo tiene en la calle del comercio en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle.
 
Francis tambien vende cds, fajas, gorras, juguetes, perfumes, desodorantes.
 
esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio.
Su deseo en esta epoca es que dios derrame bendiciones a todos los hogares del mundo.
texts.en:
Señora Francis Jaqueline B. A. is 37 years old, single and without children. She lives with her brothers. She sells all types of women’s personal use products. Her business is located on the street of commerce in the city of San Lorenzo Valle.
Francis also sells CDs, belts, caps, toys, perfumes and deodorants. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise. Her wish for this season is that God blesses all the households in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Araceli Del Carmen

texts.es: Araceli Del Carmen tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y están a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra-venta de cosméticos, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como y sus clientes las requieren, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas, con artículos de cosméticos como: delineadores, pinturas labiales y de uñas, polvo, brillos, tintes, cremas, perfumería entre otros. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Araceli Del Carmen, 38, has two children under her care. She is a cosmetics merchant. Since the beginning, she has been acquiring regular customers that have produced income for her to be able to meet household expenses for her children, who appreciate their mother's efforts. Today, she calls upon this organization to request financing that will allow her to buy certain items that her customers require: eyeliner, lipstick, nail polish, powder, eye shadow, hair dyes, creams, perfumes, etc. She wants to increase her sales so that she can reach her ultimate goal, which is to do some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Kayanja Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Catherine N. is a hardworking lady. She is married with three children, ages 7, 3 and 8 months, and she also takes care of other dependents. She is a tailor in the Kayanja trading center. She is able to make about 100,000 Ugandan shillings as profits every week from this business, which she has been doing for three years. 

Catherine is happy with her business. Although it is in a village setting, there is not too much competition and even if there were, she is so good at what she does. She gets orders from clients to make them clothes according to their demands and fashions and she is time conscious. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials, like the traditional wear, from which her customers can choose.

loans.use: Buying more clothing materials

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon S. is 29 years old and she lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare field for cultivating rice. In order to support the field crop, Mrs. Mon S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen.

Her husband, Mr. Sarvuth Orn is a duck breeder who can earn a small income by selling duck eggs to support his family's living. Mrs. Mon S. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a student at the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Elita

texts.es:
Elita, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Percy (39), quien es carpintero, y con sus 3 hijos; Lizeth (17), Johanna (13) y Carol (8).
Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos comestibles y bebidas en la tienda que habilitó en su vivienda. Atiende todos los días de la semana, a veces con la ayuda de sus hijas, y las ganancias que obtiene en este negocio son buenas, es por esta razón que puede ayudar a su esposo con el pago de la educación de sus hijas. Paralelamente, también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y conejos de raza, los cuales comercializa en los mercados de la zona donde vive. Este negocio también es rentable, porque el cuidado de estos animales no requiere de mucho sacrificio y su alimentación no es costosa. Para el futuro, quiere ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, así como comprar mayor cantidad de animales y mejorar las jaulas de éstos, porque ya están quedando pequeñas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir trabajando con esta entidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su tienda; también adquirirá más animales.
texts.en:
Elita is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Percy (39) who is a carpenter, and their three children, Lizeth (17), Johana (13), and Carol (8). She has been selling various foods and drinks from her home-based store for the past nine years. She works seven days a week with the help of her daughters. She receives a good income from her business, so she is able to help her husband pay for their daughter’s education. She also raises Guinea pigs and rabbits, which she sells in the local marketplace. This business is also profitable because caring for these animals is not difficult and their food is not expensive. In the future she would like to expand her business and buy more animals and expand their cages because they are already too small. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is sure that she will be able to make her payments on schedule, as she would like to continue to work with this group. She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise for her store and more animals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and animals

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda S. is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Nasipit Cabangahan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by helping her husband in fishing and fish vending.

Hilda’s 50-year-old husband, Roland, is a fisherman.  They have 7 children, 3 of whom are currently going to school and helping their parents in the business as part of their daily chores while the other 4 children are already adults.

Hilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fishing and fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 25,000 from her business activities.

Hilda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund operations for her fishing and fish vending ventures which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 6th loan in the amount of Php 15,000, which she again intends to use on their fishing and fish vending business. Hilda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ana Inguane

texts.pt:
Ana Inguane T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 50 anos de idade casada e sem filhos, apenas 4 sobrinhos de 15, 13, 09 e 07 anos de idade e todos vão a escola. Não estudou porque os pais não permitiram a ela e suas irmãs a ir a escola alegando que iria aprender a prostituição. Vive na casa própria com o marido e seus sobrinhos, para alem destes naõ sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da Matola para o Distrito de Boane ainda muito nova, depois do casamento continuou a viver neste Distrito. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 6 anos, possui um empregado que lhe auxilia no seu negocio. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua casa, porque não conhece melhor o sistema bancário.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA e não continuou devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas do negócio que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 22.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, vinho, refrescos, batata e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Tem um sonho de um dia poder ter uma residência condigna, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais créditos para aplicar ainda no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ana InguaneT. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is 50 years old, married and childless though she has 4 nephews and nieces 15,13, 9 and 7 years old. They are all in school. She never studied, since her parents didn't allow her or her sisters to go to school saying she would learn prostitution. She lives in her own house with her husband, nephews and nieces. Apart from these, she has no other dependents. She left Matola for the district of Boane when she was still very young. She continued to live there after she was married. She has had her own shop for more than 6 years, and has an employee to help her with the business. She earns around 6500 MZN a month, and uses it to cover her household expenses while saving some at home, since she's unfamiliar with the banking system. In the past she took out loans through the TCHUMA credit union but didn't continue for various reasons. She learned about Hluvuku through business partners who are already clients. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, for 22,000 MZN. She plans to buy products (beer, wine, soft drinks, potatoes and others) to increase her stock. She dreams of one day owning a suitable home, and in the future would like to take out additional loans for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of stock (beer, wine, soft drinks, potatoes and others)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz M. is from the village of Upper Lawon, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Beatriz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her child's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 37 years old and single with one child who goes to school.  She sells charcoal and also practices dairy farming to earn a living.  She has been in these businesses for six years and has one employee. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of her family's income.  She has been saving her money with her group in Faulu Kenya called Ikinu Clean Shine which guarantees loans to its members.  

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy animal feeds and to add to her stock of charcoal.  This loan will allow her to grow her businesses further so that her child can fulfill dreams of achieving a college degree and finding a good job.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and add to her stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en: Over the years, Maximina R. has provided for her family with her sewing business and her sari-sari (variety) store for more than five years. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of the family's income. Now that Maximina has access to working capital, her profits are better than before. Maximina is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for the much larger amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new sewing machine and support the inventories of her store. This will allow her to grow their businesses further so that their children can fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and finding good jobs. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her activities will generate a steady income to improve her financial stability and give a better life to her family in a decent manner. Maximina’s biggest dream is to have a successful tailoring business and to manage a full-fledged mini-grocery store someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of her two businesses is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family from under the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and inventory for her store.
