loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is from the village of Luna, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Imelda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish, fresh eggs, and cooking oil at the public market. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alexandra Estefania

texts.es:
Alexandra de 22 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) es estudiante universitaria y tiene un puesto de venta de arroz. 

Para ayudar a su familia ella invirtió sus ahorros en arroz y empezó a vender a sus conocidos poco a poco su negocio fue incrementándose. En la actualidad ella continua con el negocio de arroz y ha implementado vender huevos, granos etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm el resto de tiempo lo utiliza para la universidad. 

Para poder continuar con el negocio necesita comprar mas arroz y productos para su negocio el préstamo lo quiere utilizar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere surtir y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexandra is twenty-two years and old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a suburban area that used to have hills, streams, and lagoons you can still see the remains of--like an ecological area that is disintegrating). She is a university student and has a stand where she sells rice. To help her family she invested her savings in rice and started selling to people she knew. Bit-by-bit her business started to grow. Today, she still sells rice but has also added eggs, grains, etc. She works from eight a.m. until six o'clock. The rest of the time she uses for the university. To be able to continue with her business she needs to buy more rice and products with the loan. She would like to stock and grow her business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements: the purchase of Zinc sheet metal and additional family expenses

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan R. is currently in the business of selling fried sweet potatoes, cassava, bread and groundnut phase (peanut paste) in nearby Jebel Kujur primary school and is requesting a loan to stock more fresh cassava and sweet potatoes to fry and sell.

Susan is 40 years old and is married to a receptionist. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more fresh cassava and sweet potatoes to fry and sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn P. is from the town of Trento. She is 37 years old. Evelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is a 36-year-old man who wants a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, soda and other merchandise to resell in his retail shop. Before starting the retail shop business, he had been into agriculture. He used the proceeds from two seasons to start his retail shop which he has run for the last seven years.

Wilberforce is the father of six children and lives with his family in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of having a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, soap, soda and other merchadise for his shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose S. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, and rice at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal, dried fish and onions to sell.  Rose is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock bags of charcoal, dried fish and onions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is from the village of Purok de Oro, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Mary is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Mary owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies, especially steamed cake, in the local community. Mary has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Yeni Mercedes

texts.es: Yeni Mercedes tiene 35 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de lácteos y comercio de cerdos. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio lo inicio con su esposo con dinero que tenían ahorrado ella con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante pues tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, ellos asisten a una escuela por su Mama que se preocupa por proporcionarles todo los más necesario. Ella sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y proporcionar un buen servicio. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos y leche, cremas, queso y cuajada.
texts.en: Yeni Mercedes is 35, and she buys and sells dairy products and pigs.  She has had this business that she started with her husband for more than 14 years with money that they had saved.  She has sacrificed much to get ahead since she has two young children to care for.  They go to a school that their mother takes great pains in supplying everything that they need.  She dreams of improving their standard of living and to give them a better life.  This loan will be used to buy pigs, milk, cream, cheese and cuajada (a type of cheese).

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca K. is forty-three years old and married. Her husband is a lecturer at Egerton University, and they have five children aged between twenty-four and seven years old. She has a barber shop which is located in a busy residential area in Nairobi. She also provides hair salon services to ladies in the same shop. She describes herself as ambitious.

Rebecca has been in business for a year now, and she says that this business is profitable but that the major challenge she has is a lack of enough capital. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy blow driers to service her increasing volume of women customers. She hopes to have many business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy blow driers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old. Gemma is married and has an 18-year-old child. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Gemma wants to improve her family's living conditions.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She hopes that someday she will have her own money for business capital.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rokaya

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old and a married woman who has two children.

In 2009 Rokaya decided to start her own business so she opened a grocery store. She has a good reputation in the area where she lives.

She applied for a US$ 2400 loan to renovate her shop. This will help her to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Renovating her shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of three school-aged children.  Over the years, he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his printing and photocopy shop. He has owned and run this shop for more than thirty years. With his loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will perform maintenance for the photocopy machine. These modifications will allow him to significantly increase his productivity and also his income. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to further expand his business. He is hoping to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: perform maintenance on his photocopy machine

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 26 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Aurelio y de sus 2 hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Hace más de 2 años, esta empeñosa mujer instaló en su casa un pequeño restaurante, donde ofrece diversos menús (platillos preparados a diario), gaseosas y cervezas. Aunque atiende con la ayuda ocasional de sus hijos, dice que esta muy satisfecha pues el tiempo le ha permitido adquirir buenos clientes que le compran a diario. Así transcurren los días de Lourdes, quien se despierta cada mañana con muchas ganas de empezar a cocinar, para ofrecerles lo mejor a sus comensales los cuales la prefieren pues sus platillos son muy deliciosos, además los precios son muy accesibles. Y ya tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar el negocio y surtirlo con mayor cantidad de productos comestibles y gaseosas, pues anhela instalar una cadena de restaurantes en diferentes zonas. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lourdes tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, que necesita para continuar preparando sus exquisitos platillos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 26 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband Aurelio and her 2 dependent children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.  More than 2 years ago, this determined woman set up a small restaurant in her home where she offers different food (dishes prepared daily), soda and beer.  Although she serves in her business with the occasional help of her children, she says that she is very satisfied because over time she has attracted good customers who buy from her every day.  Lourdes gets up early every morning with a great desire to start cooking so that she can offer the best to her diners who prefer her restaurant because her dishes are delicious and her prices are very affordable.

In the future, Lourdes is planning to expand her business and stock it with more food and drink as she would like to set up a chain of restaurants in different districts.  This is her first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to let down those people who have made the support possible as it will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Lourdes is planning to use her loan to buy ingredients wholesale so that she can continue preparing her delicious meals.  In this way she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy products so that she continue to prepare her meals

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla N. is 53 years old. She is single and has four children aged between twenty one years old and nine years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is known as the sugar belt region. She sells cereals, which include ground nuts, peas, rice, wheat and others. She has been in this business for 20 years now and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 10,000  KES to buy more cereals to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In future, she hopes to open a retail shop and also purchase land. She describes herself as visionary, determined, loving and caring.

loans.use: Maize and Wheat

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie I. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years old and married. She has 4 children aged 16, 14, 13 and 5. Lenie owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lenie works hard to sustain her family's needs, especially her children's education. She hopes for a bright future for them.

Lenie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Luz Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 72 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su negocio, ella tiene un pequeña negocio de venta de comida y postres, ella ofrece ricos platos de comida como por ejemplo seco de cordero, arroz con pollo, saltadito, ají de gallina, estofado y muchos más. Andrea requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo, aceite, arroz, fideos, carne, papas, verduras y muchas cosas más.   

Andrea pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andrea is 72 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is married and has two children. After doing the household tasks, she works and has a small food and pastry sales business where she sells delicious dishes like lamb stew, stir fry, ají de gallina (a Peruvian dish made of chicken in a spicy cheese sauce), stew, and many others. Andrea needs the loan to purchase food items like oil, rice, pasta, meat, potatoes, vegetables, and many other things.

Andrea belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead.

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. They are located in Kaoh Reah Kraom village, in Kandal province.

Mrs. Sot S. was born 1981. She is a married woman and she is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She is a vegetable seller who is able to earn a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sun Virith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice and papayas for a living. In order to support her husband's farming, Mrs. Sot S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice and papayas.

This couple has three children two are attending the local school. Their youngest child is 4 years old.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for supporting her husband's agriculture business of growing rice and papayas.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres  hijos.  Rosa no pudo estudiar, es analfabeta. 
Desde hace doce años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que utilizó en la compra de lana para realizar bordados.

Actualmente se dedica a la crianza de truchas, hoy en día tiene seis jaulas donde contiene 30 mil unidades de trucha, cada seis a siete meses están listas para poder venderlas y lo realiza en su comunidad debido a que tiene clientes fijos que vienen desde desaguadero.  En esta actividad participa toda la familia.
Con éste nuevo crédito de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, podrá comprar unos seis  a siete  sacos de comida de trucha. 
Su sueño es incrementar más truchas y jaulas, para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank located in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito-Juli, in the department of Puno.  She is 43 years old, married and has three children.  Rosa was unable to go to school and is illiterate.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years.  She used her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN to buy thread for her embroidery work.

Now she has a trout farm with six cages and some 30,000 trout.  Every six or seven months they are ready to be sold.  She has a fixed customer base in the community.  The entire family works in this business.

With the new loan in the amount of 1500 PEN, she plans to buy seven sacks of trout feed.  Her dream is to expand production with more cages and trout in order to improve income.  She likes the punctuality of the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of trout feed

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Lourdes is married and has 4 young children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products, including fish like sardines & milk fish, in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, such as mackerel & salmon. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell, like mackerel & salmon.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  wood crafts, food vending and buying and selling dried fish.  She lives in the island of Cebu, Philippines. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Anita is borrowing PHP 18,000 to purchase dried fish and materials for her wood craft business. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and materials for her wood craft business

loans.name: Lorena Angélica

texts.es: Lorena Angélica M. R. de 39 años de edad vive en su casa con su esposo  y sus dos hijos. Tiene una tienda en su casa de habitación ubicada en el Municipio de Sonsonate Departamento del mismo nombre. En su tienda ofrece  variedad de productos tales como: aceite, papel, canela, pan dulce, golosinas,  etc. Su sueño es contar con los recursos necesarios para invertir en su pequeña tiendita para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias al carisma de Doña Lorena ha logrado tener muchos clientes que siempre están buscando sus productos ya que ella siempre está pendiente de tener lo más necesario y atender de la mejor manera a sus clientes. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para comprar variedad de productos tales como: azúcar, sal, café, variedad de golosinas, detergente, gas propano, entre otros. De Esta manera podría satisfacer mejor la demanda de sus clientes quienes la aprecian mucho por tener siempre los productos que demandan y sobre todo amabilidad a la hora de realizar su trabajo. De esta forma podría seguir ayudando a sus hijos a superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorena Angélica M. R. is 39 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and two children.  She has a store in her home which is located in the town of Sonsonate, in the department of the same name.  In her store, she offers a variety of products such as oil, paper, cinnamon, sweet bread, candies, etc.  Her dream is to have the necessary financial resources to invest in her small store so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers and aspire to a better quality of life.

Thanks to her charisma, Lorena has many customers who are always looking to buy her products since she always makes sure that she has the right products available and serves her customers well.  She decided to request a loan so that she could buy a variety of products such as sugar, salt, coffee, a variety of candies, detergent, propane gas etc.  This will enable her to better satisfy her customer demand.  Her customers are very fond of her because she always has the products that they request and, above all, because she is very kind.  In this way, Lorena will be able to continue helping her children to get improve themselves and their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, coffee, candies, detergent, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Mr. Zoljargal is 30 years old Geologist. He lives with his wife and only son Munkhjin 6, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Zoljargal works in an "Asian elephant" company as a geologist. His family own a plot of land and a small family house. Zoljargal,s job has a seasonal character and he works as a geologist from April till end of November and in his of season time, he carries people as a taxi using his family car earning some extra money. The house in which he lives is quite old and needs some renovation: completely replacing the floor, putting insulation to the walls and roof and doing interior decoration. By doing this he can save on heating cost and in same time reducing emission of poisonous gases to the air. The recent survey show that Ulaanbaatar city's air quality is in dangerous level, especially in winter time, few times exceeding the normal level. The loan Mr.Zoljargal is requesting will be used to buy insulation materials, laminated floor and other necessary building materials to make the house warmer and well insulated from the cold.

loans.use: To buy insulation materials, laminated floor and other necessary building materials to make the house warmer and well insulated from the cold.

loans.name: Amparo Filomena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amparo, tiene 45 años de edad, hace varios años atrás su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvo seis hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive con un nieto que tiene 2 años y que es como su hijo porque lo crio desde pequeño.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00  hasta las 13h00, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o cuando necesite. Lleva siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que le gusta lo que hace ya que así se olvida un poco de su soledad y además se gana el sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  siete años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito que recibió de la institución pudo empezar en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un almacén donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres de Lucha (Hard-working Women) meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Señora Amparo. She is 45 years old. Her husband died some years ago, but from this relationship she has six children, all of whom are adults and independent. A grandson who is 2 years old lives with her, and he is like her son, since she raised him since he was small.

 She sells clothing of all types. She sells door to door and also sells in her house, where her customers come. She tells us that she also works from orders that are placed in advance. She works every day from 9 am until 1 pm. She leaves products on credit and collects payments every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise every two weeks or when she needs it. She has been in this business for seven years, and it has gone very well for her. She tells us that she likes what she does since in this way she can forget her loneliness for a little while and furthermore, she earns her daily living.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, sport shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for seven years, and she likes it because thanks to the first loan that she received from the institution, she was able to begin her business.

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mayé

texts.fr: Née en 1967, Mayé est mariée à Anatole un comptable. Le couple a trois enfants à charge tous scolarisés. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Mayé contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Mayé vit ensemble avec son  mari et ses enfants. Mayé vend en effet depuis près de vingt cinq ans divers articles (sucre,lait, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile végétale, etc.) au Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Mayé  vend du maïs. C’est au Bénin que Mayé s’approvisionne. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Mayé sollicite pour une quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967, Mayé is married to Anatole, an accountant. The couple supports three children, all in school. Thanks to the income from her business, Mayé contributes to the various family expenses. Mayé lives together with her husband and their children.

For almost five years, Mayé has been selling various items (sugar, milk, canned goods, pasta, soap, vegetable oil, etc.) in Benin. At the same time, Mayé sells corn. In order to better satisfy her clientele and to improve her standard of living, Mayé is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy corn and various products (sugar, milk, canned goods, pasta, soap, vegetable oil, etc).

loans.name: Tres Esquinas Group

texts.es:
La Señora Mara, tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada tiene una hija pequeña D. 02 años D. edad, socia D. la Alcancía Comunal  Tres Esquinas, la socia se dedica a la decoración D. locales en  eventos con  telas, su trabajo es muy reconocido en la zona D. Huancayo, ya que todas las mañanas organiza con su esposo para decorar los locales D. eventos, ella tiene una habilidad  un arte para decorar  para cualquier eventos como matrimonios, bautizos, agasajos, cúmplenos y otros, su esposo se queda admirado del  gran talento que realiza, el negocio va creciendo, Ellos se proyectan para  la compra D. su casa propia. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra D. telas. La socia está ubicada en la primera D. la segunda fila lado izquierdo con chompa color celeste casaca D. cuero color negro. El joven Elvis Jhon quien falto por motivo D. trabajo está en parte superior D. la fotografía.   
El Préstamo es Socia Mara quien Solicito s/. 700.00 Nuevos Soles
texts.en:
Mara is 34 years old, married, and she has a little girl who is 2 years old. She is a member of the communal bank "Tres Esquinas", meaning "Three Corners". She decorates venues for special events with fabrics. Her work is highly recognized in the region of Huancayo. Every morning she organizes herself with her husband to decorate venues for special events. She has an artistic ability to decorate for any special occasion, such as weddings, baptisms, parties, birthdays, and others. Her husband is astonished at her great talent and the business continues to grow. She is the first person on the second row to the left, wearing a blue sweater and a black leather jacket. Elvis Jhon was absent for work reasons and he can be seen in the top portion of the photograph. 

The loan is in the amount of S/. 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: decoration of venues for special events with the use of fabrics.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 31 years old, and her husband, Sothy, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still too young for school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samet and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, they also produce rice wine and raise pigs at home. Samet is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. 

Photo: Samet and her husband.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Gbedokpo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO 1 est composé de onze personnes qui habitent la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Grâce est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Grâce est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin.  Grâce est mariée à un certain Ibrahim. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Grâce mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente des produits divers et des fournitures scolaires. Grâce s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Grâce sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO 1,  un premier crédit.
texts.en: The GBEDOKPO 1 group consists of 11 people who live in the same house.  This is the first time that this group has asked for financial aid from ALIDE, in order to increase their level of business.  The representative of the group is named Grace and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Grace is 44 years old and lives in Benin.  Grace is married to Ibrahim.  The couple have three children, all in school, two of which are theirs.  The children live together with their parents.  To support herself and her children, Grace has been in business for the past 10 years selling various products and school supplies.  Grace stocks up at one of the largest markets in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Grace is asking for, together with the other members of GBEDOKPO 1, a first loan.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and other products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gloria has been in this business for 15 years. Gloria earns more income from fishing and raising pigs.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley, 43, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, and mother to their two children. The older is in high school while the younger is in elementary.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Shirley sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands, like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Aside from the direct-selling business, Shirley also earns income by selling frozen meat products and mineral water. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers and additional frozen meat and mineral water products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Shirley dreams of being able to give her family a better life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for personal merchandise, meat product items and mineral water she needs in her business

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min is a 46-year-old widow with three children who lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a domestic laborer to plow the rest of her farmland so she can plant crops.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old, married to a carpenter and lives in Isabela. She has three children. 

For two years, Evelyn has owned a sari-sari store (mini store) located in front of their house. Evelyn believes that she needs to work hard and well and be patient in all aspects of life.

She is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, spices and noodles for her mini store. She hopes that her store expands so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, drinks, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is 22 years old and lives with her parents in Gaza. In 2011, Ahlam noticed that there are no clothing stores in the area that she lives in so she decided to open one of her own. 

She now hopes that through this loan she would be able to buy new clothes, stands, and furniture for the store. She hopes that by doing so, she will have more customers coming in, and her income will increase at the same time.

loans.use: buy new clothes, stands, and furniture for the store

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren is 34 years old and lives with her 5 children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her children go to the high school and kindergarten. Her husband works at the local construction company.

She started her business in 2009 by selling meat at the local market. In the beginning, her turnover capital was equal to 200,000 MNT. Currently her turnover capital reached 600,000 MNT. She has been doing this business consistently. With her business profits, she bought a washing machine and refrigerator for her home. She is a hardworking and energetic woman who says, "I want to give the best knowledge and education to my children. At the least this is all I can do for them, so that my children can contribute to the development of our country."

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 56 years old and married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with six children. She has a retail store based in her home, and she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell. She has been running her business for 14 years, and she is thankful because her income has been increasing.

Her family is her motivation for improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she requested.

loans.use: to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Rostiko

texts.en: Rostiko is a forty-year-old married man with eight children, living in Masindi, Uganda. Having started as a farmer 10 years back, he decided to venture into produce buying.  Rostiko buys and sells 50 bags of maize in a month. He dreams of buying more land and constructing commercial houses as an investment for his children, to increase the family income. He also desires to own a maize mill and to acquire another store in order to increase his output. Rostiko intends to use the loan he has requested to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida tiene ya mas de siete años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva a fuera de su vivienda. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de invierno que es (suéteres, chamarras, conjuntos deportivos, abrigos y zapatos para damas  y caballeros) ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de mercancía. 
Desea mejorar los ingresos de su familia y poder darles el estudio necesario para su para le futuro de su hijo quien esta bajo su responsabilidad. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Adelaida has been selling new and used clothing from her home for more than seven years.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy winter clothing (sweaters, jackets, sportswear, coats and shoes for women and men, as already her clients are asking for this type of merchandise.

She wants to increase her family income, and to be able to provide the necessary education of her children in order to secure the future of her child, which is her responsibility.

With a part of the profit that she obtains from her business she plans to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena de 44 años. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a una pulpería, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora a sus clientes les gusta conversar con ella pues además siempre brinda buenos consejos. Maria es una mujer feliz, con fondos propios se esforzó por tener su propio negocio que le generara ganancias para su hogar. En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pastas, huevos, papel higiénico, jabón y sopas especialmente quiere surtirse muy bien.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 44. She has had a small general store for six years. She is a very enterprising woman, and her customers like to talk with her, as she always offers them good advice. María is a happy woman. With her own funds, she made the effort to start her own business, in order to generate earnings for her household. 

At this time, she is applying for the loan to buy candy, soft drinks, pasta, eggs, toilet paper, soap, and soups, as she especially wants her store to be well-stocked.

loans.use: To buy candy, soft drinks, pasta, eggs, toilet paper, soap and soups.

loans.name: Sangay

texts.en: Sangay is 32 years old and lives in Barnersville.  She is single and has a 3 year-old child at home and in school.  For the past three years, she has been running a provision shop in her community.   She makes more profits and has more customers since she is the only one who sells tissue, quality soap, oil, and etc.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more tissue, soap , oil, and others items for her business.  Her plan is to develop her shop into a store.

loans.use: to purchase more tissue, soap , oil, and other items for her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina a sus 50 años de edad, es una emprendedora, quien desea iniciar un negocio de producción y venta de arepas, el cual le comprará a una amiga. La señora Luz Marina años atrás trabajó con su familia en un negocio de arepas, por lo cual cuenta con experiencia en este oficio. La señora Luz Marina desea comprar el montaje de la fábrica de arepas compuesto por dos asadores, un fogón de gas, dos ollas grandes, un molino, y una moto para los domicilios. Con lo anterior la señora Luz Marina mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luz Marina, 50, is an entrepreneur who wants to start her own business making arepas [a flat, round, unleavened patty made of cornmeal or flour which can be grilled, baked, boiled, or fried] to sell; she will buy it from a friend.  Years ago Luz Marina worked with her family in an arepa business so she has experience in this line of work. Luz Marina wants to buy the essentials needed to set up an arepa factory which consists of two grills, a gas stove, two large pots, a mill and a motorcycle for home deliveries.  With this Luz Marina will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to set up an arepa sales business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El socio Sr. Jose Antonio; el socio desea invertir el credito en esta ocasión en su salud, el socio viajara a las ciudades de Arequipa y Lima para hacerse un chequeo genral ya que estos meses su salud a decaido un poco y requiere revisión mas minusiosa. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en esta ocasión en su salud y sus pasajes junto a su esposa.
texts.en: Jose Antonio would like to invest the money from this loan in his health.  He will travel to Arequipa and Lima to get himself a general checkup, since his health has deteriorated slightly these past months and he needs more detailed care.  He is asking for this loan to pay for his and his wife’s travel.

loans.use: to travel to obtain medical care.

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en: Sophany, 45, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a teacher. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Sophany is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a new business selling groceries at home, renew her house, and support her children in their studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Ayomassè

texts.fr: Ayomassè est âgée de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayomassè n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Ayomassè est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Nestor. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leur mère. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Ayomassè vend depuis huit ans des charbons de bois et divers produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, et cassoulet). Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Ayomassè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Ayomassè sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Ayomassè ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Ayomassè is 45 years old and lives in Bénin. Ayomassè never went to school. Ayomassè is married to a driver by the name of Nestor. The couple has four dependent children of whom some go to school. The children live together with their mother. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together.

To contribute to the diverse needs of her family, Ayomassè has been selling charcoal and a variety of food products (corn, beans and cassoulet) for eight years. Thanks to the income that this business generates for her, Ayomassè contributes to the different family expenses.

To satisfy the needs of her increasingly growing clientèle, Ayomassè is requesting for the third time a loan from ALIDé. The two credits previously received by Ayomassè were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, cassoulet and corn.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, y además empleada del estado. Tiene conjuntamente con su marido un puesto de ventas de comidas y bebidas. En el cual trabajan juntos.
Tiene ventas de comidas rápidas como ser lomitos, hamburguesas, panchos y choripan desde hace 15 años. El puesto de comidas está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad, lo que les ayuda a tener una buena clientela.
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para su negocio, como ser carnes, huevos, condimentos, aderezos y demás. Agradece también por la oportunidad de crédito y los  buenos servicios que le brinda la institución para el crecimiento de su microempresa.
texts.en:
Brigida is from the city of Pilar, is a merchant and is also a state employee. Together with her husband, she has a point of sales of foods and drinks in which they work together.
She has had the sales of fast foods like sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs and sausages for 15 years. The food stall is located in a strategic zone of the city, which helps them to have good clientele.
She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, like meat, eggs, condiments, seasonings and more. She appreciates the opportunity for the loan and the good services that the institution provides her for the growth of  her small business.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, condiments, seasonings and more.

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en: Seeing the succes of the Sambi Ternak, the group received a higher loan from MUK. Their prior loan was 10M IDR. Now the group received 14M IDR. Most members received 1.5M IDR and two of them received 1M IDR. Luh, as the head, was replaced by Ketut because she moved to another city in east Bali following her husband who works there. Ketut used her loan to purchase four local pigs for pigroll. She hopes the business will run smoothly like last period and she can earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase four local piglets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 53 years old and is married to Cruzaldo, a father who is engaged in a rice farming business. They work hard to raise their four children. Cecilia is busy managing their hog-raising business. She has been in this business for six years. Right now, Cecilia is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 17,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins to sustain the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins

loans.name: Yemin Orfilia

texts.en:
I have had my business for several years, in which I sell used shoes, women's accessories, underwear, lotions and other items. With my earnings, I help my children in their studies and my own. I need to stock my inventory in order to better my sales and to help with the family expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase shoes for women and children, lotions, accessories.

Tengo mi negocio desde hace algunos años, en el que vendo zapatos usados, accesorios para dama, ropa interior, lociones y otros. Con las ganancias de mi negocio he ayudado a mis hijos en sus estudios y los mios propios. Necesito abastecer mi inventario para poder obtener mejores ganancias y ayudar con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de zapatos para niño y dama, lociones y accesorios.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Faafouina

texts.en: Faafouina runs a taro plantation and a fruit farm. She is 39 years old and has six children.  Her husband earns wages of less than USD 3 a day and supplements this with some fishing, but this was never enough to support their large family. So Faafouina joined SPBD in order to find a way of lifting their family out of poverty. When she joined the program, the SPBD staff and the women in her center spent a lot of time with her, teaching her how to run a business and how to handle cash and count money. Now she is able to handle her business alone and is a whiz at counting money. She is still aiming to grow her business and keep improving her family, and so she is applying for an additional loan to purchase fertilizers that can improve her crop yield. Two of Faafouina’s children have graduated from school and have jobs in government offices. She is very proud of their accomplishments and hopes that with hard work she can provide a bright future for her younger children, too.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her taro and fruit farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Hola mi nombre es Elizabeth, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas y pan de levadura, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromiso, gracias a los ingresos que persibo de este negocio mis hijos pueden estudiar y a la vez colaborarme en su tiempo libre.

Hi, my name is Elizabeth, my main activity is a business in my house selling sweets and bread. I have many years of experience in this line of work which has allowed me to contribute to my family’s expenses and other dues. Thanks to the income generated from this business my children can study and I can be there for them. .

loans.use: Compra de manteca, azucar, huevos,azucar, leche, canela y vainilla// Purchase of  lard, sugar, eggs, milk, cinnamon and vanilla

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefina lives in the area of Linares in Nuevo León. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a laborer. To improve her family's lives, Maria started her business 19 years ago, after she had undergone various costly treatments to be able to have children. She decided to sell groceries because one of her sisters-in-law was in contact with suppliers and provided Maria with a loan to start. Now she continues her business and fortunately, she has developed it with her hard work and dedication.

To continue growing her business, Maria needs a loan of $375, which she will use to buy more merchandise to stock up her business and thus, offer good service to her customers. She promies to repay this loan in 4 months. Be an important part of this business and in the lives of this family, who sincerely thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Josefina vive en la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León, está casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo es obrero y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia desde hace 19 años Maria inició su negocio, en aquel momento pasaban por costosos tratamientos para poder tener hijos, se decidió por la venta de abarrotes porque uno de sus cuñados tenía contacto con los proveedores que después le otorgaron crédito a Maria, ahora ella continúa con su negocio y afortunadamente lo ha hecho crecer con mucho trabajo y dedicación.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, que agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: Mr. Ing C. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support his family, Mr. Ing C. works near a market as a motor-taxi driver and can usually earn around US$4 a day in revenue. His wife stays at home cooking food and looking after her four school-aged children. His other two children work -  one at a garment factory, and the other - as a motor-taxi driver like his father. Mr. Ing C. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a new motorcycle for his son to operate as a motor-taxi, thereby providing additional income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to operate as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dovi A., 24, is married and mother of three children. She lives with her family in the village of Atséti where she makes palm oil. When plenty of palm nuts are available, she buys them up and produces palm oil which she then keeps to sell when it is in short supply. Unfortunately, the income from this business is not nearly enough to supply the basic needs of her family. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 so that she can purchase a sufficient quantity of palm nuts. This will allow her to make a greater profit so that she can better support herself and her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dovi A. de 24 ans d’âge est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle réside avec sa famille dans le village d’Atséti où elle exerce son activité de production d’huile de palme. En temps d’abondance, elle achète les noix de palme avec lesquelles elle produit de l’huile qu’elle stocke pour revendre en période de pénurie. Cependant, le revenu tiré de cette activité reste insuffisant et elle est très loin de satisfaire ses besoins les plus élémentaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de $300 afin d’acheter en quantité suffisante des noix. Ceci lui permettra de dégager une marge importante de revenu pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat en quantité de noix de palme et vente

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en: Zohrab H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 48 years old, married and has three children. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He needs a loan in amount of $600 so that he can repair his car.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Maria Dolorosa José

texts.pt:
Maria Dolorosa José S., bearer of ID number 110082821Z, is married and the mother of 5 children. She joined the program on November 11, 2006, with an initial loan of 5000 MT, and is now on her 3rd loan. She is requesting 8000 MT, to be repaid in 6 months. Maria has a beauty salon in the Compone market, and she intends to use this loan toward purchasing beauty products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Dolorosa José S., portador do BI nº 110082821Z , casada com 5 filhos entrou no programa a 17/11/06 tomou o valor de 5000 agora esta no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 8000 a pagar em 6 meses tem um Salão de Beleza no mercado Compone o volor pretende aplicar na compra de Produtos de Beleza.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Afivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afivi Gbéka is 46 years old, a widow and a mother of five children. She has been selling sandals for 8 years. She buys sandals wholesale in Lomé and individually resells them at the local markets. Thanks to this small business, she manages to take care of her family's needs. This loan will enable her to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Afivi Gbéka est âgée de 46 ans , veuve et mère de 5 enfants .Elle exerce le commerce des sandalettes depuis 8 ans . Elle achète ses sandalettes en gros à Lomé pour les revendre en détail dans les marchés locaux .Avec cette activité elle arrive à faire face aux charges de sa famille. Le présent crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son stock

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of sandals in Lomé and individual resale

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.es:
Juana, Maria, and Elizabeth have been members of the Orcasitas communal bank for one year. They live in the Orcasitas community, located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

Juana is 22 years of age and lives with her partner. Juana buys tara pods and cochineal insects, then sells them to middlemen. She also sells food at her local stadium on Sundays.

Maria is a 49-year-old married mother of 6. Maria and her husband make handcrafted tiles.

Elizabeth is a 24-year-old who lives with her partner and her only son. She buys tara pods and cochineal insects, then sells them to middlemen. She also sells drinks at her local stadium.

Juana, Maria, and Elizabeth needs loans of 900, 300, and 1750 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of tara pods, cochineal insects, sand, molds, beer, and soft drinks.

Juana, Maria, and Elizabeth dream of advancing in their businesses, owning a house, and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, Maria y Elizabeth pertenecen al Banco Comunal Orcasitas hace 1 año. ellas son de la comunidad de Orcasitas, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Juana es conviviente y tiene 22 años, Juana compra tara, cochinilla y lo vende a intermediarios. Además Juana vende comida los días domingos en el estadio de su comunidad.

Por otro lado Maria es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales.

Mientras que Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth compra tara, cochinilla y lo vende a intermediarios. Además Elizabeth vende bebidas en el estadio de su comunidad.

Juana, Maria y Elizabeth necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 300 soles, 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla, arena, moldes, cerveza y gaseosa.

Los sueños de Juana, Maria y Elizabeth son progresar mas con sus negocios, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of tara pods (a source of tannins), cochineal insects (used for dyes), sand, molds, beer, and soft drinks

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Trần Thị Phương and her husband are both 31 years old. They have 2 children who are attending school. She tends a store selling basic goods and grocery: candies, cookies, beers, cigarettes ...etc. Her husband is a farmer. Her store attracts a lot of customers because she is very friendly. Her monthly income is 150 USD. For the past 5 years, all her loans from TYM were well invested. This time she is requesting a loan of 625 USD to replenish her store. Her wish is to expand her store to include cooked food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hai vợ chồng chị Trần Thị Phương năm nay đều 31 tuổi. Anh chị có 2 con đều đang học cấp 1. Công việc của chị Phương là bán hàng tạp hóa, còn anh Xoan, chồng chị làm nông nghiệp và phụ giúp chị trong công việc kinh doanh. Cửa hàng của chị kinh doanh chủ yếu các loại mặt hàng như bánh kẹo, rượu, bia, thuốc lá ... Luôn có thái độ niềm nở ân cần với mọi người nên hàng của chị Phương bán rất chạy. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng khoảng 150USD. Trong suốt 5 năm tham gia, chị luôn là thành viên sử dụng vốn hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng bán. Mong muốn trong tương lại của chị là sẽ mở rộng kinh doanh sang các lĩnh vực khác như bán hàng ăn.

loans.use: Buy wine, beer, confectionery for grocery store

loans.name: Musidal L Group

texts.en:
Amadu J. is a cow trader who has been running his business for more than 4 years. He buys and sells cows. With his previous loan from Kiva, he increased the number of cows by 2 and has a small calf for the family to rear.

Unlike Amadu, Ibrahim is a butcher in Fadugu village but at a very micro scale. He normally buys 1 cow at a time. The group has 5 members, but the other 3 were away and the team managed only to meet Amadu and Ibrahim. They are requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000. to increase their flocks.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and expand the business

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo is 50 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. He is married and has two children ages 15 and 20. His wife is a homemaker. Pablo works as a supplier of local produce to general stores in his neighborhood. He has four years of experience in this business which he started with his own resources. He plans to use the money from the loan to invest in inventory, to purchase additional produce to offer a wider variety of products for the stores he serves. He plans to continue to work hard to ensure his children have everything they need.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

El Sr. Pablo tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y tienen dos hijos de 15 y 20 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Pablo trabaja como proveedor de verduras a las pulperías aldeñas a su barrio, tiene cuatro años de experiencia y empezó el negocio con recursos propios. Con el dinero que le presten lo invertirá en inventario, en la compra de verduras para ampliar la oferta a las pulperías que atiende. Sus planes futuros son seguir trabajando arduamente para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.

loans.use: To purchase produce and invest in his business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa sells cosmetics per catalogue since three years. She worked selling food but she stopped because she was not earning enough. Rosa also sells clothes upon request; her clients are her neighbors and family.

She has used the loans she has received to buy cosmetics. One day she would also like to have a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 3 años. Ella trabajaba vendiendo comida, pero dejó el negocio debido a que no le resultó rentable. Rosa también vende ropa por pedidos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y familiares. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para tener un stock de cosméticos en su casa. A ella le gustaría tener un restaurante en su casa.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Yhovy Group

texts.es:
The group called Yhovy formed on the date of July 10, 2008. This group was organized thanks to the current President Jacinta R. de C., who works keeping pigs. She participated in a presentation at the Agricultural Extensions Office in the city of Itá, and later explained to her neighbors how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras group worked.

The members of this group would use their loans for different activities like the sale of fruits and vegetables, the sale of food, others working to make articles, others selling cosmetics, cakes, and eatable sweets, and others raising and selling pigs.

The group works together in a group, demonstrating companionship and solidarity. All the members of the group attend the weekly meetings and undertake activites in order to collect funds for the common good of the group. The group is made up of a total of 15 hardworking and sacrificing women.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado Yhovy, se conformó en fecha 10 de julio de 2008, dicho grupo fue organizado, gracias a que la actual Presidenta Jacinta R. de C., quien se dedica a la faena de chanchos, participó de una charla en la Dirección de Extensión Agraria de la ciudad de Itá y posteriormente comentó con sus vecinas de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Logró juntar a 15 mujeres, las cuales integran hoy día el Comité Yhovy.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas, otras se dedican a la costura de prendas, otras venden cosméticos, tortas y comestibles dulces, y otras crían y venden cerdos.

El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad. Todas las integrantes del grupo asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. El grupo está integrado por un total de 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, to buy ingredients for the preparation of food, to buy fabrics for tailoring work, to buy pigs for an existing pig farm, to buy cosmetics, to buy ingredients to make cakes and sweet snacks, etc.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old. She is a widow with 4 children aged between 11 and 6 years old. She is a charcoal seller. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Kurbonoi

texts.en: Kurbonoi M.  is 48 years old and is the mother of two grown daughters and one grown son. Her husband moved to Russia to earn a better living. Kurbonoi started her own business to help support her family and for the last 12 years she has been selling clothes. She has her own trading area that is located in one of the local markets. Every week she transports goods from the larger Dushanbe and Khujand to her local market.  Kurbonoi would like a loan to expand her business and promises to be on time with her loan payment

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Paloma (“Dove”) Village Bank. She is 45 years old and married with three children. She works at the regional hospital as a nurse technician, and also travels to different regional fairs to sell dry goods and fruits. At the fairs, she buys grains to sell in markets in the city of Ayacucho. She and her husband also own a car, which they use for urban transport. Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Maria’s dreams are to have good investment capital, to keep working, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma. Maria es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, trabaja en el hospital regional como técnica en enfermería, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que realiza en sus días libres, donde vende abarrotes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego distribuye en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Maria junto a su esposo tiene un carro que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad. Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo. Maria sueña con tener un buen capital, seguir trabajando, darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Maria would like to buy rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
For almost 22 years, Rudy has been in the farming business. He is now 47 years old, married and has two children: Rudylyn – 21 years old, a college graduate and Rudy Mar – 11 years old, still at the elementary level. Their house is located in Barangay San Vicente in the province of Quirino, Isabela and it is considered a hilly place. The main products in their town are corn, rice, and tobacco. Vegetables are mostly planted in the backyards of the residents.

Rudy is in need of financial assistance to maintain his .8 hectare of rice and corn field. For this, he is asking if he can have a loan of PHP 10,000.00. This loan is not enough to cover all his needs but he chose to borrow a smaller amount to make sure that he can pay it back on time. Some of the things that he would like to purchase are fertilizer and hybrid seeds for his rice field.

He will do his best in order for his business to become profitable and provide for the immediate needs of his family. According to Rudy, he should work and work and work in order to become progressive.

loans.use: additional working capital for his farm

loans.name: Sindor

texts.en: Sindor is a 26-year old young man and a father of two children. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper. Sindor has been a professional driver for 5 years. He has been able to buy a passenger bus with his savings from his cattle raising business. Now his main business is providing taxi service to the population of his town. At his home his wife helps him with the livestock. He wants to increase his production and to purchase more cattle to breed. For this reason he has applied to IMON International for a loan of 4000 Somoni. Sindor thanks everyone supporting him and promises to promptly repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing breeding cattle to expand business

loans.name: Grupo Rojo 0103037-2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Rojo conformado por tres mujeres de nombres: Sandra del Socorro J. V., Eugenia M., Juana María A. M.. Residen en el barrio San Jerónimo de Masaya vendedoras de productos como ropa y zapatos.
Doña Juana María A. M. de 33 años, casada, madre de dos hijos pequeños comercializa zapatos de mujer que su esposo elabora en su casa, ella los vende en el mercado de Masaya y a veces según sus encargos tiene que comprar en otros talleres lo que el cliente le solicite es pare esto que  necesita el crédito, para comprar  zapatos de varones, zapatos cerrados de mujer etc. los cuales su esposo produce. Tiene 7 años de vender zapatos, actividad que la aprendió de su madre desde muy joven.
Espera algún día poder tener un taller propio donde se produzcan  diferentes estilos de zapatos tanto de varón como de mujer.
Desea seguir trabajando con Adim para salir adelante, renovando su compromiso solidario con su grupo.
texts.en:
This is the Rojo group whose members include three women: Sandra del Socorro J. Velasquez, Eugenia Martinez, and Juana Maria A. M.. The live in the San Jeronimo de Masaya neighborhood. They operate businesses selling products such as clothes and shoes. Juana Maria, 33, is married and the mother of two young children. Her husband makes women's shoes which she sells in the Masaya market. At times, depending on what she has available, she has to buy shoes from other workshops in order to meet the demand of her customers. That's why she needs a loan. She's been selling shoes for 7 years, a business that she learned from her mother as a young girl. She hopes one day to have a workshop of her own where she and her husband can produce different styles of shoes, for men as well as women. She hopes to continue working with Adim in order to get ahead and meet her commitment to the group.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la compostura de prendas de vestir en el mercado más cercano de su casa. Hace cinco años que goza de tener un puesto propio por el cual no tiene preocupaciones de renta y le permite tener un negocio mas rentable.
Anteriormente estuvo vendiendo como ambulante alrededor de ocho años. No obstante, la municipalidad le restringió el permiso y tuvo que abandonar las calles para vender dentro del mercado.
El interés por la venta de ropa nació cuando vendía prendas de vestir al por mayor en su casa, en donde se dedicaba también a la fabricación de monederos y pequeñas carteras. Es así que se dio cuenta que el negocio de ropa era bueno si se esforzaba mas.
Por otro lado, también recibe ingresos gracias al alquiler de un mini departamento que se ubica en el segundo piso de su casa.
A sus cincuenta y siete años, aun tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como juntarse con un grupo de compañeras y formar una pequeña empresa de fabricación de ropa. Más adelante quisiera
Ropas y zapatos para surtir su puesto
texts.en:
Candelaria makes a living by selling clothing and also by mending clothing items in the marketplace closest to her house. For the past 5 years she has enjoyed having her own stall at the market. She does not have to worry about paying high rent and it allows her to have a profitable business. She was an ambulatory salesperson for about 8 years. However, the city government started to restrict licenses for ambulatory salespeople and she had to abandon selling in the streets and move to the marketplace. She became interested in selling clothing when she started to sell clothing at wholesale prices out of her house. She also worked making coin purses and wallets. She then realized that the business of selling clothing would be profitable if she worked harder. Candelaria also receives rental income from a studio that she rents out which is located on the second floor of her house. She is 57 years old and she still has many plans for the future. One of her plans is to get together with a group of women like her and start a small business that specializes in making clothing. She would also like to have a larger selection of clothing and shoes to sell at the market place.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing and Shoes to Increase Her Inventory

loans.name: Kitimbwa Group (C)

texts.en:
Suzan N. runs a small bookshop in a rural area of Uganda called Kayunga. Kayunga is about 2 hours north-east of Kampala. Suzan sells books, record books, different kinds of paper, pens, chalk, and other such things at her shop.

Suzan is requesting a loan of 400,000 Uganda Shillings (USH) to restock her store. This will be her second loan and she is already seeing a change in her life because of the loans she is taking. Previously, she was only making about 20,000 USH per week, but now she makes more like 30,000 USH per week. She explains that this is because of two factors; first, she is able to purchase the items in her shop for less money because she can buy them in bulk, and second, because she is able to have more items so more customers come to her shop.

Suzan has four children and no husband. The fathers of the children help her with paying school fees for their children, but they offer no support for the children’s daily lives. Now, with the profit that she is making in her business, she is able to cover her share of the school fees as well as make her children comfortable when they are at home.

loans.use: To purchase more paper, books, chalk, pens, and other book store items

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 And 4 Group

texts.en:
These 10 entrepreneurs are the new members of the Mujeres Unidas Bank of Hope from VilL. MelL.. They live in the farthest northern neighborhood of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.  Ornise M. is the Group 3 Coordinator. She doesn’t speak much Spanish so her fellow group members helped with her interview and also described some of their own businesses and why they decided to get together on a microloan.
