Ornise sells clothing which she buys in bundles. She travels from Santo Domingo all the way to Dajabon, a city on the border with Haiti with a large commercial market. It is about a 5½ hour riD.. Another member of the group is involved with the same business. The other businesses incluD. a butcher shop and a fried food stand. Two of the members own colmados (convenience stores). 
Carine D. L. C. is the Group 4 Coordinator. This group was interviewed during a visit to Esperanza International’s DR headquarters in Santo Domingo. Carine also sells clothing. She would like to increase her business profits to build a reputation in her area. In general, the group members indicate that loans help them to keep their businesses stocked and allow them to have merchandise available for longer periods of time. They are very excited to be receiving their first microloan through Esperanza International. Please help us to support their business initiatives. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing for resale

loans.name: Prak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak A., age 62, has been selected to be the loan group leader by two other borrowers of the loan. Since 2000, Mrs. A. has been selling ice blocks in the village. Most of her clients are neighbors who live near her house. She is married to Mr. Sip, age 65, who makes an income by driving a trailer-motor taxi, and who helps her with selling the ice. The family has five children; three of them are single and the others are married and live independently. 

Mrs. A. is applying for a loan to repair a motor that is frequently breaking down and she plans to use half of the loan to improve her business capital. The others borrowers include; Mrs. S. who sells Khmer fritters from her home and requests a loan to use as capital to begin running a grocery store. And Mrs. S. who sells desserts at her store in the front of her home and is applying for a loan to expand her business. They all live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair a motor and improve business capital

loans.name: Bashiran M. Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji has been a citizen of a mid-size city named Raiwind, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband M. M. A. runs a dairy business. He gets milk from his buffalo and sells to the milk shops. Bashiran baji also helps him by getting milk from the buffalo. Her husband has three years of experience in this business. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a new loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk-selling business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Anes Gull Group

texts.en:
Anes Gull is the group leader of Anes Gull group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for there business.

Anes Gull and Hajera want to take a loan for there business of Bakery to buy stick and wheat for there business and change the designs of there bakery to contract with more restaurant and hotels. Also Azema and Khoja Mohammad want to take a loan for there business of work shop.  And buy necessary materials for there business. And Mier ways wants to take a loan for his business of stationary and he wants improve for his business. There requested a loan of 50000 afghani. there want to expand and progress for there business.          
They want to say that these loans are progressing the business and make larger business so they are use full they all wants to thank the kiva process in Afghanistan which supports poor people.

loans.use: there expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase equipment for breaking stones

loans.name: Candida Maritza

texts.es: Candida Maritza M. reside en el barrio San Juan de Dios en el departamento de San Vicente junto a su único hijo de 13 años de edad. Ella posee una librería en su propia casa, y es un negocio el cual se venden muy bien los productos, ella vende todo lo relacionado con papelería, así también vende camisas y arreglos florales para el hogar. Candida solicita un préstamo a través del cual surtirá más su negocio, ya que como madre soltera trabaja día con día para brindarle una vida mejor a su hijo, es por esto que ella desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Candida Maritza M. lives in the San Juan de Dios neighborhood in the San Vincente department. She lives with her only child, who is 13. She has a bookstore in her own house. Products sell very well in the business. She sells everything having to do with stationery. She also sells shirts and floral arrangements for the home. Candida is asking for a loan to better stock her store. As a single mother, she works day to day to give a better life to her son. That is why she wants to improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her bookstore

location.town: Barrio San Juan de Dios, departamento de San Vicen

loans.name: Obotantim Group

texts.en:
Comfort F., 36 years old, is the divorced mother of a daughter, who is currently in school. Comfort is a committed, creative, and hardworking single mother who is prepared to work hard to provide for her child. She is a trader and trades in grocery products like skimmed milk, rice, bags of sugar, and cartons of vegetable oil, as well as offering boxes of body lotions, hair creams, and so on. She started her business seven years ago. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Obotantim,’ which translates as 'Solid Rock.' Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They are requesting a loan to upgrade their businesses in order to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 East Namawa Mutesi Group

texts.en: N. Mutesi is 35 years old, married with five children, and taking care of three dependents also attending school. She has been operating her business of selling used clothes for over five years. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase more used clothes for sale. She is an encouraging business lady whose dream is prospering.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes for resale

loans.name: Paola Del Milagro

texts.es:
Paola tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, de 5 años y de 2 meses de edad, en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al negocio de venta de tejidos hechos artesanalmente, ella realiza su trabajo en base a pedidos: compra el material para luego confeccionar y bordar toda clase de manteles, vestidos y frazadas que después distribuye en ciudades como Lima y Piura.

Gracias a la artesanía ella puede mantener a su familia, su esposo trabaja como mototaxista (un servicio de transporte muy utilizado en la zona) y juntos sueñan con comprar un terreno en el que puedan construir su casa propia.

Tratando de seguir su sueño ella está solicitando por pirmera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más hilos y telas con los cuales confeccionar más manteles y así, salir adelante poco a poco.

Paola es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable y día a día borda y teje con mucho entusiamo tratando de apoyar a su familia con los gastos diarios del hogar.
texts.en:
Paola is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children, who are 5 years old and 2 months old, in her in-laws home located in the Monsefu district, 20 minutes for the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 5 years she has dedicated herself to her business in the sale of handcrafted textiles. She carries out her work based on orders: she purchases materials to later make and embroider all types of table cloths, dresses, and blankets that she later distributes in cities like Lima and Piura.

Thanks to craftwork she can support her family; her husband works as a motorcycle taxi (a popular transportation service used in the area), and together they dream of purchasing a plot of land on which then can build their own house.

In an effort to follow her dream she is requesting for the first time from our institution a loan of 1,100 PEN which she plans to invest in the purchase of more thread and fabrics to make more table cloths, and in that way get ahead in life little by little.

Paola is a hardworking and responsible woman, and everyday she embroiders and sows with much enthusiasm hoping to help her family with daily household expenses.


Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabrics to make handcrafted textiles.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es: La señora Alfonsa vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos en la calle Heroes del Chaco Nº 29 en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, comercializa polleras y mantas las que confecciona con ayuda de sus hijos para luego venderlas en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y sus provincias. El objetivo del crédito es la compra de mas material para aumentar su  producción de polleras y mantas y mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de telas, hilos, etc., para su negocio de confección y venta de polleras y mantas.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu B. is from the village of Bato. She is 44 years old. Marichu is widowed and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Marichu joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Marichu from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcia Leonor

texts.es: Marcia Leonor Martínez García tiene la edad de 37 años, es una madre soltera por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que con mucho sacrificio asisten a un colegio público y recibe la educación necesaria. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 que se dedica a este negocio, pero importante resaltar que es un negocio ambulante, que nació por su familia ya que su Mama era la que se encargaba de administrar el negocio, pero al fallecer ella Marcia decidió hacerse cargo de esta actividad. La metodología que Marcia utiliza es brindar los productos de cosméticos y ropa a personas que trabajan en instituciones, colegios, tiendas entre otros. El sueño de ella es mantener su negocio y lograr obtener más recursos para invertir su inventario y también proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar decente donde vivir el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Marcia Leonor Martínez García is 37 years old and is a single mother with three children in her care who due to her sacrifices attend public school and are getting a good education. She has sold general merchandise for the last four years as a street vendor. Her mother used to run the business but when her mother died, Marcia decided to take over. Marcia offers cosmetics and clothing to people who work in institutions, schools and stores as well as in other locations. Her dream is to keep her business going and to invest in additional inventory. She would also like to be able to improve her home to give her kids a good place to live in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hélénia

texts.fr: B. Hélénia est née le 20 Novembre 1977 à Kpomassè au Bénin. Hélénia est mariée à SOSSOUVE Thierry et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Hélénia vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint à Midombo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Hélénia est une coiffeuse de profession et qui vend également des mèches pour cheveux et des produits cosmétiques à Midombo. Hélénia a sept ans d’expérience dans ce métier. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que  Hélénia s’approvisionne. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Hélénia sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Hélénia was born on November 20, 1977 in Kpomassè in Bénin. Hélénia is married to SOSSOUVE Thierry and is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in school. Hélénia lives with her children and spouse in Midombo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. The couple share in supporting the family.

Hélénia is a professional beautician who also sells hair extensions and cosmetics in Midombo. Hélénia has seven years of experience in this trade. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. Looking to expand her business and better satisfy her clientele, Hélénia is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of products for hair, hair extensions, and braids

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène S., 47 ans, est marié et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison tels que mangues, orange et aussi de l’arachide. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Mbène S. is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. She sells sesaonal fruits such as mangos and oranges, and she also sells peanuts. Her goal is to strengthen her business and to help improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell seasonal fruits

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia, 42, runs a rice farming business. Her rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato is 3 hectares wide and she is looking forward to expanding her business in the future. Eugenia joins Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to improve her rice field, as she would like to provide better financial support to her 11 year old child.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Vicky Jicela

texts.es:
la joven Vicki Jicela A. C. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, su compañero de hogar es taxista y se ayudan mutuamente con los gastos de la casa. Vicky se dedica  a la venta de pescados fritos, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas pescados, ingredientes para hacer los pescados fritos y refrescos.
su sueño es tener su propia casa y darle un techo digno donde vivir a su hija.
texts.en:
Vicky Jicela A. C. is a 25-year-old young woman who lives in a common-law marriage and has a three-year-old daughter. Her partner is a taxi driver and they help each other with household expenses. Vicky sells fried fish and has done this type of work for five years. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase more fish, ingredients to fry them, and soft drinks. Her dream is to own her own home and put a proper roof over her daughter's head.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fish, butter, tortillas, cabbage, soft drinks, lemons, salt, and spices

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El señor Apolinar L. está muy agradecido con su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo poner el piso de concreto en toda la casa. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder colocar el vitropiso (cerámico) en toda la casa, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejora. 
Desea que su casa ya este terminada ya que tiene un hijo pequeño de edad y quiere que viva mejor.
texts.en:
Apolinar L. is very grateful for his past loan with which he was able to install a concrete floor througout his entire house. Again, he is asking for financing to install ceramic tile flooring throughout the entire house because he doesn't have sufficient funds at the moment to complete the project. He hopes to have his house finished because he has a young son and he wants him to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda B. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Luzviminda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda makes and sells calendars for local businesses. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Luzviminda joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Luzviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Koem Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Srun T. is 29 years old, and she lives in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer. She needs 1,000,000 KHR from AMK to buy rice seed and fertilizer for supporting her crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Ven, a construction worker in a private company, can make a small salary to support his family.  Mrs. Koem Srun is the mother of three children, one of whom is a student in the local school, and the others are too young to study or work. 

Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Alejandro (41) y de sus 4 hijos; Daysi (19), Jordan (17), Ruth (15) y Alejandro (13).
Hace un año instaló una tienda de comestibles en la cochera de su casa y le ha ido muy bien, pues en poco tiempo ha podido ampliarla. Aún recuerda cuando empezó, solo contaba con algunas cosas en su pequeña tienda, estaba casi vacía. Ahora, en la actualidad, vende variedad de productos: abarrotes, bebidas, y hace poco tiempo ha empezado con la venta de gas (doméstico). A Marlene le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se distrae bastante, aunque no puede salir mucho por atender la tienda; además por las ventas obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten comprar cosas necesarias para su hogar. Y como es una mujer que no corre del trabajo duro, para futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda y surtirla de mayor cantidad de productos, para que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio todo lo que necesiten.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda seguir adelante con su negocio. Marlene tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su tienda, también adquirirá cuadernos, que por campaña escolar, se venden bastante bien.
texts.en:
Marlene is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Alejandro (age 41) and their four children: Daysi (age 19), Jordan (age 17), Ruth (age 15) and Alejandro (age 13).

One year ago, Marlene opened a store in the garage of her home and has done very well. Over time she has expanded her business. She still remembers that when she first opened, her shop was almost empty because she had few items in stock. Today she sells a variety of products such as groceries, beverages, and most recently gas (for home use). Marlene enjoys her work because it provides a distraction. However, she is not able to get out much because she has to attend to the store, which generates good profits that allow her to buy necessities for her home. Since she is a woman who is not afraid of hard work, Marlene has plans to expand her facilities and stock her business with a greater quantity of products because her customers rely on her business to provide everything they need.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marlene is very grateful to everyone who has made it possible for her to move forward with her business. She plans to use the money to buy more merchandise to restock her shop. In addition, she will buy notebooks for the school season since they sell very well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Analiza's Group

texts.en: Analiza O. is from the town of Masaya Sur, San Agustin. She is 42 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Analiza O. Group. Analiza is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Analiza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Analiza plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Prk.Crutons, Brgy Abuanan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.  She buys the piglets, feeds them for several months, and then sells them at the market.  Gloria has been involved in her pig-fattening business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2003, Gloria joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from NWTF. Gloria is now requesting a new loan, her 12th, for 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Collin

texts.en:
Collin P. is from the village of Brgy. Qurino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Collin is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Collin owns & operates a business venture providing mechanical services to local community members. Collin has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Collin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Collin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Collin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Collin from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
Albino T. G. nasceu na provincia de Gaza,sul de moçambique  tem 60 anos de idade vive maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 19 aos 23 anos   faz 2ª classe do antigo sistema e não continuou devido aos maus tratos na escola por ser filho de um campones.

Sai de chokwé para Maputo aprocura de emprego, trabalha no Hotel Rovuma  como servente durante 5 anos,ganhava pouco teve uma proposta para trabalhar no Hotel Libombos no distrito de Namaacha na fronteira de Swazilandia onde veio a trabalhar 2 anos devido ao mau ambiente de trabalho com os colegas alegavam que o cargo que ocupava não lhe merecia e deste modo abandona o emprego. Mas com o fundo colectado e com ajuda da sua mulher esta que é modista Albino inicia seu próprio negócio de alfaiataria e sapataria, uma actividade que aprende com as irmãs missionarias quando ainda frequentava a escola. Hoje é dono de uma alfaiataria e sapataria denominada Tchapo­Tchapo, Albino esta muito feliz pois ele hoje e um dos alfaiates mais solicitados do distrito graças a maquina que conseguiu comprar com o empréstimo  da hluvuku e kiva e que o mesmo foi roubado dificultando assim mais o seu trabalho. Trabalha das 7h as 18h na sua alfaiataria  excepto quartas e sabados  tem estado no mercado imformal que funciona dus vezes por semana, tem tido mais rendimentos nos sapatos pois solicitam muito etes serviços principalmente nos tempos chuvosos pois os sapatos descolam se com muita frequência devido a lama argilosa que se faz naquela época. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 6.000mt e consegue poupar por mês 1.500.00mt porque não responsabiliza se por niguem pois ele e único na familia que sobreviveu durante a guerra.

Este e o quarto  empréstimo de Albino na Hluvuku e egundo no Kiva.  Os tres  primeiros foram usados para comprar tecido e maquina de lichar solas de  sapato e pede este quarto de 15.000.00mt para comprarar uma maquina de costura pois no inicio do ano tem tido muitas  encomendas de uniforme escolar e pretende satisfazer a necessidade dos clientes na totalidade e render mais ainda.
texts.en:
Albino T. G. was born in the Gaza province in the south of Mozambique. He is 60 years old and married, and the father of 3 children ages 19 to 23. He completed through the second grade in the old system, and dropped out due to the poor treatment he received at school for being a farmer's son. He left Chokwé for Maputo to look for work. He worked at Hotel Rovuma as a server for 5 years, but earned little. He had an offer to work in the Hotel Libombos in the district of Namaacha on the border of Swaziland. He went to work there for 2 years but left the job due to the bad working environment with his coworkers, who felt that he did not deserve the position that he held. But with the money he had earned and the help of his wife who is a seamstress, Albino opened his own tailoring and shoe cobbling business, activities he had learned with the missionary nuns when he attended school. Today he is the owner of a tailoring and cobbler shop called TchapoTchapo. Albino is very happy because today he is one of the most requested tailors in the district thanks to the sewing machine he was able to buy with a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. That machine was stolen, which has made his work more difficult. He works from 7am to 6pm at his shop except on Thursdays and Saturdays. He has a stand in the market that is opened twice per week. He has had more profits from the shoes because he has a lot of work, especially during the rainy season because shoes often come apart due to the muddy clay that exists during that time. He has had monthly profits of 6.000mt and is able to save 1.500.00mt per month because he is not supporting anyone because he is the only one of his family who survived the war. This is Albino's fourth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. The first three were used to purchase fabric and a machine to grind shoe soles. He is requesting this fourth loan of 15.000.00 to purchase a sewing machine because at the beginning of the year he had many requests for school uniforms and wants to meet the needs of all of his customers and make greater profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: 41-year-old Jocelyn V. is a mother focused on her family’s dream. She lives in the coastal place of Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines with her loving husband, Wilfredo (a fisherman) and five children. The couple works hard to give a better education to their children for the future and they want a better life as well. They decided to join ASHI in 2006 to get capital for their business, which is a fishing and fish trading business. They have requested a new loan of Php 17,000.00. They will invest this capital to maintain raw materials needed in the fishing business and to purchase additional inventories of fish for sale. They hope to build their own beautiful house, expanding their fishing business and have wider space for their fishing equipment. The family feels very happy with the loan that will improve their lives. She is continuing to pray and wish all lenders all the best and good luck, and that they will continue to support poor families like hers who want to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of raw materials needed in the fishing business and to purchase additional inventories of fish for sale.

loans.name: Mol

texts.en:
Mol V., 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its clay and ceramic products.

V. sells groceries and stationery at home for an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is a police officer.

V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria Z. es socia del banco comunal San José hace 5 años, fue invitada por una amiga de la cual esta muy agradecida ya que los prestamos le han ayudado para superarse en su hogar; vive en la comunidad de Inga Pirca que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, muchos de sus habitantes salen a la ciudad en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, realizan las labores de albañiles y arreglo de casas.

Doña Gloria se dedica a trabajar en un  Centro de Desarrollo Infantil en el cual se dedica a cuidar y realizar actividades dinámicas con niños, en este trabajo ya tiene 6 años, labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., de lunes a viernes; también se da un tiempo para criar animales como pollos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre, concibio 2 hijos que tienen 10 y 8 años de edad, estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil y juntos han logrado construir su casa propia.

 Con su nuevo crédito que recibe por parte de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a utilizar para hacerle unos arreglos a su casa, su meta es sacar a su familia adelante y a sus hijos darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Miss Gloria Z. has been a member of the San José community bank for 5 years. She was invited by a friend and she is very grateful since the loans have helped her to improve her home. She lives in the community of Inga Pirca which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. This parish is known for the majority of the people working in agriculture and livestock. Many of the habitants go out to the city in search of better work opportunities, doing work in construction and housekeeping. Miss Gloria works in a Child Development Center where she leads dynamic activities and cares for children. She has worked there for 6 years, working from 8am-6pm, Monday to Friday. She also works part time raising animals such as chicken which she sells when she needs to. Our member is 26 years old and has a common-law marriage with her husband. She has 2 children who are 10 and 8 years old and they study in the community school. Her husband is a professional builder and together they have been able to build their own house. She plans to do some household repairs with her new loan that she will receive from the ESPOIR foundation. Her goal is to provide a better life for her family and her children and give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, and sand

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata A. est âgée de 62 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs ménages au quartier Sokala de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école par refus de ses parents qui voyaient en l’école une porte de déperdition de la fille, elle débuta  tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière, elle a pu maîtriser les rouages du commerce. Ainsi, elle finit par évoluer seule pour mener le commerce du jus de fruits et  de la glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis 17 ans  et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. Elle reçoit constamment des commandes lors des grandes cérémonies (mariage, baptême, décès etc).
Pour faire son jus elle utilise du sucre,  du gingembre,   du Tomi (fruit exotique) très prisé, des  sachet de sucres valines et  poudres de jus (banane et orange). Le tout est mélangé dans 3 litres d’eau  afin d’avoir le goût recherché.  Le breuvage ainsi obtenu est mis  dans des bidons soigneusement lavés  qui seront  finalement dans le réfrigérateur pour refroidissement. 
Dans  le but d’acquérir un nouveau réfrigérateur afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle demande un nouveau prêt Soro Yiriwaso.  Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis  4 ans,  elle a  déjà obtenu 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels,  tous bien remboursés. 
Elle  est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 nouveau réfrigérateur. Elle s’approvisionne en cet équipement sur place. 
Madame Fatoumata A. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à payer ses factures d’électricités. 
Son ambition est de développer son commerce et d’initier ses petits enfants dans ce secteur d’activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata A. is 62-years old, married and the mother of eight children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, her children, and several households in the Sokala neighborhood of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She never went to school due to the refusal of her parents, who felt that school was the road perdition for the girl. She started early on to work with her mother selling cotton clothes. After several years at her mother’s side, she was able to master the mechanics of the business. She started running her own shop selling fruit juice and ice. She has been doing this for 17 years and enjoys great reputation and recognition. She is constantly getting orders for important ceremonies (weddings, baptisms, deaths, etc.). She makes her juices using sugar, ginger, tomi (very popular exotic fruit), and packets of vanilla sugar and juice powders (banana and orange). Everything is mixed into three liters of water to achieve the desired flavor. The beverage is then poured in thoroughly washed drums and placed in the refrigerator to chill. In order to get a new refrigerator to meet customer demand, she is seeking a new loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with the organization for four years, and has already received four group loans and two individual loans, all repaid without incident. This will be her third individual loan, which she plans to use to buy a new refrigerator. She can acquire the equipment locally. Mrs. Fatoumata A. sells cash or credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and pay her electricity bills. Her goal is to expand her business and train her grandchildren in this industry.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: John Okubo

texts.en:
John Okubo, who is 40 year old, testifies how life without a job at times can be hard. This was what actually contributed to the initiation of his investment in the clothes-selling business in the year 2000 in Nambale, so that he could generate income to support his family. Despite the business being attractive, he was totally disillusioned since he could not get enough capital to expand it. He says that if he can access a loan worth 10,000 Kenyan shillings from Kiva, he will be able to adjust going to Busia and Kisumu two times a week to purchase enough so that he expands the business and widens his income base. 

A happily married father of four children, who stay in Nambale, he believes that if his request is responded to, he will absolutely build his own premise and ensure that his children’s educational pursuits are met.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah N. N. is 40 years old, married and has five children aged between 7 and 21 years old. His business is located at a busy area in Nairobi called Mukuru Kwa Njenga. The Mukuru Kwa Njenga area is served by the Kitengela branch. 

His business is well-known by the name Smart Furniture Designer. He sells such items as wall units, beds, seats, side boards, tables and stools to the local people, schools and churches. He has been doing this business for 10 years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same business so his customers are not loyal as they are spoiled for choice. He says there is a lot of power rationing, hindering the business' performance, as well as insecurity in the area. 

However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber for making the products that he sells to his customers. He hopes to open a big furniture shop in the future. He describes himself as hardworking and business-oriented.

loans.use: Timber

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B., age 45, and her husband Fernando, age 55, have six children.  They work hard to cover daily expenses and to pay for their children's education.  For the past ten years Teresa has owned and operated her own sari-sari store (general store) which is situated adjacent to her house, to provide additional income for her family.

Teresa has applied for a PHP 14,000 loan to pay for additional groceries for her store, including prepaid phone cards, mineral water, and charcoal.  She hopes that the additional items will attract more customers and allow her to improve her income.  

Teresa has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation since 2008 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.  She hopes that she will one day expand her business and put all her children through school.

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missionary work in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: groceries, beverages, sacks of charcoal for retail, firewood and mineral water.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Boubacar B. est un jeune commerçant  de 30 ans qui habite à Dalifort. Il est marié sans enfant. Sa spécialité est la vente de fruits comme bananes, pommes, poires et mangues. Il est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 3 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de fruits en vue de renforcer son stock et satisfaire la demande de la clientèle  qui augmente habituellement pendant la période  de Ramadan. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de soutenir ses proches.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar B. is a young 30 year-old salesman who lives in Dalifort. He is married without children. He specializes in the sale of fruits, including bananas, apples, pears and mangoes. He has been a member of the credit association of Dalifort for 3 years. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs which he expects to use to strengthen his stock and satisfy the needs of his customer base, which usually increases during the period of Ramadan. The financing could allow him to increase his profits and to support those close to him.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growth of circulation funds

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en: Camilo V. is from the village of Cabisera 27. He is 52 years old and is married with one adult child. Camilo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-eight years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per cropping. In 2010, Camilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marlene Jeanete

texts.es:
Marlene Jeanet López López
Antonieta es de 23 años de edad, casada, es tejedora en la actividad tiene 8 años de experiencia, solicita su cuarto crédito, para gastos personales y universitarios, en virtud que la misma es utilizada para mejorar su nivel de estudios en la compra de libros. Así mismo los pagos provienen de la actividad a la que se dedica. Por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Marlene Jeanet L. L. Antonieta is 23 years old, married, and a weaver in the business. She has 8 years of experience, and is requesting her fourth loan for personal and school expenses.  The business is used to improve her studies by purchasing books.  The payments will come from the work she does, so she will have no problem making the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: gastos universitarios

loans.name: Minavar's Group

texts.en:
Minavar M., 53, is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married. Her spouse temporarily works in Russia. The family has two children--the son is also in Russia, the daughter is a schoolgirl. The main family incoming comes from cattle breeding. Seven years ago, Minavar sold potatoes in the market. With her earnings, she decided to purchase a cow, and since then she has been reselling cattle. The purpose of this loan is to buy another calf. In the future, the family wants to buy a flat in Osh city.

Muhabat A., 40, is the treasurer of the group. She is a widow who is raising three sons on her own. The eldest son is in the military and the other two are schoolboys. Muhabat makes money by selling fruits and vegetables. When she started her business 12 years ago, she sold cotton-seed oil. Out of her profits, she has managed to build a house. She will use her part of the loan to purchase a calf. In the future, she is planning to buy a car.

Ulanbek D., 21,  is a bachelor. In his childhood, he helped his father breed cattle. Now, for the past two years, he is breeding cattle on his own. He has earned sufficient money to build a temporary house. Ulanbek wants a loan to purchase a calf. In the future, he wants to marry and to buy an automobile.

Tynchtykbek T., 24, is married. His wife is a teacher. The family makes their living by cultivating tobacco and by reselling cattle. Since 2007, Tynchtykbek has been reselling livestock. His profits have enabled him to buy a lot. The loan purpose is to buy cattle. In the future, he is planning to build a house on his new lot.
	
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members receive special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in Kisii town, western Kenya.  Her farm produces maize, beans and nappier grass, which are all sold locally. She also buys and sells vegetables at a local market.

She has requested this loan of 20,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that her family will have enough milk for consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. Her primary challenge has been the unpredictable weather conditions which affects her production. 

Hellen is 34 years old. She is married with four children who are between the ages of 18 months and 13 years. Three of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Fernando ; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 7 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de combustible que lo transporta de Cusco a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado  , el socio trabaja de forma independiente , siendo este el único sustento para su familia . 

El socio solicita el préstamo para proveer de mas combustible

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Puntualito” that is found in the Cusco district, in Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is Mr. Fernando, 52, married and he has 7 children.  The member sells fuel that he transports from Cusco to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  He works for himself and he is the sole support of his family.

Fernando is requesting a loan to purchase more fuel.
He appreciates those who are part of his dream and he promises to make all the payments at the established time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase more fuel.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya and has been doing mixed farming for 9 years. She employs two farmhands on her farm. Her produce of maize, tea, beans, bananas, milk and millet are sold locally. She has one 8-year-old child.

She requested the loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this loan will improve her family standard of living in terms of food. She is focusing on buying a pick-up truck in five years time to help in transportation of milk to the market.

She laments on the poor road networks and low prices for products within the local markets.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Arturo

texts.es: El señor Juan Arturo A. esta casado y tiene una hija por la que quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor patrimonio. Arturo construyo su vivienda con ahorros propios pero ahora el desea hacerle una mejor fachada para esto el necesita comprar material de construcción. El señor es chofer de camiones para trasportar a empleados a sus respectivos trabajos y su esposa como operadora para solventar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Arturo A. is married and has a daughter for whom he wants to offer a better quality of life and a good inheritance.

Arturo built a home with his own savings, but now he wants add a better façade and needs to buy the necessary construction materials. He works as a truck driver and transports employees to their respective jobs. His wife works as an operator to cover their expenses.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to improve the façade of his house

loans.name: Familias Productivas Group

texts.es:
FAMILIA PRODUCTIVAS

Deyanira tiene 3 meses siendo presidenta de la Alcancía comunal”FAMILIAS PRODUCTIVAS” este grupo se conforma por 7 personas que se conocieron por medio de otras Alcancías Comunales y le pusieron el nombre de Familias Productivas a su alcancía por que   lleva el nombre de su institución ,
Deyanira tiene 51 años es madre casada tiene 2 hijos menores de edad Deyanira tiene 1 años trabajando en un salón de belleza su nombre es (YUDIT) haciendo maquillajes peinados y con el ingreso de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su casa y  piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en compras de de materiales y herramientas de repostería sueños es tener un negocio de repostería y con la ayuda de Edaprospo-prosperidad lo lograra
texts.en:
Deyanira has been president of the ”FAMILIAS PRODUCTIVAS” communal bank for 3 months.  This group has 7 members who knew each other through other communal banks.  They gave their group the name "FAMILIAS PRODUCTIVAS" (Productive Families) because it is the name of their institution.

Deyanira is 51 years old.  She is married and has two dependent children.  Deyanira has been working in a beauty salon called YUDIT for one year.  She does make up and hairdos and uses the income from her work to help with her household expenses.  She plans to use her loan money to buy material and tools for making confectionery.  Her dream is to have a confectionery business and, with Edaprospo-Prosperidad's help, she will achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy tools and material for making confectionery

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gouloukan, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de lait et des galettes.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier avec Soro Yiriwaso.
MAZE B. s’approvisionne en condiments avec les grossistes de Dioïla presque chaque semaine. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F  CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Benkadi Group („Harmony”) are all married. On average, they are 43 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Gouloukan, prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood. They trade with food condiments, milk and biscuits.

This is the first loan of the women of Benkadi Group with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Maze B. buys condiments nearly every week from the wholesalers in Dioïla. She sells them in her village, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Mrs B. expects to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to repay the loan and pay for healthcare, food and tuition, and any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hortalizas, ella tiene un pequeño terreno donde cultiva zanahorias, papa, habas y arvejas y lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de hortalizas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas para su terreno de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Mujeres en Acción Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Anta District, which is part of the Anta Province and the Department of Cusco.

Lucila is 39 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables. She has a small piece of land where she grows carrots, potatoes, beans, and peas and sells them at the different street markets in the Anta District. She wants to improve and expand her business selling vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds for her farmland.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen members located in Preaek Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Thai S. K. is the village bank president selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Thai S. K. is a Khmer noodle and bread seller, earning a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she wants to expand her business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy more Khmer noodles and breads. Her husband, Mr. Ing Bo, stays at home and also helps with his wife's business. This couple has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a waitress in a restaurant, one stays at home and one is a student.

loans.use: to buy more Khmer noodles and breads

loans.name: Fudia

texts.en: Fudia is 40 years old.  She is single, and has one 14-year-old child and one additional dependent. In 2008, Fudia established her bar and restaurant business. She began her business because she saw that there are lots of offices situated in that particular area and workers were finding it difficult to get food.  She opens her business 6 days a week and 12 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to purchase more drinks and food items to meet the demands of the customers during the 50th year Independent Anniversary celebration. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Epifania is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Epifania owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables like eggplants & string beans. Epifania has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Epifania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Epifania from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Torn C., 36, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She is a housewife and her husband earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables. He earns about $5 a day, and the family uses this money to meet expenses that include $30 a month for food and $20 a month for other necessities. C. is applying for a loan for $400 to buy mangoes to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. We see C. here in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy mangoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en:
Ma. Liz is 35 years old and married with 5 children.

Ma. Liz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her general store.

Ma. Liz has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Ma. Liz aspires to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar S., 58, lives in Phnom Penh city. She currently lives with her mother who stays at home to care for the housework. She was married with Mr. Sar Theurn, age 56, who is a rice farmer. She has two married children and the other two are single. The three of them earn money to help meet the family's living expenses. 

Sar S.’s children always use their own motorbike as a way to ride to work, but now their motor is broken down. Sar S. doesn’t have  immediate cash to help them, so she has decided to seek a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her children in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her children in order to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
M. es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, el cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz en el caserío Sime que se encuentra a unos 20 minutos del distritode Pitipo  y a 40 minutos de la provincia de Ferreñafe.  Esta zona se caracteriza porque sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura,ganadería y turismo.

La labor que M. desempeña es como personal de seguridad en el almacén de una librería desde hace algún tiempo, otra actividad que realiza es la venta de gas, la cual es una buena oportunidad de negocio ya queen su zona es elúnicoque se dedica a ese negocio.  Todas esas actividades que desempeña es con la intensión de incrementar sus ingresos para poder brindarles un mejor niveldevidaa su familia. 

M. desea comprar más gas  ya que su clientela aumentado considerablemente y para eso a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles y así seguir incrementado sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
M. is a 47 year-old father who lives in his own home together with his wife and children. His home is located in the small village of Sime, 20 minutes from Pitipo district and 40 minutes from Ferreñafe province. His home has running water and electricity. This area is noted for the fact that its residents work in agriculture, livestock raising and tourism.

M. has been working as a security guard in a book store warehouse for some time. In addition, he sells gas. The gas sales are a good business opportunity as he is the only one in his area who carries out this business. M. carries out all his business activities in order to increase his income so that he can provide his family with a better standard of living.

M. would like to buy more gas since his customer base has increased considerably. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can continue increasing his income and thereby improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Ernesto Rufino

texts.es: El señor Ernesto B. , tiene la edad de 53 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen un hijo a su cargo , actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Ernesto labora en una empresa privada desde hace varios años , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder tener el capital suficiente para ir  comprando materiales de construcción de una sola vez , con el primer financiamiento logro hacer gran parte del baño de la vivienda y ahora este segundo financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de una puerta , cerámica , cemento y otros materiales para terminar la obra .
texts.en:
Ernesto B., 53, lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife who works and helps him with household expenses.  They have a son in their care who is currently a student.  His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions.

Ernesto has worked for a private firm for several years.  The greatest difficulty he faces is not having sufficient capital to buy all the building materials at one time.  

With his first loan he was able to complete most of the bathroom in his house and now needs this second loan to buy a door, tile, cement and other materials to finish the project

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal El Arenal del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad y dos hijos 
Recién son 3 ciclos que esta perteneciendo al banco comunal, su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos (habitaciones), tiene una casa de 3 pisos la cual ha habilitado para prestar este servicio. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprarà 10 baldes de pintura, 2 rodillos, pintara la parte de debajo de su casa para dar mejor vista a los cuartos.
Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, todo el negocio está a su cargo y lo maneja adecuadamente, el dinero de los alquileres lo invierte en la construcción de otros ambientes para el alquiler.
Espera que Manuela Ramos le otorgue un monto más alto para poder invertir màs y asì hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "El Arenal" in the district of Calleria, of the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and she has two children. She has been with her communal bank for 3 loan cycles and her business is renting rooms (bedrooms). She has a 3-story house which she has remodeled to provide this service. With her new loan of S/. 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase 10 buckets of paint and 2 paint rollers to paint the lower section of her house, to give the rooms a better appearance. 

Her husband is an agriculturist. Her business is entirely in her charge and she manages it adequately. The funds earned from the rentals are invested in the construction of other shelter for rent. She hopes that Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) will grant her a greater loan amount to be able to invest more and to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase paint.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 46 years old and married by status. Her husband works in the Municipal Corporation on a low income. He also operates a business selling seeds. He has a good number of business contacts and earns a good profit after completing their orders. Nasreen also supports him financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is also a very good housewife and performs her daily routine tasks very well. 

She has given birth to eight children. Her three eldest children left their education after 8th and started to work to contribute to the family financially. Her remaining children are continuing their education. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase seeds in bulk quantity for selling to earn a good profit. Nasreen hopes that her husband’s business will improve further after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for selling

loans.name: Adelita De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Adelita es una ama de casa, gran una mujer, madre soltera y muy emprendera.  

Ella necesita un préstamo de ₡500.00, para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su casa, construyendo y añadiendo a su vivienda un cuarto de pila, para lo cual necesitara comprar zinc, cemento, arena y clavos, entre otras cosas.

Ella pertenece a la Empresa de Credito Comunal de Brasilia.
texts.en:
Adelita is a home maker, a single mother and a great and very enterprising woman.  

Adelita needs a loan of ₡500.00 (USD $1025) to carry out an improvement on her house.  She wants to add a laundry room on to her house.  She will need buy zinc, cement, sand and nails, among other items.

Adelita belongs to the communal bank "la Empresa de Credito Comunal de Brasilia" (The Communal Credit Company of Brasilia).

loans.use: to build a laundry room.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 50 years old and has two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Kate is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Kate has been farming rice for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pap

texts.en: Pap keeps livestock and has an orchard. He would like to increase his livestock and develop farming. With the requested loan, Pap plans to purchase two cows and two calves. Development of agriculture will help Pap increase his income and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Pap lives together with his father, wife, and adult child.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She has been in farming for the last 10 years producing mainly milk, coffee, eggs and tea which she sells to the local market. She is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 1. Nancy is employed as an accounts clerk and gets additional income which supplements her farming income.

Nancy has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase artificial insemination equipment for her farm. Nancy says the machine will enable her to generate income by rendering the service to other farmers as well as getting the services at a lower costs. 

Nancy notes that farmers in the area are facing challenges due to poor markets and lack of enough water for irrigation.

loans.use: to purchase artificial insemination equipment for her farm

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah,s group is comprised of four hard working women. Faridah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child.  Her child is currently in school.  Faridah has had a business of selling clothes for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faridah hopes to generate greater profits.  In the future, Faridah hopes to expand her business.   Faridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 36-year-old single lady who has been living with her mother and sister since her father passed away.

To be able to support herself and to help with the family’s income, Nahla started almost two years ago working as an independent dressmaker and operating a small clothing retail business at home.

Now Nahla has applied for a loan to buy more clothing materials and fabric so she can one day have her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and fabric

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is a basketmaker and sells her baskets from her home. She can earn $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker. The couple has two children, 4 and 3 years old. Every month, Sopheap has to spend $53 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She has requested a loan of $350 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use in traveling to work. She plans to buy more baskets from her fellow villagers to sell in Phnom Penh, so that she can make more income for her family. She hopes to support her children's studies until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's transportation to work.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes decided to engage in a direct-selling business. She learned about the business through some friends and she has been in the business for one year.

She is 46 years of age. She lives with her five children. Lourdes separated from her husband eight years ago. Despite this, Lourdes wants to improve her family's living situation through her business. 

Lourdes is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase eyeliner, lipstick, eyebrow pencil and lotions to sell to her customers. This loan will help her improve the inventory that she offers to customers. Her only difficulty is that she sells on credit, and her customers don't pay for their purchases on time.

loans.use: to purchase eyeliner, lipstick, eyebrow pencil and lotions to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson wants a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. He is a 32-year-old father of two children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a mechanic and has been in service for seven years. He faces a problem of delayed payments and his dream is to own a full-fledged garage.

Jackson intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Wilmer tiene 19 años de edad y es soltero, él nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él estudia en un instituto superior la carrera profesional de prótesis dental y es cachimbo. Wilmer en sus horas libres se dedica  a brindar servicio de transportes en el taxi de su padre. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio urbano y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Wilmer requiere el préstamo para uso personal y desea comprar libros, materiales de estudio, otras cosas más.  

Wilmer agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Wilmer belongs to the San Isidro de Compone community bank.  The bank's members meet once a month in Compone, a neighborhood of the city of Izcuchaca.  

Wilmer is 19-years old and single.  He was born in the city of Cusco and lives and works there.  He is studying for a degree in dental prosthetics.  In his spare time, he earns money driving his father's taxi.  He has worked as a taxi driver for a couple of years and done very well thanks to the effort he's made to do it.  Wilmer is applying for a loan to pay personal expenses, books and study materials, among other things.  

Wilmer is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy books and other materials for his university studies.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, a unos hijos los logro sacar adelante con los estudios, con grandes esfuerzos los gradúo de carreras universitarias, tiene dos hijos que estan estudiando en la universidad toda via.
Don Juan Francisco se dedica a la Caficultura y Agricultura, tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo y manejo del café, el credito lo utilizara para comprar un sistema solar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y realizar algunas tareas por las noches e incluso ahora dice que sus hijos podrán hacer uso de computadoras portátiles en su casa y ya no viajar hasta el pueblo para realizar trabajos o tareas que le dejan en las universidades.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco is 65 years old, married, and his children are already grown up.  He managed to support some of his children in their studies and, with a lot of effort, he managed to see them graduate from their degree courses at university.  He has two children who are still studying at university.

Juan Francisco grows coffee and farms.  He has a lot of experience growing coffee.  He will use his loan to buy a solar-energy system to improve his living conditions and to carry out some tasks in the evenings.  He says that his children will now even be able to use laptop computers at home and not have to travel to the village to carry out work or tasks that they have from university.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Jalia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells electronics. 

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.
