The loan will be used to buy more electronic supplies for resale, and will help Jalia to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Jalia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jalia, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electronic supplies for resale.

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es:
Magali cuenta con 31 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando Brenda la mayor estudia 1º de secundaria, Sandy está estudiando la primaria y miguel esta en 3º de preescolar tiene un bebe de un año 7 meses, su esposo se llama hidael es albañil.

Ella es comerciante vende empanadas de arroz con leche, harina y camote ya tiene 4 años con su negocio lo ha sabido sacar adelante sale a vender sus empanadas en varios pueblos para poder vender más y que le queden ganancias, ella invirtiera su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para las empanadas como son: harina, aceite, azúcar, leche, etc.

Magali pertenece al grupo la fe el cual está integrado por 14 miembros dos hombres y 12 mujeres las cuales se definen como unas trabajadoras y todas se encuentran trabajando a continuación serán mencionadas: Abel, Marcelina, Ma del Refugio, Feliciana, Adelfa, Ángela, Teodora, María del Rocío, Ismael, Juana, Blanca, Silvestra, Esther. Todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de productos de abarrotes, refrescos, frutas y verduras, pescaderia, comida, artículos domésticos, ollas de barros, etc.
texts.en:
Magali is 31-years-old and is married. She has 4 children, and those in school are Brenda, the oldest, who studies in the first year of middle school, Sandy, in elementary school, and Michael, in his third year of preschool. She has a 1 year, 7 month old baby. Her husband is named Hidael and is a bricklayer.

She is a merchant selling empendadas with rice pudding, flour, and sweet potato. She has had her business for 4 years and has known how to move it forward. She sells her empanadas in several towns in order to sell more and to maintain profits. She will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients used for empanadas such as flour, oil, sugar, milk, etc.

Magali belongs the group "La Fe" [The Faith] which is composed of 14 members, 2 men and 12 women, who identify as hard workers and all of whom are working. They are mentioned as follows:  Abel, Marcelina, Ma. del Refugio, Feliciana, Adelfa, Ángela, Teodora, María del Rocío, Ismael, Juana, Blanca, Silvestra, and Esther. They all have businesses, like the sale of groceries, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables, fish, food, household items, clay pots, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like flour, oil, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother of 8, ages between 27 and 17 with the last two still schooling. She has been in active farming, specifically poultry and dairy farming. She has been selling her products within the local markets for the last 5 years. She is 48.

Beatrice has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to improve her poultry business by buying more birds. She says this loan will increase her poultry to 700 in number and improve her farming income, which she will use to uplift the living standards of her children.

She too, mentions farmers lose much of their income due to poultry diseases.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Flor De Azar Group

texts.es: La nueva integrante del grupo es la señora Anita va a comprar con su prestamo uniformes para los alumnos de la primaria y secundaria. La señora Julieta Pastora tiene 46 años de edad, ella tiene un puesto de dulces, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar bombones, paletas de caramelo, galletas, chicharrones y una parte para la escuela de sus hijas, su negocio es importante porque está en su casa y puede atender a sus hijas, ella se siente orgullosa de poder salir adelante con sus hijas, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años su esposo le dio para comprar los dulces, sus hijas tambien le ayudan a atender a los clients, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir en dulces y para algún imprevisto de enfermedad o gastos de la escuela, ella está planeando echar colado a su local para vender pozolelos fines de semana, ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar su mercancía para que su negocio este bien surtido. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijas sigan estudiando. Las integrantes de grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante y la familia está mejor”.
texts.en:
The new group member is Anita who will use her loan to buy uniforms for elementary and secondary school students.  

Julieta Pastora, 46, has a candy stand.  She asked for the loan to buy bonbons, caramel lollipops, cookies and fried pork rinds and part of it for her daughters’ schooling.  Her business is important because it’s home-based so she can watch over her daughters.  She is proud to be able to get ahead with her daughters.  

She started the business three years ago; her husband gave her money to buy the candy.  Her daughters help her tend to customers.  She uses profits to reinvest in candy and also for unexpected illnesses or school expenses.  She’s planning to lay a concrete floor in her locale to start selling pozole on the weekends. 

She is happy with the loan she’s going to get and is going to use it to buy merchandise so that her business will be well-stocked.  Her dreams and hopes are that her daughters stay in school.  

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for the loans.  Thanks to you we can get ahead and the family is better.”

loans.use: to buy candy, bonbons, caramel lolipops, cookies and fried pork rinds and part of it to pay for her daughters' schooling.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 31 years old and married with one child who is eight years old. She is running a tailoring shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothing material for dressmaking.

loans.use: To buy clothing material for making dresses

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Rene has a shop where she sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 10 years. She's requesting a loan of 8000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Rene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary was born 41 years ago in Empuyiankat, Kajiado. As young girl she used to look after her fathers cattle and did not get a chance of attending school. However, her wish is to educate her five children to sail through the tabulate waters of this world. Two of her children are in college while the rest are in secondary school. She is married to a responsible man who contributes towards the development of their family. Mary is a strong member of Inkiramat women group. She sells bead items and milk to earn a living. She sells milk to hotels at Kitengela town and bead items in Isinya as well as Kiserian. Mary’s group is scheduled for training in livestock management towards the end of September and this aims at equipping members with new methods of livestock management to prepare them for the new business they are to start. She wants to start a business of rearing steers and selling them after some time. She wants to utilize the expanding market and the availability of pasture in the area at present. Mary plans to start with 2 small steers and later will develop the capacity to raise about 10 steers. At this level, she will be in a position to providing for her family the minimum necessities of life.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy 2 small steers.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is originally from Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan.
In 1998 she started her clothes trading business. In 2005-2006 she borrowed twice in the total amount of $1,400 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded her business.
Now she wants to borrow $1,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae invested her first loan with SPBD in operating a business selling pork buns and ice-pops. She is now paying off her third loan, which was also used in purchasing necessities for her business. Some of these loans were used in paying her three kids' school fees. One of her children is attending university and the fees are very expensive. Faavae believes that she wouldn’t be able to meet their family needs without the assistance of the program.

loans.use: To purchase pork buns ingredients, cordial sugar, and assist in paying kids' school fees

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Rany is single. She lives with her nephew in the same house. She has been weaving silk at home since 1984. Her nephew is a goldsmith, who began his work in 2004. Rany left school after grade 4. Besides weaving silk, she knows how to prepare her loom and weave patterns on the silk as well.

Rany has already borrowed and repaid five loans from MAXIMA . This time, she would like to borrow $600 to buy tools for working gold for her nephew. That way, he can make necklaces, bracelets, rings, and earring to sell in the village. This business can help them to earn enough money to live on and the other people can buy jewelry near their house. We feel sure that they can pay back the interest and principal on this loan without any problem.

loans.use: Buying tools for working gold to make jewelery

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: With over ten years of experience as an entrepreneur, Marina L. manufactures and sells footwear in the central city market of Zaporozhye. Married with three children, Marina lived and worked in Chernobyl after the nuclear explosion. As a result, she has suffered lasting health complications that require ongoing treatment. Marina works with professionalism and dedication. She is optimistic and hard-working, with plans to increase her footwear manufacturing and sales business. Marina has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for six years. A successful microfinance entrepreneur, Marina has maintained a perfect credit history. She is currently seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase new inventory and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Felismina Fabiao

texts.pt:
Felismina lives with her husband and their six school age children – all of whom are enrolled in school. She joined the credit program in 2005 and, thanks to her micro-loans, her business has been doing well. She has a small shop where she sells miscellaneous household and farming tools: rakes, buckets, rope, hoses, chains, nails, etc. She would use this cycle's loan to increase the shop's inventory. Felismina hopes the business will continue to do well so that she can make additions to her house, to better accomodate her many children. At the shop she counts with her husband's help.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Felismina vive maritalmente com um homem com quem tem 6 filhos. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar.Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito do FDm em 2005. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para adquirir mais artigos para rechear a sua barraca. Ela tem muita clientela, pois que vende de tudo um pouco, desde baldes, cordas, ancinhos, correntes,mangueiras, balancas, pregos etc,. Com os rendimentos do negocio ela pensa ampliar a residencia tendo em conta o numero de filhos. Ela trabalha com o marido na venda.

loans.use: Felismina will use her loan to buy more items to sell at the hardware shop she runs with the help of her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HER SHOP AND PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Amih

texts.en: Amih is 44-year-old woman who makes a living by producing bamboo mats at her house and usually earns about US$ 22.50 per month. Her husband, M., has no fixed income, so the family really depends on her income. Now she needs a loan of US$ 150 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her weaving business

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween A. from Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I have lived all my life in this town. My husband operates an electronics store. Now, he requires a loan to buy some items for his electronics store.  I would like to borrow in a group of few women: Nasreen A. needs loan to buy goats for their livestock trading. Rubina B. wants to open up a grocery store. Nargis B. will use the loan for the repair of their rickshaw. Saleema B. also wants a loan for her son’s grocery store. Rahima B. is a widow and sells cloth.

loans.use: Expand electronics store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella S. is married and has 4 children.  For the past 5 years, she has been selling food products to students at Cape Coast University.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional food items to sell to the hungry students.  Stella is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional food items for food sales business

loans.name: Delsi

texts.es:
Delsi is a member of the communal bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 34 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her husband works in an office and as a driver. With the first loan she received, Delsi invested in a small general store. Today she gets up at 6am to make breakfast for her husband and children, and then she works in her store until 8pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, ham, noodles, sodas and other stock for her store. Delsi is very content because she has become a prosperous and enterprising woman through her will and efforts to succeed, and now she is able to help cover the costs of her family.

La señora Delsi pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano José de San Martín Mz A Lt 9 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante y motocarrista. Delsi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a atender su bodega hasta las 8pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1400 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, jabón, fideos, pasamanería, gaseosas, etc. Delsi esta muy contenta, porque se ha convertido en una mujer prospera y emprendedora tan solo con ganas y esfuerzo para salir adelante, ahora puede apoyar en los gastos de su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, SUGAR, MILK, NOODLES, SODA, ETC  TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel T. began her business, a clothing shop, 15 years ago. She is a mother to four children: Jesus, Jose, Ma. De los Angeles and Hilda Barco T.. She wanted to work so that she could contribute to her family’s income but worried about neglecting her children. For this reason, she decided to launch her own business.

She is requesting a loan of US $500 which she will repay in 6 months so that she can purchase merchandise and remodel her shop’s structure. With your assistance, Maribel will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Maribel T. inicio su negocio, un bazar de ropa desde hace 15 años. Es madre de 4 hijos Jesús, José, Ma. de los Ángeles e Hilda Barco T.. Ella deseaba trabajar para contribuir en la economía familiar pero le preocupaba descuidar a sus hijos por los horarios que manejan las empresas por esta razón decidió emprender su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y remodelar la estructura de su local. Con tu ayuda Maribel saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing W. is 25 years old and single. She sells drinks wholesale and has been in business since 2004. She live in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She needs a loan for $700.00 to buy more drinks to sell. She says, "Thank you!" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mariela Vanesa

texts.es:
Mariela lives in the neighborhood called Hills of the Memorial Sandino. She is 27 years old. She is married and has two children; one of 8 years and one of 8 months. Her husband works as an administrative technician.

Mariela sells clothes, cosmetics, jewelry and various other items. She began selling clothes and has grown with the passage of time. She already has seven years of experience in this market, and, with the previously requested loans, she has diversified her sales.

The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of inventory: clothes, cosmetics and jewelry. Her plans are to open a store, since at present she has merchandise in her house, but also works by selling on foot.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años y uno de 8 meses, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como técnico administrativo.

Mariela vende ropa, cosméticos, prenda y otras variedades, ella inició vendiendo ropa y ha ido creciendo con el pasar de los tiempos, son siete años ya de experiencia en este mercado, y con los préstamos anteriormente solicitados ha ido diversificando sus ventas.

El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de inventario: ropa , cosméticos y prendas. Sus planes son llegar a poner una tienda, ya que actualmente tiene mercadería en su casa, pero también trabja de forma ambulante.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Since 6 years, Carmen sells tennis shoes in a shopping mall. Her nephew got her into the business because he already had two selling spots at the mall; now Carmen sells in one of them.

She works from 8am until 10pm. She has used the loans she received to buy more merchandise. Now, she would like to have her own selling spot at the mall.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años, Carmen trabaja vendiendo zapatillas en un centro comercial. Su sobrino la animó a participar de este negocio, debido a que él tiene dos puestos de ventas. Ella vende en una de esos puestos. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Los préstamos le han servido para invertir en la compra de las zapatillas. A ella le gustaría tener su propio puesto de venta de zapatillas.

loans.use: To buy more tennis shoes

loans.name: Marta Azucena

texts.es:
The county of Nagarote in the city of Leon is characterized by the very important role that cattle and agriculture play in the community's economy. Marta Lopez L. has had a business rearing cattle and cows to obtain milk to sell it and thereby support her young son.

Nowadays she urgently needs to acquire more cows to raise and to milk. It is because of this that she is looking for the support of Ceprodel; to get some credit in order to move forward and give her family better living conditions which they so deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de Leon se caracteriza por ser un local donde la ganaderia y agricultura juegan un papel importantisiimo para la economia de la comunidad. La señora Marta Lopez L. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería por medio de la crianza de ganado como lo son las vacas con el proposito de obtener la leche para comercializarla y de igual forma para proporcionarsela a su pequño hijo.

Hoy en dia la necesidad que ella atraviesa es con urgencia la adquisición del ganado para la crianza con el proposito de extraer la leche. Por este motivo es que busca el apoyo en Cepordel para obtener el credito para salir adelante y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su fmilia que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy cows to rear/Compra de vacas para crianza

loans.name: Maryam 's  Rabi Tupe Kheri Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 7, 5, and 3 years old and a baby of 8 months. She has been a charcoal and clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling bites, firewood, coconuts, cassava, fish, and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes to increase her current stock

loans.name: Magdalena U.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Magdalena U. M. from Tukuyu, married with five children between the ages of 9 and 20. Magdalena, who has been running a Vitenge (traditional African women’s clothing) shop since 2004, works 10 hours per day, 7 days per week and currently earns about $95 each month from her business.

She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase vitenge in bulk for her business, and in the future plans to have her own clothes shop for catering to a variety of fashions. Magdalena thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja Sáenz R. pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Maruja tiene 37 años de edad y dos hijos con su esposo que trabaja en la parte administrativa de la UGEL (unidad de gestión educativa) en Yungay. Administra una bodega en su casa que queda en el jr. 02 de mayo Acobamaba en el distrito de Yungay. Ella expende sus productos y menciona que es su mayor satisfacción haber hecho crecer su negocio donde sin muchas dificultades ella ha podido iniciar y mantenerse y de esa manera apoya a su familia, además nos comenta que los miembros de su familia se sienten muy orgullosos de ella. Realiza los pedidos desde la ciudad de Huaraz o compra en los mayoristas de Yungay.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará específicamente con todo el préstamo, arroz, azúcar y leche, porque menciona que ahora han subido mucho los productos, nos cuenta también que ahora la caja de leche cuesta S/ 110. 

Maruja menciona que desearía capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también en su  vida personal.
texts.en:
Maruja Sáenz R. belongs to the communal bank Mujeres at Progreso (“Women Progressing”) in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. Maruja is 37 years old and has two children with her husband, who works in the administrative section of UGEL (UGEL is an administrative unit in charge of many schools in what you would call a "county") in Yungay. She manages a general store in her house, which is located on 2nd of May Street in the Yungay district. She sells her products, and notes that it is a great satisfaction to have made her business grow without many difficulties and help support her family. In addition, she tells us that her family is very proud of her. She fills orders in the city of Huaraz, or she buys from the wholesalers of Yungay. With this loan of 1,200.00 soles, to be canceled in six months, she will specifically purchase rice, sugar, and milk. This is because, as she mentions, prices have gone up quite a bit and a box of milk now costs 110.00 soles. Maruja mentions that she would like to train on how to better improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en: I. Saifullo is 49 years old and lives in the village of Penjikent. He is married with two children. He supports his children as well as his wife and parents.  His main source of income is farming and raising livestock. Saifullo is an experienced livestock breeder. In order to better manage his herds and increase productivity, he needs to build an enclosure for them.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 11 months. This will allow him to make his livestock business more profitable so that he can better support his family.

loans.use: Building an enclosure for his livestock.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is married with five children and lives in the town of Bamenda, Cameroon.  She plans to invest this loan in her retail business.  She wants to purchase more specifically, yam, paw-paw, oranges, and pineapples.  
 
This is Serah's fifth loan from GHAPE since she joined in 2004. Serah also has an excellent site for her business located at the entrance into the main market of the town. She has seen that there is a high demand in her produce because her inventory is always fresh. Sarah  plans to strengthen her business by purchasing these items from farms located closer to town thereby reducing her transportation costs.
 
With the profits earned from this loan, Serah plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs.  She also intends to buy a piece of land for herself.  She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living. She plan to repay her loan in 18 months and her first installment repayment will be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of produce such as paw-paw, oranges, and pineapples and vegetable for resale

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya S. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur, a married woman with four children. She runs a charcoal store at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. The demand for charcoal for domestic use as a main source of power is very high in most developing countries due to high electricity costs and unreliability.  Raya purchases charcoal bags wholesale directly from the charcoal producers. She has been in the business for six years. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more business inventory

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 31años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y zapatos, los mismos que los vende ambulatoriamente por la zona donde vive, dejando sus prendas al contado o al crédito. Esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años juntamente con su esposo, quien es el encargado de viajar a comprar la mercadería para luego traerla y llevarla a vender. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y muchas personas, además le es rentable porque tiene su clientela que le solicitan con anticipación sus prendas. Posteriormente quiere tener un local para instalar su propia tienda de ropa. Ya son 11 veces que recibe un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta mucho trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa y zapatos, y en adelante mandará a construir un local para poner su mini tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 31 years old, lives with her children and husband. She owns her own house. Her activities are selling shoes and clothes in her neighborhood. She accepts full payment from her customers or she keeps a tab. She has been doing this for the past 4 years with her husband who is the one in charge of traveling to buy the merchandise to sell. The thing she likes about her job is that she travels and meets a lot of people. Her business is also profitable because she has her clients that pre-order their clothing items. In the future she wants to have her own store. She has received 11 loans from MFP and she enjoys working with the members of her communal bank. With the money she is asking for, she will buy more clothing and shoes. In the future she would like to have enough to build her own little clothing store.

(Translated by Ashlee and Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Romana

texts.es:
Romana inicio su negocio primero pusieron su  ferretería en la bajada del mercado Francisco I. Madero  en Tampico, y de esta manera lograron su sueño, ya que en la actualidad, aparte de esa Ferretería tienen otros dos negocios más pequeños en la bajada del mercado y les ha ido muy bien desde entonces. 
 
Su negocio ha tendido grandes progresos comenzaron  con un negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo  pudimos tener dos ferreterías mas, una de las cuales ya se la traspasaron a su  hija y también le está yendo muy bien.

Ella necesita un prestamo de MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar artículos de ferretería para poder tener mas surtido el negocio y que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan.
texts.en:
Romana began her first business as a hardware store in the market Francisco I. Madero in Tampico, and with this business was able to fulfill her goal of building two other smaller businesses in the same market and they have done well. They have been successful enough to be able to transfer ownership of one of them to her daughter, who is also doing well. She now requires a $12,000 MXN loan to repay in 12 installments to buy hardware materials to offer a varied inventory so her clients can always find what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La Sra. Mariela P. 34 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Leonardo Mareco de 52 años de edad. Ellos tienen 1 hijo de 4 años.

Doña Mariela comenzó con este negocio con el capital adquirido por la venta de un automovil, aproximadamente en el año 2003. Ella se compro varias máquinas de coser y telas con la que desidió emprender su propio taller de costuras, en la actualidad tiene varias personas que trabaja con ella y una gran clientela ya formada.

La Sra. Mariela invertiría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías, y asi poder satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariela Portillos is 34 years old and married to 52 year old Mr. Leonardo Mareco. They have one 4 year old son. Mariela began this business with the capital she acquired by selling a car back in 2003. She bought various sewing machines and fabric with which she decided to open her own seamstress shop. Today she has various people that work with her and a well established clientele. Mariela will invest this loan in buying more merchandise and in this way be able to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu M., 39, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 260 Tala (~108 USD).  SPBD loans are Faatupu’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud M., 29 years old and married with two children, has operated an Internet computer cafe in the center of Hebron, Palestine for the past two years. The business is quite interesting but demands investment from time to time in order to retain a good customer base.  Mahmud is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to renovate his cafe.  These renovations will allow him to earn a higher income, thereby enabling him to provide his children with a better life.

loans.use: To renovate his Internet cafe

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married with seven children: two are currently in school. She lives with her family at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

She is a food vendor and sells banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She has been in business for five years now.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the village called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase salon materials in bulk for her business

loans.name: Juana Bonifacia

texts.es: La Señorita Juana R. cuenta con 27 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de Blusas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella, lleva 6 años en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Juana R. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is a merchant “who buys and sells typical women’s blouses”. For six years, she has been running her business out of her home in the village of Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac in the district of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Customer demand has increased, but she has insufficient capital to expand her inventory. This is why she has applied for a loan from Asociación ASDIR. She intends to buy additional merchandise so that she can increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Doris es separada tiene 42 años, tiene un hijo de 11 años que estudia en la escuela estatal. 
Doris trabajaba en una joyería pero la dueña murió y la joyería cerro se quedo sin trabajo y se dedico a la venta de productos de belleza  por catalogo hasta llegar a ser líder zonal, actualmente tiene  a su cargo ochenta vendedoras. Tiene en las ventas nueve años.
Desde que Doris esta en Finca aprendió a como controlar su negocio y como hacerlo crecer.
Doris necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para productos  de belleza por catalogo, 
El sueño de Doris es comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Community Bank "Melcochita".

Doris is separated and she is 42 years old. She has an 11-year old son who is attending the community school.

Doris used to work in a jewelery store but the owner passed away and the store closed down. She was left without work so she decided to start selling beauty products through catalogue. She has since become the regional leader and has in her team eight other sellers. She has been in sales for the past nine years.

Ever since Doris has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned to better administer her business and now knows how to make it grow.

Doris requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles to purchase beauty products through a catalogue. Doris' dream is to buy a car.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products through a catalogue.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline M. est une femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK 1 depuis trois ans et demi et y a reçu sept (7) prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Son petit commerce d'huile de palme, de miel et de citron lui procurera des bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. son prêt de 400000 francs CFA sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois
texts.en:
Jacqueline M., 39, is married and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack 1 for 3 and a half years and has received 7 loans which she has always reimbursed correctly. Her little business selling palm oil, honey, and lemons brings in profit that allows her to support her family.

Her loan of 40,000 F CFA will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her inventory in order to raise her income

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 46 years old. Theresa is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Theresa owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Theresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Theresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
La señora Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años, tiene 03 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Dany, es una mujer joven que le gusta trabajar, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de salchipapas, lleva 05 años dedicándose al negocio y con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito salchipapero y luego; poco a poco fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de salchipapa y comidas, en una esquina donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 5:30 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Dany, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Doña Dany is a member of "Banco Comunal "Las Orquídeas", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martín, Department of San Martín. She lives with her significant other, is 37 years old, and has 3 children who still depend on her.

Dany is a lady who enjoys work, she tells us that on her own iniciative she decided to sell "salchipapas" (hotdogs and chips) for a living and has done so for 5 years. In order to contribute to the family's economic income, with her first loan of jS/.300.00 from Movimiento Manuela Ramos and with the support of her partner, they bought her "salchipapas" cart and then little by little she bought her utensils and material to offer better service to her customers.

Presently she continues selling "salchipapa" and meals on a very popular corner and she tells us that sales are fine. She starts selling at 5:30 p.m., time when customers need a snack, she herself attends to her clients with politeness and charisma.

With this loan of S/.1,500.00 she will buy "javas" of chicken, sacks of potatoes, packs of cooking oil, and some kitchen utensils to replace the ones she has now and thus offer better service to her customers.

Dany is certain that her business will succeed better than at the present and is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to making her dreams come true and reaching her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa R., tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como agricultor y comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tiene un hijo varón de siete años , actualmente el niño estudio su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios , doña Maria desde hace nueve años se dedica a la agricultura ; ya que su mamá le apoyo para que trabajara las tierras , antes que ella se dedicará a  los cultivo era ama de casa, y abecés no ajustaban con los ingresos que su esposo. Ella con el primer desembolso logro mejorar sus cultivo y gracias a las instrucciones del técnico obtuvo una mejor producción y logro cancelar en tiempo y forma. Agradece ala institución por su buena aprobación con el segundo financiamiento el cual comprara fertilizante para abonar al cultivo de piña el cual espera vender a buen precio y tener buenas ganancias y llevar a  cabo sus objetivos.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y poder abonor el cultivo de piña

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: José Noel C. Núñez tiene 37 años, su actividad economía es la venta de cocteles y ceviches, el tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que todavía asisten a clases. Su negocio consiste en comprar pescado, conchas, camarones para preparar los diferentes platillos para ofrecerlos a sus diferentes clientes. Hace más de 5 años que inicio este negocio,  ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer sus servicios como obrero, pero al no sufragar los suficientes gastos de su familia decidió dedicarse a la venta de estos platillos, con el tiempo ha logrado obtener los suficientes clientes que le han proporcionado la estabilidad en su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es comprar un medio de transporte para ofrecer sus productos de una manera mucho mas rápida.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: K. Charlotte est née en 1979 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte est célibataire sans enfant. Charlotte n’est jamais allée à l’école ; elle fait plutôt le commerce des produits alimentaires tels que : les boîtes de tomate, de cubes, etc. Charlotte vit depuis sept ans  à Fifatin, un quartier de Cotonou. C’est  à Gbogbanou, marché de vente en gros de tous produits importés que Charlotte s’approvisionne en ces différents produits. Charlotte vend ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Charlotte a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans cette activité mais elle est à son deuxième crédit avec ALIDé. En effet, Charlotte veut mieux développer son activité, c’est pourquoi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Charlotte K. was born in 1979 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Charlotte is unmarried and without any children. Charlotte never went to school; Rather, she sells food products such as: canned tomatoes, bullion cubes, etc. Charlotte has lived for seven years in Fifatin, a neighborhood of Cotonou. Charloote buys her various products in Gbogbanou, a wholesale market of all imported products Charlotte sells her products in Dantokpa, a large international market of Benin. Charlotte already has seven years of experience in this activity, but she is on her second loan with ALIDé. In fact, Charlotte wants to grow her business. This is the reason why she requests this loan.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned tomatoes and bullion cubes for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica, 78, is a widow with five children, all independent. Though Veronica is old, she travels to the northern part of the country to buy tomatoes in bulk, supplying them to other retailers. This is a trade she has been doing for the past 30 years, and she wants to use the loan to buy more baskets of tomatoes to meet the daily demands of her customers. Veronica hopes to use part of her profit to support her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeb P., 40, and her husband, Mr. Khim Nhoem, 47, live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1986 and have two daughters; one of them attends school and other one is still young. And one son is assisting his mother in the business.

Chroeb has been raising pigs and cows for five years. Her husband is a policeman. She now is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase additional cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows to raise

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Felix H. se ha destacado por vender carne la cual la mantiene almacenada en una mantenedora y a la espera de que sus clientes le visiten para comprar la carne en su establecimiento en el municipio de Condega.

El negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años habiendo ofrecido tanto carne de res como de  cerdo. La razón por la que ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de la carne con el fin de continuar comercializándola en su local de tal manera que le continúe generando ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar que tiene a su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix H.'s business is the sale of meat, which he stores in a refrigerator and his clients come to see him to buy the meat in his establishment in the municipality of Condega. He has had this business for ten years, and offers his clients both beef and pork. The reason why he is seeking this loan is to buy more meat in order to continue selling it in his store. This way, he can continue generating revenue, which he uses to fulfill his responsibility of maintaining his household.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Miriam Eduvinia

texts.es: Miriam Eduvina  trabaja como directora de la Escuela Enmanuel Mongalo y Rubio  desde hace 16 años , vive en la zona  # 6 de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por dos hijos y su esposo, los niños estudian en la misma escuela que ella y su esposo trabaja como mecanico, quien le apoya con con los gastos familiares. Miriam Eduvina tambien  imparte clases en la universidades que existen en el Municipio para obtener  ingresos adicionales que le permitan que su familia pueda vivir mejor, esta solicitando su 8vo refinanciamiento  con AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda y terminar de construir la cocina de su casa,  pues actualmente la tiene en un rincosito de la sala; doña Miriam se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer luchadora, responsable que le gusta el progreso y ama su trabajo,  desde que obtuvieron su casa tanto ella como su esposo se han esforzado mucho para tener un hogar digno para su familia que cumpla con las condiciones que la familia necesita y su deseo es que sus hijas estudien para ser alguien en la vida, salud y trabajo.
texts.en:
Miriam Eduvina has been the principal at Enmanuel Mongalo y Rubio school for the past 16 years. She lives in Zone 6 of Nueva Guinea with her family, which is composed of her husband and two children. The children study at her school and her husband is a mechanic. He helps her with family expenses. Miriam Eduvina also teaches in the universities that are in the municipality in order to earn extra income that will allow her family to live better. She is asking for her 8th financing from AFODENIC to be used to make home improvements and to finish building her kitchen; currently it's in a corner of the living room. Miriam has always been a fighter, she is responsible, and likes to make progress in life and loves her job. Since they got their house, both she and her husband, have made every effort to have a proper home for the family, one that has all the requisite characteristics that the family needs. Their wish is that their daugthers study in order to become upstanding citizens, that they all have good health and work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her kitchen.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida J. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nida is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan Nida has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch N. is 39 years old and a villager from Chi Khmol village, Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Maney Soung, is a laborer in a local village. The couple has two children who attend the local school.
The family has had some problems because while this is a rice-growing season, they have not had enough money to support their rice field, especially since the soil is infertile and there are a lot of insects. Therefore, Mrs. Touch N. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide and rice seeds. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire laborers to plow the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide, rice seeds, and hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, es una mujer muy paciente, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre de cuatro hijos y dos dependen de su cuidado, ella se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es policía. Gladys forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace tres ciclos, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de telas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será invertido en la compra de telas, elásticos y otros materiales necesarios para la costura. La meta de Gladys es implementar la actividad que realiza adquiriendo implementos como: una maquina mini industrial, una remalladora, etc.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very patient woman who lives in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are still in her care. She works at home as a tailor, with the support of her husband, who is a policeman. Gladys has been a member of the “Las Dinámicas” ("The Dynamic Ones") communal bank for three loan cycles. She invested her first loan, for 300 Peruvian soles, in purchasing fabric. Now she needs a loan of 800 soles, which she will invest in buying fabric, elastic strips and other materials necessary for her tailoring work. Gladys' goal is to continue developing her business by acquiring equipment such as a mini-industrial sewing machine, an embroidering machine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric, elastic bands and other materials to make clothing

loans.name: Adija

texts.en:
Adija sells foodstuffs like bags of rice and cooking oil at retail prices. She is happy in her business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to grow her business. 

Adija is 56 years old; she is married to a commercial driver and they have 5 children. Adija is not only a wife and a mother, she is also a grandmother and this gives her joy. She hopes to lift her business and her family above poverty. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Baren Akinyi

texts.en:
Baren Akinyi M. is 42 years old, and married with three children. She stays and does her business in Nyalenda Kisumu Kenya. She started her nursery school business in 1992 after leaving her former job where she was employed as a subordinate staff.

As this business is her source of income, Baren needs to improve it so as to increase her income to be able to provide for her children. It is on this backdrop that she requires 20000 KES to help buy enough seats (plastic chairs) and also to renovate her classrooms by painting so that they will look neat and appealing.

In the future she wishes to buy a land/plot where she will be able to build the school to exonerate her from paying rent. This will ensure that she have sufficient savings.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and renovate the classrooms.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en: Normelita Y. is from the village of Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Normelita owns and operates a specialized retail business selling dried squid in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Normelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. Normelita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell (she us maintaining her loan amount at 9,000 PHP). This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income and support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amisha

texts.en:
Amisha is a 21-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and their 2-year-old daughter. Amisha and her husband are very close and work well together.

Amisha manages a coir business which she started five years ago. Her coir business consists of taking the fibers from coconuts and creating household goods such as floor mats or rope from the fibers. She is hard-working and gets along well with those around her.

Amisha has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy a new machine for manufacturing her coir products. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her coir business

loans.name: Sreyla

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyla K., age 30, and husband, Mr. Ranu Nin, age 31, (pictured here together), have been married since 2001 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Sreyla has been a garment factory worker since 1997, and her husband has been a mechanic since 1996. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn E. is from the village of Tuyabang Proper. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a hog-fattening business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Sreyyi

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyyi H. is 61 years old and lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yarng Pen, are farmers who own three hectares of land and a threshing machine to support their farming crop. This couple can earn a small income when someone rents their threshing machine. Mrs. Sreyyi H. now is requesting a loan to buy two wheels for the threshing machine. This couple has two children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other one is a student in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two wheels

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  señora Juana de 35 años de edad, esta casada con el Señor Baleriano Franco, tiene dos hijos uno de 10 años que esta en el 3er grado y el otro es de 3 meses.
   Ña Juana tiene una despensa donde trabaja diariamente y al mismo tiempo tambien le ayuda a su marido quien se dedica a la carpinteria por lo cual tambien se dedica a la venta de  muebles.
   Hace poco la Sra. Juana dio a luz a su hijo Arturo. Mientras tanto su marido se dedico fuertemente a la muebleria abandonando más el rubro de la despensa, pero piensan nuevamente incursionar en la venta de artículos de primera necesidad.
    Solicito el credito para la compra de Terciadas, Tela , Espuma, etc.
texts.en:
Juana, 35, is married to Baleriano Franco and has two children, a ten-year-old who is a third-grader and a 3-month-old. Juana has a grocery store where she works daily. She also helps her husband who is a carpenter so she also sells furniture. A short while ago Juana gave birth to her son Arturo. In the meantime, her husband focused more strongly on the furniture business neglecting the grocery store. However, they plan to once again invest in stock items for the store. This loan will be used to buy three ply, fabric, foam, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three ply, fabric and foam.

loans.name: Agness Nasumiyu

texts.en: Agness Nasumiyu N., 45 year old, is married with seven children and stays in Nambale, Busia. Agness could not withstand the economic dependency on her husband anymore and decided to start selling vegetables and potatoes in 2007. She buys her stock in Nambale and Butula twice a week. Upon learning of the wonderful contribution of KMET micro finance and KIVA, she joined so that she could get a loan of Ksh.10,000 to boost her business and later achieve her dreams of expanding the venture and constructing rental houses to enable her to uplift her economic standards.

loans.use: To Increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 23 years old and married, and she has one child. She graduated from primary school. 

The borrower is a tailor. She will use this loan to purchase a domestic sewing machine and cloth. The borrower has had a sewing business for two years and acquired a great deal of experience in her work. The borrower has a good reputation and is capable of attracting many clients.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina is the wife of A. K.. They both reside in a city called Multan, which is famous for its hot weather and history, in Pakistan. 

A very caring and happy-natured lady, Rozina stays at home; she loves to cook food for her family and take care of them. She manages the household chores in an efficient way and gives the required time to her kids. 

Her 55-year-old husband belongs to a dairy business. He has a buffalo that produces 8 to 10 kilograms of milk per day. He sells 1kg of milk for approximately 45 Pakistan rupees (PKR), so his average income is 360-450 PKR per day. He is the only breadwinner of his family and this makes him worry about how his family would survive if something happened to him.
  
Therefore, Rozina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy a dairy cow and increases his milk-selling business. The purpose of buying a cow is to sell more milk and save money for the rainy days. The saved amount will help them to run the financial circle smoothly and will improve the living standard of the family as well.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.en:
M. Kobiljon is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He grows vegetables and sells them in the market for income. He has been working in this business sphere for almost 15 years and has gained a lot of experience. 

Kobiljon has a large family considering that he is living with his parents. With his large family, Kobiljon works almost every day to generate revenue to support his family. Because of his family relying on vegetable growing, Kobiljon needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for his current harvest and in that way to earn enough money for supporting his family. This will be his first loan with IMON International and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo A. is from the village of Cabisera 27. He is 46 years old. Rodolfo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per cropping.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jennifer Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jennifer de 19 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa de caña, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. tiene un hijo de 7 meses con su esposo. 

Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, ella y su esposo trabajan juntos en su tienda vendiendo arroz, azúcar, carnes etc. Trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Ella quiere el préstamo para surtir mas su tienda con víveres como arroz, azúcar y carnes. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa de cemento y poder así tener todos los servicios básicos, y expandir su tienda.
texts.en:
Jennifer, who is 19 years old, has a small store in her bamboo house.  She lives in the outskirts of the city in an area called Fortín, which is characterized by its dirt roads and hills.  She and her husband have a 7-month old son. 

She has a small store in the front of her house.  She and her husband work together in the store selling rice, sugar, meats. etc.  They work from 8am -10pm every day.  She wants the loan in order to stock up her store with provisions like rice, sugar and meats.

In the future, she wants to finish construction on a cement house and to be able to have basic services in her home.  She also wants to expand her store.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, meats

loans.name: Zinakan Kydyrmanova's Group

texts.en:
Zinakan K. is the leader of the group. She is 53 and married. Her husband is a farmer. Zinakan makes her bread by offering a sewing service. She has been doing this for 12 years already, owing to the fact that she has vocational education. Due to years of working hard, she has managed to obtain multi-logic sewing-machines. The family wants to use this loan to purchase fertilizers for farming. In the future, they are planning to send a son abroad, then to purchase a car.

Sveta A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 46 and married. Together with her spouse, she brings up a son who is a schoolboy. Sveta works in the hospital and her husband is a builder.Out of their business profits they have managed to pay for the education of their children. In order to put money into agricultural development, the family hopes to get a loan. In the future, Sveta is planning to purchase a car and to arrange her son’s wedding. 

Rahat O., 28, is not married. She earns her living by working as a kitchen worker in a café. Her total earnings made it possible for her to begin house repairs. In order to finish it up, she needs to get a loan. In the future, Rahat is going to begin building a house. 

Kaken A. is 62 and a widow. She has been engaged in farming and agriculture for eight years already. During this time, she managed to arrange her children's weddings. The loan's purpose is to purchase petroleum-based fuels. In the future, Kaken wants to build a big house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school.  

Hadjah has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products for retail prices at the market.  Hadjah has requested a loan 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.     

She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to buy another plot of land.   

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 54 años de edad, separada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería  donde vende todo tipo de panes, pasteles, tortas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca a delante a sus hijos. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su panadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the community bank "Puntualito", which is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Vilma is 54 years old, separated, and has three children.  She balances her daily activities with work at a bakery, where she sells all types of bread, pastries, and cakes.  Her business allows her children to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to improve her bakery.

She is thankful to everyone who will make her dream possible through this loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Improve her bakery

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea H. is an older woman who has been living in Phnom Penh. Chea H. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Chea H. also travels to sell her medicine by walking around her community. She has six children: three are married and live away from home, and the other three are single and live under her management.

Her husband is currently a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Chea H.'s husband wishes to earn extra profit and make the business more successful by expanding his business, but he lacks the funds. So Chea H. will be using her loan to support her husband’s business to purchase a larger amount of used goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of used goods to sell.

loans.name: Betsy Mabel

texts.es: LA SEÑORA BETSY MABEL H. ASCENCIO TIENE ACTUALMENTE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA ESTA CASADA Y SU ESPOSO RADICA EN LA ACTUALIDAD  EN LA SELVA DESDE HACE UNOS AÑOS EL CUAL LE ENVIA UNA REMESA A SU ESPOSA PARA AYUDAR EN LA CANASTA FAMILIAR, TAMBIEN TIENE 2 HIJOS DE 12 Y 6 AÑOS, AMBOS ASISTEN AL COLEGIO. LA SEÑORA BETSY SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ACCESORIOS DE CELULARES DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS EN UN CENTRO COMERCIAL DEL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD, NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LA ADQUISICION DE MAS ACCESORIOS PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en: Betsy Mabel H. Ascencio is 39 years old. She is married and her husband currently lives in the jungle where he has been for a few years. He sends a remittance to help with the family expenses. She has two children ages 12 and 6 years old and both go to school. Betsy has been selling cell phone accessories for three years at a mall in the center of the city. She needs this loan to buy more accessories for her business.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for her business.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a pharmacist from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. Sameera's husband is a pharmacist too. They started their own pharmacy five years ago and have been running it together. Sameera and Sameer have two daughters: Rahaf who is 4 years old and Raghad, 2 years old.

Sameera came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase a large amount of medications as well as hygienic items which will increase the returns and attract more customers. Sameera is a religious woman, as are most of Gaza's inhabitants; therefore, Sameer appears in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase medications and hygienic products

loans.name: Qedumona Group

texts.en:
Ntombenhle is 34 years old and she is single with three children, aged between 9 and 15 years. She sells airtime and does photocopies at her home at Mtubatuba in South Africa (KZN). She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. 

She says that the she does not face any challenges because her business is small. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to help purchase another photocopy machine for her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her business succeed and she would like to buy and operate public phones. She hopes to use her profits to make her house bigger. 

Ntombenhle is the leader of her group of five borrowers, and is raising her hand in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a photocoping machine

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como odontóloga, la socia tiene un consultorio de odontología y por medio de este trabaja la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el consultorio de odontología. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el consultorio dental.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Communal Bank “Banco del Desarrollo” (Bank of Development), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Soledad divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a dentist. She has a dental office where she works so that her child can get ahead. Soledad wants to expand and improve her dental practice.
