She is requesting this loan so that she can keep her dental practice in operation.

Soledad is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Operating capital for her dental practice

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin T. was born in 1963, and she is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. She and her husband are fishermen who are  able to earn a small income to support their family. With their fishing, they face some problems, because they don’t have enough fishing gear. So, Mrs. Vin T. would like to ask for a loan to purchase fish nets and some other equipment for her fishing. 

This couple has four children who are all fishermen. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fish nets and some more fishing supplies

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es:
Zoila madre soltera crio a su hijo sola, tiene su propio negocio un cafetín en donde ella obtiene el sustento diario. Los planes para futuro que el nivel de vida mejore. Su hijo se prepare. Proyecto mejorar por completo su vivienda obteniendo comodidad y seguridad. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedra, piedrín, Bloques, alambre de amarre, clavos de acero, hierro, ladrillo y otros materiales.
Agradeciendo a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento social de su familia.
texts.en: Zoila is a single mother who raised her son on her own. She has her own business, a little cafe where she makes her living every day. Her plans for the future are to improve her standard of living, give her son a good education and improve her home to make it safe and comfortable. The loan will be invested in the purchase of building materials such as cement, sand, stones, gravel, blocks, mooring wires, iron, bricks and other materials. She is grateful for the support received to improve the situation of her family.

loans.use: Buy building materials.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites G. is from the village of Barangay 25, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old. Marites is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cellphone accessories in the local community. She has also started buying and selling used clothing as well as making and selling home made chorizo. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ea

texts.en: Ea K., 48, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. K. is a farmer and sells fish, earning an income of about $6 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $56 USD on food and $35 USD on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. K. appears in the photograph with her son.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna F. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Lorna is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada.  Vive con su esposo y s menor hijo en una  parte urbana del distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz a pocos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo este distrito, contando con todos sus servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica).

Erlita se dedica a la venta de cerveza y carbón desde hace más de 6 años. Y poco a poca ella ha ido comprando su mercadería, la creciente demanda del negocio de Erlita la ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.

Cliente ha ido creciendo económicamente dado que su nivel de vida se ha ido acomodando con el pasar de los años.

Erlita  a trabajado con nosotros anteriormente los ha cancelado con bastante puntualidad. Es primera vez que se le otorga crédito en modalidad de capital semilla dado que es un cliente muy puntual.
Erlita es muy conocida por ser una persona de confianza, muy respetuosa y responsable con sus clientes su  único objetivo de salir adelante y poder contribuir en su hogar.
texts.en:
Erlita is 40 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and small son in the urban part of the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, just a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  This district has all the basic utilities (running water and electricity).

Erlita has been selling beer and coal for six years.  Little by little she has purchased merchandise but now the growing demand in her business has caused her to think about expanding and acquiring more products.  She decided to request a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

Over the years she has been able to grow economically and her lifestyle has improved.

Erlita has taken out previous loans and paid them back on time.  This is the first time she has received a loan as seed capital since she is a well-paying customer.

Erlita is well-known for her dependability.  She is respectful and responsible with her customers.  Her only goal is to get ahead and be able to contribute to her household.

loans.use: To buy more products (beer and coal) for her business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells the local dish, kenkey, and serves it with okra sauce at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to store and to produce kenkey for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a kiosk for the sale of the food.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to store and to produce kenkey for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas esta formado por 6 mujeres y 2 hombres, quienes son amables y muy trabajadores, laboran en diferentes actividades las  mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus ríos y su naturaleza, las costumbres y traiciones de su gente y su  variada  gastronomía.

La Señora. Marcia vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia del mismo.

Nuestra socia tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 19, 17, 15 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo es discapacitado y sus dos hijos siguientes estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una compañía privada, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Marcia se dedica a la decoración de locales para todo tipo de evento social, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años y aprendió este oficio por habilidad. También  tiene el negocio de Internet y cabinas telefónicas, trabaja en su local de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de accesorios para su local como: mouse, teclados, tinta de impresoras, etc.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de uno de los socios que por su trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando fue tomada la fotografía del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Progresistas (Progressive Women) consists of 6 women and 2 men, who are kind and very hard-working. They work in different activities that permit them to support their households and help their families advance. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is knows for the beauty of its rivers and its natural surroundings, its customs and traditions of its people, and its gastronomic variety.

Señora Marcia lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. This is the fourth loan that she has obtained through the communal bank, to which she was invited by a friend who is a member of the bank. She is 42 years old, is married, and has children who are 19, 17, 15, and 2 years old. Her oldest son is disabled, and the next two children study at a city high school. Her husband is a professional driver and works for a private company. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Doña Marcia's work is decorating sites for all types of social events. She has been doing this for 3 years, and she learned to do it using her own talent. She also has an internet and telephone booth business. She works there every day without a fixed schedule. She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of accessories for her business site such as a mouse, keyboards, printer ink, etc. Her dream is for her family to have their own house.

The little photo attached in the corner is one of the members who, because of his work, was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy keyboards, a mouse, printer ink, etc.

loans.name: Akmatbek

texts.en:
Akmatbek is a 56-year-old villager, who supports his family by means of cattle breeding. In 2000, Akmatbek’s family decided to engage in cattle breeding. 

As Akmatbek was born into a farmer’s family and had wide experience in animal breeding, he started this activity with great enthusiasm. He used his initial capital of 9,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening and reselling and managed to increase the number with the monthly income of 11.000 KGS. Also, he began to cultivate wheat and clover which serve as concentration of forage for his cattle. With the revenue, Akmatbek gave a good education to his children which allowed them to successfully manage their lives. 

Now Akmatbek plans to use this loan of 25,000 KGS to buy more cattle for fattening and reselling. He wants to use the revenue from this loan to help his son buy his own house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
En el Municipio de El Sauce, departamento de león, el señor Luis A. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener en buenas condiciones su actividad ganadera. El se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador y con buenos valores Cívicos ha hecho que se gane el Respeto de muchas personas. 
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mantenimiento y reparación de su finca ya que cuenta con una propiedad de 90 manzanas de terreno, un buen inventario ganadero que le genera sus ingresos, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la chapia de potrero, para el repasto de su finca y pago de mano de obra para la mejora de su familia, con esto le brindara un mayor servicio y mejorara las condiciones de su propiedad.
texts.en:
In El Sauce, León, Luis A. is well-known as a hard worker on his cattle farm. He is well-respected in the community for his community values. 
He seeks a loan from Ceprodel El Sauce, to maintain and carry out repairs to his farm, which is 90 manzanas in size, supporting many head of cattle, his main source of income.  With this credit, Luis plans to repair the well and improve conditions on his grazing land, in order to better the conditions of his herd and farm.

loans.use: to maintain farm

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
This is Caren, 27, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Marcial, a welder, and mother to their child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide continuous income for their everyday expenses.

Caren operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Caren earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Caren hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Babou

texts.fr: Monsieur Babou est un tailleur de profession qu'il associe avec l'élevage dans sa maison.Il est agé de 41 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses 3 enfants. Il a commencé l'activité d'élevage depuis longtemps pour l'accompagner avec son métier de tailleur qu'il a appris dans l'atelier de son oncle. Ce qui l'interesse le plus dans ce métier c'est la création et la reproduction de nouveaux modéles trés appréciés et qui sont à la mode. Cependant, vu l'approche de la saison des pluies, Monsieur souhaitait emprunter 200 000FCFA pour acheter un taureau pour developper son élevage.
texts.en: Mr. Babou is a tailor by profession and he also raises livestock at his home.  He is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children.   He began his livestock business a long time ago to supplement his tailoring, which he learned at his uncle’s workshop.   What he likes most about this profession is the creation and reproduction of new, popular models which are in style.  However, given the approaching rain season, Mr. Babou would like to borrow 200,000 FCFA to buy a bull to build up his livestock business.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Shairkul's Group

texts.en:
Shairkul, 38, is treasurer of this group. She is married and has four children. Shairkul’s husband is a security officer in a learning center. Being inspired by Kyrgyz traditional style of sewing and successful designers, who made their business ideas come true, Shairkul dared to get involved in the sewing and textile industry. Five years ago, she bought her first sewing machine, some fabric and other sewing supplies for a total sum of 8,000 soms. Just like every newcomer in business, she was afraid of risk and lack of experience. She was amazed at how her works were accepted among her fellows and potential customers, and soon became widely known in her town of Tokmok as one of the best seamstresses and designers. Shairkul applied for a loan in order to buy one more sewing machine, because she plans to broaden her team. Of course, as any other designer, Shairkul dreams of opening her own fashion house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a God-fearing and business oriented 60-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with five children who are school-going. He has been engaged in the transport business as a bus driver to make a living. He makes an extra shilling from the sale of milk from his dairy cow. He wants in the next five years to be successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to pay school fees for his children. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Aliseyran

texts.en:
Aliseyran is a 55-year-old man who has lived all his life in Agsu, where he works as a farmer. He has two sons and two daughters, all of whom are married.

Aliseyran has an animal breeding business. This range of activities allows him to earn enough money to feed his large family. He requested a loan of 1000 Azerbaijan new manat (AZN) so that he can buy 10 sheep to fatten and resell at the local market in winter. Aliseyran dreams to provide the best living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and feed for them.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 40 years old and single. She has rental houses that give her a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She has been in the business for the past 10 years.
 
This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to build more houses for rent. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy a piece of land to build more rental houses. In the near future, she hopes to build more houses in other parts of Kitengela.

loans.use: To build houses for rent.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is a 43-year-old, divorced father of an 18-year-old daughter. He lives in his sister’s apartment with her family. He runs a taxi business with his own car. He dreams to have his own home someday and start a new life. He is seeking every opportunity to earn money. 

Now he has a plan to start a new business of construction designation. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy a mastic mixer machine to start planning his new business. He believes it will increase his income notably.

loans.use: to buy a mastic mixer machine to start planning his new business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Theresa sells different kinds of fish to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 250 PHP a day for these activities.

At this time, Theresa wants to borrow PHP 7,000 to purchase different kinds of fish, such as tilapia, bighead and milkfish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Alcione

texts.es:
Alcione pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Alcione tiene 63 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es contadora profesional y trabaja de forma independiente y su oficina está ubicada en su domicilio. 

Alicione también se dedica a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos de chompas de lana de alpaca y oveja. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. En esta oportunidad Alcione requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. 

Alcione agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alcione belongs to the “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank. Every thirty days members of the bank meet in the city of Izuchacha in the community of Compone.

Alcione is 63 years old. She is married and has two children. She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city of her birth, where she carries out her business. She is a professional accountant and works independently. Her office is located in her house.

Alcione is also involved in the sale of handicrafts such as woven sweaters made from alpaca or sheep wool. She has dedicated herself to this business for several years and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into the work. Alcione needs the loan in order to buy more merchandise such as alpaca and sheep wool sweaters. She is thankful, appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as alpaca and sheep wool sweaters.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David Antonio se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de tomates, cebollas, papa, bananos, plátano, zanahoria entre otros. En el negocio le ayuda su esposa. Su deseo es agrandar el espacio de su tramo de su negocio y tener más inventario para el negocio.
texts.en:
David Antonio sells fruits and vegetables. He has earned his living in this manner for more than three years. David started this business out of necessity so that he could cover his household expenses.

This loan will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, bananas, plantains, carrots, and other items. His wife helps with the business. David’s wish is to expand the space of his vending post so that he can have more inventory for his business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, bananas, plantains, carrots, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated her grocery store in Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years. She is 48 years old and has 3 school-going children.  

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to expand her grocery store by buying more assorted vegetables. She wants to create more space for stock in which she has seen a growing demand.

In the future, Jane hopes to become one of the leading grocery vendors in the Ndunyu Njeru area and to earn more income so as to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To  expand her grocery store by buying assorted vegetables

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Solicita un préstamo para poder mejorar la apariencia de su negocio y al mismo tiempo atraer a mas clientes, ya que podrá dar otro servicios de estética, como poner uñas artificiales, aplicar tintes, etc. que antes no se podían ofrecer por falta de equipo; tanto como Don Francisco y su esposa se verán muy beneficiados con el crédito ya que es la fuente principal de ingresos para su familia. Entre el señor Francisco y su esposa son los que atienden el salón de belleza.
texts.en: Francisco is requesting a loan to improve the appearance of his business and attract more customers. He will be able to provide more services, such as artificial nails, tinting, etc., which he is currently unable to provide due to lack of funds. Francisco and his wife will benefit greatly from this loan, as this business is the main source of income for his family. Francisco and his wife tend to the salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment and furniture; tables, mirrors and chairs, for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Rice farming is what Ma.Luz and her husband do for a living. They usually earn about P20,000 during harvest season in April and November. They culitivate a two-hectare plot of land where they grows rice. The couple has one child who is still in elementary school. As of now, the couple needs additional capital to sustain their rice crop so that it will produce an abundant harvest. Ma. Luz is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to use in farming.

Ma.Luz would like to keep growing rice and improve their farming practices so that it will enables them to make their business more profitable in the future. She would like to earn enough income for the college education of her child.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to use in farming

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Agnes” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kaday, on the left, is the leader of this group. The 57-year-old widow has five children – two in secondary school and one in college. Kaday has been a businesswoman for more than eight years now. She sells soft and hard drinks. She also sells sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy drinks in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to  buy drinks in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 47 years old and married with six children who are 2, 8, 13, 16, 20 and 22 years old. He does dairy farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years. He describes his business environment as favorable because he has regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to develop his business. He hopes to have five cows in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells maize and fante kenkey (fermented maize dough wrapped in banana leaves) in Krofoforao, near Abura. Ama has received no formal education.  She is single and has four children. Ama has been selling maize and fante kenkey for twenty-two years. She is responsible for paying school fees and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 14  y 10 años de edad, las cuales se encuentran estudiando con el deseo de superarse y en un futuro poder ayudar a sus padres. Maribel cuenta con un negocio en el cual se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas en su comunidad, a diario por las tardes ella saca todos sus utensilios y se instala en las aceras de la calle principal de su comunidad debido a que no cuenta con un lugar fijo y cerrado para el negocio. Maribel debido a que su clientela a aumentado desea   realizar un cuarto de lamina para instalar su venta de pupusas pero debido a que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios no ha podido realizar dicha construcción, es por ello que tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito FUSAI para comprar los materiales como: lámina, clavos y madera para la construcción de un cuarto para su negocio y así poder brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old. She lives with her life partner and her two daughters, ages 14 and 10 years old. They are studying, with the hope to get ahead and in the future be able to help their parents. 

Maribel has a business in which she makes and sells pupusas in her community. Every day in the afternoon she takes all of her utensils and sets up on the sidewalk of a main street in her community, since she doesn’t have a fixed and settled place for the business.

Since her customer base has grown, Maribel would like to make a corrugated metal room for her pupusa sales, but since she doesn’t have the financial resources necessary to do so she has not been able to build it. 

For this reason she has made the decision to seek a FUSAI loan, to buy materials such as corrugated metal, nails and wood for the construction of a room for her business, in order to give her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal, nails and wood in order to build a room for her business and offer her customers better service.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with two children.

He has had a food shop business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase more milk to sell and hopes this will help him to open an additional shop as well as a barber shop.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children well and grow in business.

This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to sell at his shop.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Maria de los Angeles F. M. is 47 years old, she is married and has five children. She has a small business, where she sells different meals and snacks. She started her business five years ago, because she needed to help the family economy, her husband is a construction worker and their income is very variable. At the beginning she just sold corn and tamales but now she has diversified and has a complete menu with several options of meals. She has a mobile kiosk where she works with two more people, one of them is her daughter.

Mrs. F. is requesting a loan for $1,100 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. This will be to buy a new stove because the one that she has is not convenient to offer a good and quick service to their clients.

SPANISH

La señora Maria de los Angeles F. M. tiene 47 años esta casada y tiene 5 hijos . Tiene un negocio de venta de comida que inicio hace mas de cinco años ante la necesidad de ayudar al ingreso familiar, ya que su esposo es trabajador de la construcción y sus ingresos son muy variables. Al principio solo vendía elotes y tamales, pero con el tiempo diversifico sus productos y actualmente vende comidas, cuenta con un puesto semi-fijo, el cual atiende ella misma y brinda trabajo a dos personas, una de ellas su hija. La Señora Angeles solicita un crédito por $1,100 USD a pagar en un plazo de siete meses, para comprar una nueva estufa, ya que la que tiene es insuficiente para brindar el servicio rápido a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy a new stove

loans.name: Mohammad Sarwar

texts.en:
M. Sarwar was born in 1962. He lives in a household of 6 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

M. Sarwar has a shop in the market selling fabrics. He already passed the 1st, 2nd and 3rd cycle loan with positive repayment and now he is continuing with a 4th cycle loan. He has 6 years' experience in his current business. At the start of his business his shop had less fabrics, but after taking a loan through AFSG he bought lots more. Right now he is able to buy all kinds of fabrics and sell them in the bazaar. Through this process he is able to cover himself and his family financially.

loans.use: To buy fabric and clothes

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en: Lanuola is a 38 year old woman.  She is married and has six children.  While her husband is employed as a taxi driver, his income isn’t steady and doesn’t meet the needs of her large family.  To ensure that her six children can remain in school and have a bright future, Lanuola opened a shop in her small Samoan village.  She has used microloan facilities to expand and upgrade her business.  While her store is profitable, the sales are still not enough to cover the family’s expenses. Lanuola feels that being a successful shop-keeper is the most promising means of becoming financially secure. Therefore, she is seeking an additional loan to finance further expansion of her product line.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Sokphorn

texts.en: Sokphorn was married in 1990. She has two daughters and one son who are studying in a local school. She is weaving silk products at home while her husband growing rice in the field. She is illiterate and her husband only finished grade four in a primary school. They are gentle, polite and honest. She asked for $200 in the fourth cycle from MAXIMA to buy sewing thread and silk material. Every year, they harvest enough rice from the field to eat, so the income from weaving silk is for extra food, to support their children for further education, and saving. She has enough capacity to pay back the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 33 years old. She is a single hairstylist. She has her own beauty salon which is located in downtown Caacupe. She has been doing this for the past 10 years and she has a steady clientele composed primarly of public figures and government/city employees.

Some of the type of jobs she does are manicures, pedicures and all sorts of hair cuts and/or hair styles, etc.

She tells us that her main satisfaction is that her dream came true since now she has her own beauty salon with all the neccessary equipment to do her job well.

She would like to build a glass stand where she would like to display other beauty products she would like to sell such as facial cremes, body lotions, perfumes, jewelry, etc. In order to be able to purchase these products, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 33 años, ella es soltera, y es peluquera. Ella tiene su propio salón de belleza que está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caacupé. Se dedica a este oficio hace ya más de 10 años y ya posee una clientela fija constituida mayormente por funcionarias públicas de la Municipalidad y la Gobernación de la ciudad. Entre los trabajos que ella realiza podemos citar: manicura, pedicuro, tintes, peinados, cortes de cabello, etc. Comenta que su mayor satisfacción es ver realizado su sueño, ya que hoy día tiene ya su salón propio con las herramientas necesarias para realizar hasta los trabajos más exigentes. Ahora tiene como proyecto habilitar en su peluquería un stand de vidrio donde podrá exhibir mercaderías para vender, como cremas, lociones, perfumes, joyas entre otros. Para poder comprar estos productos ella desea obtener un préstamo de $ 200.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as hand and facial lotions, perfume and jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza, a married mother of two children (8 and 3 years old), lives in the Santiago Primero area of El Alto. She sells food on one of the city’s busy streets. Her husband is a teacher in a rural area.

Esperanza would like a loan to make the final payment on a phone line for her home (in Bolivia, upon a given deadline, phone lines are purchased and made personal property). Owning their phone line would help the family be in better contact with others and have the ability to more effectively react in case of any eventuality.

This would be her seventh loan with IMPRO, with whom she has worked since 2003. All her previous loans have been repaid, and a review of her work and credit history indicate she would qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza, vive en la calle 1 de la zona Santiago Primero de la ciudad de El Alto. Se dedica a la venta de comida en una de las calles populosas de la ciudad. Su familia actualmente consta de dos hijos de 8 y 3 años respectivamente. Su esposo se desempeña como profesor en el área rural. El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado en la cancelación de la cuota final de una línea telefónica para su casa, (en Bolivia, hasta la fecha, las líneas telefónicas se compran y se convierten en propiedad personal) con lo cual la familia estará más en contacto y podrá reaccionar más rápidamente ante cualquier eventualidad. Es el séptimo crédito con Impro. Esperanza es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003 y todos sus anteriores créditos han sido pagados en forma regular. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito

loans.use: Purchase of telephone line.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Ms. Olga R. is 55 years old, single and mother of three children. The oldest is 29 years old and works as an administrative assistant at an underware elaboration factory. The 24 years old son is studying Business Administration. Finally, the youngest daughter, 19 years old, is a student and was awarded a full scholarship, which she is using right now, to attend Public Notary school.

Ms. Olga has run her diner for 20 years, where she sells turnovers, cakes and breaded steaks, which she elaborates herself. She also sells beverages, such as soda, beer and wines.

She wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of beers, sodas and ciders, as the present holiday season is when sales are greater.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Olga R. tiene 55 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. El mayor tiene 29 años y trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una empresa de confección de ropa interior, otro de 24 años está estudiando administración de empresas y la menor, que tiene 19 años, es estudiante y obtuvo una beca completa para la carrera de Notariado Público, que esta usufructuando en este momento.

La Sra. Olga tiene su copetín desde hace 20 años donde vende comida rápida de su propia elaboración como empanadas, tortillas y milanesas. También vende bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas y vinos.

Desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cervezas, gaseosas y sidras, ya que en esta época es donde mayor venta tiene, debido a las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages: sodas, beers and wines.

loans.name: Gulnure

texts.en: Gulnure S. raises cattle with her family in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Gulnure is 20 years old and married with one child and has been working in this business for the last three years. She is currently looking for funding so that she and her family can purchase more calves to raise for slaughter and milk production.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise for slaughter and milk production

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Lorenzo Group

texts.en:
This committee of women named, “The Women in the Fight,” has worked hard to ensure the safety and health of their families. They are all friends and neighbors and, together, they work to take out a loan, but they also plan activities with all of their families. These women have come together to celebrate birthdays and support each other in pregnancy, births, and through the ups and downs of their businesses.

Together, they are asking for a loan to invest in their different businesses, buying clothing, foods items, cosmetics, refreshments, and household items. They support each other and make sure that all of their loan payments are done on time.

loans.use: The women will divide the loan money according to the needs of each business.  The money will be spent on goods, like clothing, shirts, pants, perfumes, facial creams, food, meat, refreshments, and baking goods.

loans.name: Brice

texts.fr:
Born in HOZIN, a village situated in the province of OUEME in the 1970's, Mr K. Brice is married and father of 3 children. He is a woodworker by profession, and has been practicing his craft for more than a decade. In his workshop, he makes primarily tables, chairs and benches to name a few. The quality of his furnishings is very appreciated by his clients. For the last while he has experienced serious difficulties in the purchase of wood and other products used to make his furniture. He is asking for a loan to be able to quickly supply himself with wood, which becomes to expensive during the rainy season.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à HOZIN un village situé dans la département de l’OUEME vers les années 1970, Monsieur K. Brice est marié et père de 3enfants. Il est menuisier de profession et exerce ce métier depuis plus d’une décennie. Dans son atelier, il fabrique notamment des tables, chaises, bancs pour ne citer que ceux là. La qualité de sa prestation est très bien apprécie par ses clients. Depuis un certain temps il éprouve de sérieuses difficultés dans les achats de bois et autres produits servant à la conception de ces objets. Il sollicite alors ce prêt pour pouvoir vite s’approvisionner car le bois devient trop cher en saison pluvieuse.

loans.use: Purchase 50 planks of wood and 30 boxes of varnish

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
The group called Mujeres Emprendedoras from the city Itá had their beginning in May, 2006. It was formed by Marciana O., who contacted her neighbors to make up the group. They all have activities in the commercial realm. The group is very organized and united, they made it through the 7th cycle with excellent payment history.

It should be emphasized that all of them are very unified, within the group emphasizes the friendship and solidarity between them.

These women will use your loans for different activities like: the sale of food, underwear, clothes, coal, and basic articles for the home, etc.

They all understand the importance of fulfilling the commitment to the Committee and the importance of good relations between the members in order to achieve the objectives of the group and of course their personal objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado Mujeres Emprendedoras de la ciudad de Itá tuvo su inicio en el mes de Mayo del año 2.006. El mismo fue formado por Marciana O., quien contactó con sus vecinas para la constitución del grupo, todas poseen actividades en el ámbito comercial. El Grupo es muy organizado y unido, pasaron al 7º ciclo con un comportamiento de pago excelente.

Cabe destacar que todas son muy solidarias, dentro del grupo resalta la amistad y la solidaridad entre ellas.

Las mismas destinaron sus créditos a diferentes actividades como: venta de comidas, mercería, ropas, carbón y articulos básicos para el hogar, etc.

Todas consideran la importancia de cumplir con los compromisos del Comité y el buen relacionamiento entren las integrantes para concretar los objetivos del grupo y por supuesto sus objetivos personales.

loans.use: Sale of clothing, underwear, food, basic household items, etc.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State in Nigeria. She sells drinks, a trade she learned from her mother. She started her business in 1992 and her shop is very busy with customers. She is requesting a loan of $875.00 to buy more drink to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esmatullah

texts.en:
This is Esmatullah, son of A.. He is married and has two children, and they are the residents of the Ningarhar province. When he graduated from class twelve, he started working as a shop keeper, and he is still working in his shop.

Esmatullah is an active man, and he is attempting to increase his current level of his income to solve all of his family's problems. He wants to pave the road to improve his small business, but for this goal he needs some money to buy many things and find more customers. He applied to AFSG for a loan of 50,000 Afghanis, and he has decided to repay it in 18 months.

loans.use: To buy many things for his shop

loans.name: Julio Ines

texts.es:
Mister Julio Ines S. is married, 45 years-old, with three children aged 6, 4 and 2 years respectively; one of them is in the first grade, and the other two still do not go to class. His wife works alongside him. Both live in the village Austria, Leon Nicaragua. His business is the purchase of pigs, and he sells on an itinerant basis in local markets.

The purpose of the credit is to increase his working capital to maintain sufficient inventory of pigs, with which he covers his needs and serves as breadwinner.

This man's dream is to improve his living conditions in terms of housing, as well as to buy a vehicle that will search for pigs and transport them for sale. His business serves as an alternative to unemployment. By lack of study, he was unable to develop professionally – a fate which he does not want for his children for it requires credit as a way to expand business and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Julio Ines S., es casado, tiene 45 años de edad, con tres hijos con edades entre los 6, 4 y 2 años respectivamente, uno de ellos esta estudiando el primer grado de primaria, los otros dos no van todavia a clase, su esposa trabaja en conjunto con él, ambos habitan en el reparto villa austria, leon nicaragua, su actividad economica es la compra de cerdos en pie para destace ya que ellos mismos lo realizan ambos comercializan de forma ambulante en los mercados locales.

El proposito del credito, ha sido para incrementar su capital de trabajo manteniendo inventario suficiente como es cerdos en pie, con el cual cubrir su demanda y llevar el sustento familiar.

Los sueños de este señor, es mejorar sus condiciones de vida en cuanto a su vivienda, así mismo poder comprar un vehiculo que le serviría para ir a buscar los cerdos, así como para poder trasladar su producto al mercado. Su negocio surge como una alternativa al desempleo que por falta de estudio no pudo desarrollarse profesionalmente, lo que no quiere para sus hijos en un futuro para ello requiere del credito como una manera de poder ampliar su negocio y condiciones de vidas.

loans.use: For the purchase of pigs

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.es:
My name is Dora Elia O. R., and I am a seamstress and a hard-working person. In spite of my disability, I fight to go forward. My husband is retired and, as a result, he is not able to work. Therefore, we turn to this project so that we can construct a fence in the front of our house for our protection because we live alone, because there is a lot of insecurity, and because we are older people. It is necessary that we put a cement floor in the front of the house because of my disability and so that we can use my wheelchair more easily. 

Dora Elia O. R. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi.  Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

 Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi nombre es  Dora Elia O. R. soy costurera y una persona muy trabajadora, a pesar de mi discapacidad lucho por salir adelante, mi esposo es pensionado , y debido a esto el ya no puede trabajar por eso recurrimos a este proyecto para lograr construir una barda en el frente de nuestra casita para protección de nosotros ya que estamos solos y existe mucha inseguridad y somos personas mayores; poner el piso de cemento en el frente de mi casa es una necesidad  por mi discapacidad y para poder utilizar con mas facilidad mi sillas de ruedas.”

loans.use: To construct a fence in the front of my house

loans.name: Shagen

texts.en:
Shagen sells uniforms for workers in different spheres of life. His business is located in the central marketplace of his home town of Ordzhonikidze. His business has one big advantage: long-term agreements on uniform clothing supply from wholesalers. Shagen has been running this business for 4 years. Presently, his turnover capital is over US$ 8000. His monthly income is about US$ 900.

Shagen is married with two kids. His business is the main source of income for his family of four. Shagen works hard to meet his family needs. He believes financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. Shagen is determined to work on his entrepreneurial dreams; to make them a reality, understanding real success and wealth takes time. He is seeking a 2500 Grivna loan hoping to generate more profit as he increases his sale. Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Zuhura W.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Zuhura W. K. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children between the ages of 11 and 14 and is also responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents passed away. Zuhura has been operating a shop since 2005, selling vitenge (see below), bedsheets, sweaters, blankets, and gowns. Assisted by her younger sister, she works 10 hours each day, 7 days per week, currently earning about $85 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy new clothing to sell, and in the future plans to have a big shop for garments. Zuhura thanks you for your support!

Traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women is called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement A. is 45 years old, married with a child. He does upholstery, a skill he learned for 4 years. His area of specialization is car upholstery and he has been in this business for 13 years. He hopes to have a bigger place where he can attend to more customers. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to buy more upholstery materials for work. He says thank you.

loans.use: To boost the business to buy more materials

loans.name: Ruzi

texts.en:
Ruzi M. is 21 years old, young and full of energy.  He runs a cattle breeding business in a small village in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ruzi is a hard-working man who started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment.

He knew many people who purchased cattle and this motivated him to start his own business four years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well. 

Ruzi now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase additional cattle to sell. More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing. He thanks you very much for the support that you offer him in helping to expand his business and give his old parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. is a farmer in Prey Mech village in Kampong Speu province. On the plantation, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy an ox to plow the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Khut Thal, sells dessert for an income.  He uses his motorbike to carry a cart to transport the dessert. Mrs. Sopheap S. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only a year old. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field.

loans.name: Parveen Rahmat Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a 43-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is R. M. and he is a driver by profession. Parveen baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her daughter is 12 years old and stays at home and does household work.

Parveen baji is involved in a sewing business. She takes orders for clothes from her neighbors. Her daughter helps her in sewing clothes. She invests her income in a committee and plans to marry off her daughter when she becomes 18. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute inPakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he will be able to earn a good income.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shakra baji and Shazia baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Nasreen baji and Bashiran baji and Khalida baji each want a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Lilia Magaly,

texts.es:
Lilia es madre de tres hijos, uno de dieciséis, el segundo de catorce y el último de ocho años.  Siempre se ha dedicado al cuidado de ellos y al mantenimiento de su hogar. Hace un año su esposo era el único que llevaba el dinero  a casa. No obstante, en ese tiempo un grupo de amigas la animaron a formar un grupo de préstamos para poder invertir cada una en un negocio en particular.
Ella accede a empezar con el negocio de venta de ropa bajo pedido. Hoy ya lleva un año con la venta de diferentes prendas de vestir. Ahora su único deseo es poder crecer con la cantidad de mercadería para poder abrir una tienda en el futuro. Es por ello que sus ganancias las vuelve a reinvertir en compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Lilia has three children: 16, 14 and 8 years old. She has always dedicated herself to their care and to the care of her home. A year ago, only her husband was bringing an income into the household. Since then, a group of friends encouraged her to form a lending group so that each could invest in their business. She began by selling clothing on demand. For a year now she has been selling clothing of various sorts. Today her only wish is to increase the amount of merchandise she has so that she can open a proper store in the future. Because of this, she reinvests her profits in the purchase of more clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to retail

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Fausta S. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children aged 6 and 13. Fausta has been selling clothes and kitchen utensils since 2000. She buys the items wholesale and sells them retail to earn a profit.

She works at her business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Fausta currently earns about $300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more clothes and kitchen utensils in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Fausta thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and kitchen utensils in bulk

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dewi

texts.id: Setelah dua kali mengikuti program pinjaman ternak babi di Dinari, Ni nyoman Dewi ingin mengikuti kembali program ini untuk tahap yang ketiga. Di periode kedua yang sudah berlalu,  Nyoman Dewi memelihara 3 ekor penggemukan. Walaupun kandangnya hanya terbuat dari bambu, tidak mematahkan semangat Nyoman Dewi untuk memelihara babi. Karena dari 3 ekor babi itu, Ni Nyoman Dewi akan mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.200.000.- / 6 bulan atau Rp. 200.000.- / bulan. Di pinjaman tahap ketiga ini, Ni Nyoman Dewi merencanakan untuk menambah babi peliharaannya. Agar nantinya keuntungan yang diperoleh semakin besar.
texts.en:
Ni Nyoman Dewi participated in Dinari pig farming loan program twice in the past. Now she is planning to participate for the 3rd terms.

In her last 2nd term, she raised 3 piglets. She can earn a net profit of USD 110 for a 6 month period. In this 3rd term, she wants to raise more pigs so she can get higher profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine O., 29, is a mother of 3 children. She has one elementary student and 5- and 3-year-old kids. Her husband works as an on-call carpenter. With their present situation, Aida financially helps her husband through peddling homemade food such as longganisa (sausage), hot dogs and lumpia (spring rolls). She strives to prepare financial support for the schooling of all her children. For her first loan, she wants to apply for the amount of PHP 4,000 to HSPFI's  partner, KIVA.

loans.use: purchase longganisa (Philippine sausage) and hot dogs for re-sale

location.town: Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke S., 51, is married and lives with six of her children in Takeo province. Working a farm with her husband, Ke S. typically makes US$2 each day. Her family is also supported by three of the children who work as blacksmiths.

Ke S. is asking for a loan to purchase blacksmith materials for her children.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials for her children

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen makes a living selling various types of food and drinks. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell, and expresses her thanks and appreciation to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food items and drinks

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Neema M. from Mwanza. She is single with one child, age 2.5 years old. Neema has been running a beauty salon since 2008. Her business is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, or blue hair and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Neema currently earns about $150 US from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 US in order to purchase a dryer and long hair for re-sale to customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and long hair extenders

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio, la señora María Lourdes R. se dedica a elaborar diferentes platillos de comida los cuales son ofrecidos en el mercado Mayoreo que es donde tiene el negocio.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ella ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima y así continuar elaborando sus deliciosos platillos en su localidad.
texts.en:
With much enthusiasm for her work, Mrs. María Lourdes R. prepares different dishes of food and sells them from the wholesale market where her business is located.

Despite going through economic difficulties, she has managed to succeed in her business. She has come to Ceprodel requesting a loan to purchase ingredients so that she can continue preparing delicious dishes from her vending location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita. 
José es casado tiene 62 años, tres hijos mayores de 25, 22 y 19 años que trabajan y estudian.
José es Ayacuchano trabajando en varios cosas,  en amigo de los animales por seis años pero se canso y empezó a trabajar en una carpa en venta de caldo de gallina como ayudante, aprendió el movimiento del negocio   y con lo que tenia ahorrado puso su propio negocio de caldo de gallina actualmente cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan.  
Desde que José esta en Finca, aprendió a invertir ha recibido mucha orientación en el negocio.
José necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar arroz, fideos, gallina huevos.
El sueño de José es prosperar y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
José is a member of Melcochita community bank. He is 62 years old, married, and has 3 grown children (ages 25, 22, and 19) that work and are in school. José is from Ayacucho. He has had various jobs; he worked with the non-profit organization Amigo de los Animales (Friend of Animals) for 6 years but got tired and began to work at a tent selling chicken broth. He worked as an assistant in order to learn the business, and with his savings started his own business selling borth. Currently, he employs 2 assistants. Since José began working with Finca, he has learned to invest and has received a lot of guidance in running a business. He needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to buy rice, pasta, and eggs. José's dream is to be successful and have his own store space.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, pasta, chicken eggs

loans.name: Erving Manuel

texts.es: El señor Erving Manuel A. C. tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el barrio San José los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus padres , el es soltero , los planes hacia su familia es mejoras las tierras introduciendo diversificación de cultivo , para que en futuro logre tener mejor ingreso y apoyar mas a su papá , el desde la edad de doce años trabaja como agricultor , los rubro que le da mantenimiento es a la piña y al plátano , los planes hacia un futuro en su negocio es conservar su pequeña finca con obras de conservación de suelo . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Erving Manuel A. C. is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the San José Los Ríos neighborhood, located in the Ticuantepe municipality. He plans on improving his family’s crop fields by diversifying so that he can earn better wages and help out his father more. Ever since he was 12, he has been working as a farmer, growing plantains and pineapples. His future plan is to maintain his small farm by providing soil maintenance. He wants this loan in order to purchase fertilizer and supplies so that he can yield a good harvest and sell his produce at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and married to Jhon, who works as an engineer. The couple are blessed with one child, Nica, who is 11 years old and in elementary school. Marites has been a hairdresser for 25 years. She manages a beauty salon named after herself. With her experience, she has been able to set up her own salon and employ six people.

Treatments Marites offers in her salon include manicures, pedicures, haircuts, hair treatments, hairdressing and facial massage, all of which are very affordable. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to develop her business.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
La señora Elda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de pescado en hoja (comida típica de la Cuidad), donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las tardes. Lleva 08 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100.00 comprará: Pescados frescos en kilos, ya que los obtiene a diario, hojas bijao para envolver los pescados y algunos condimentos , para dar sabor a sus comidas.

Elda, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elda belongs to the communal bank "Las Orquídeas" in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín. She is married, 35 years old, and has two children that still depend on her. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the desire to get ahead by her own means drove her to start up her own business for selling fish wrapped in leaves (a typical food of the city). Little by little she became very well known among her clients and inhabitants of the community. Today she tells us that it is going very well for her. Currently she is continuing with the same business where she sells fish daily, in the afternoon. She has been working in this business for eight years and she feels very content with what she does. With this loan of S/ 1,100.00 ($400) she will buy: fresh fish by the kilogram, since she obtains them daily; bijao leaves to wrap the fish, and a few condiments to give flavor to her food. Elda feels at peace and very content with what she does, and she thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Florida  esta conformado por Rosa Argentina L., Aracely del Carmen M. M. y Pablo R.. Ellos viven en el casco urbano de Nindiri municipio de Masaya.  

La coordinadora del grupo es Rosa Argentina L. de 44 años quien fabrica y vende zapatos en el mercado de Masaya. Ella inicio su negocio familias por medio de préstamos y actualmente tiene dos tR. en el mercado y la fabrica que son atendidos por su hermana, esposo e hijos. 

L. esta muy satisfecha de trabajar con adim porque no es cara y es semanal. Además ella sueña superarse, que su negocio crezca y que su familia este bien.

loans.use: Para comprar materiales para fabricar zapatos como cuero, pega, hilo

loans.name: Gerald Nelson

texts.es: Gerald Nelson S. V. tiene 30 años de edad. Es un hombre muy trabajador. Se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de transporte, el tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que logro mantener estos pequeños contratos y ha logrado aprovecharlo ya que es por medio de este trabajo que su hijo ha logrado tener la oportunidad de estudiar, el siempre disfruta de su trabajo ya que recorre muchos lugares y así le da la facilidad de conocer más clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para invertir en su camión y proporcionarle ciertas mejoras. El sueña con mantener siempre activo este financiamiento ya que son muy necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerald Nelson S. V. is 30 years old and a very hardworking man. He has provided a public transport service for the last six years which is how he has managed to maintain small contracts, and in so doing his son has had the opportunity to study. Gerald has always enjoyed his work as he has travelled to many places and this has made it easier to meet more clients. The loan that he is applying for will be used as working capital to invest in his vehicle and make certain improvements. He dreams of making this loan a reality as the improvements he needs to make are invaluable for the development of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.es: Ambrocio C. C. de 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango del departamento de San Salvador. Ambrocio vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Oscar de 18 años de edad y Jesica de 8 años. El es un padre ejemplar, responsable con su familia, para Ambrosio es muy importante apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que como experiencia propia ha vivido las dificultades de no tener una educación escolar y lo difícil que es conseguir un empleo bien remunerado, es por ello que él trabaja día a día para darle una mejor oportunidad a sus hijos, Ambrocio maneja su propio negocio una venta de camisas ubicada en el centro de San Salvador, el destino del crédito que el solicita es para surtir su local variedad de ropa para poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ambrocio C. C., 48, lives in the municipality of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Ambrocio lives with his wife and two children: Oscar, 18, and Jesica, 8. He is an exemplar and responsible father; to Ambrocio it is very important to support his children educationally because he himself has experienced the difficulties that result from not having an academic education and not obtaining a well-paying job. This is why Ambrocio works every day - to give his children the opportunity to succeed. Ambrocio manages his own business selling shirts in downtown San Salvador. He will use the loan he is requesting to stock his store with a variety of clothes in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking his business

loans.name: Brian Albertico

texts.es: El señor Brian Albertico es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Alberto  se dedica a la elaboración de bolsas de hielo, bolsitas y bolis los cuales luego sale a distribuir en y algunas veces los ofrece en su misma casa. Este negocio ha sido unos de los medios de supervivencia más importante para Brian. El  inicio  su negocio hace 3 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue idea de su esposa para ofrecerle a sus hijos el sustento diario. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias primas para su negocio. Lo que el sueña es terminar de construir su casa ya que la compra de los materiales es muy cara. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Brian Albertico is married and has 4 dependent children. He manufactures ice packs, ice chests, and popsicles which he later sells for distribution. Sometimes he offers his products out of his home. This business has been an important means of survival for Brian and his family. He started this business 3 years ago and says that it was his wife’s idea to find a way to provide for the daily needs of their children.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase materials for his business. He dreams of finishing the construction of his house, but buying materials in order to do this is expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase materials

loans.name: In

texts.en: In B. is 48 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 per day, while her husband works collecting palm juice to refine into palm sugar. On average, he is able to make about US$3.30 daily . This couple has six children, two of whom are students and four are employed as garment factories workers and construction workers. In B. is asking for a loan of US$1200. Her husband wants to purchase a motorbike so that he can operate a moto-taxi to provide them with additional income. (In B. is pictured here with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia S. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Cynthia is widowed and has 5 adult children. Cynthia owns & operates a business providing transport services to community members with her motorcycle. Cynthia has been in business for over 15 years and has a monthly income of approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which is about $65 US.

In 2009, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to add the value of the services offered. This loan will be the first loan Cynthia has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy items for use in motorcycle taxi business

loans.name: Katerinauataliatalosaga

texts.en:
Katerinauataliatalosaga L. is 35 and married with 2 children (ages 6 and 10).  She owns a business venture, providing general clothing services to local community members and that is by sewing different kinds of clothes.  Katerinauataliatalosaga has 7 years of experience in this business.  Katerinauataliatalosaga needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Katerinauataliatalosaga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Katerinauataliatalosaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Katerinauataliatalosaga L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score.
