For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 40 years old and single. He has owned a restaurant in his town since 2000. The specialty in his restaurant is a special Lebanese food called falafel, and Hasan is well known in his region for this delicious food. He opened his restaurant after seeing a need for such services in his locality. His business idea was successful and allows him to control his life situation. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to increase his inventory and meet customer demand.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Blanca Inés

texts.es:
Blanca Inés C. es dueña de la Lavandería Blanquiset que maneja desde su casa, simultáneamente con la venta de productos de revistas especializadas. Vive en el barrio La Ceiba de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos entre 24 y 18 años de edad. Está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace más de 10 años, durante los cuales ha visto su negocio avanzar gracias a los créditos de esta organización. Recientemente su hija mayor graduó en la universidad y ahora solicita un crédito de educación para pagar la carrera universitaria de su segunda hija en enfermería superior. Aprecia mucho la educación de sus hijos y está buscando la manera de apoyar al más joven que está todavía a su cargo. Con este fin, se mudó al barrio La Ceiba porque siente que en un barrio de mejor ambiente familiar y más prosperidad, así que la gente es más estudiosa y son un muy buen ejemplo.
Antes trabajaba en una casa de familia a cuyo dueño lo contrataba una empresa para lavar ropa. Gradualmente el señor no pudo responder y por el comportamiento de Blanca la hicieron cargo de esta actividad. Luego se independizó y abrió su propia lavandería, donde comenzó con una lavadora de uso personal que le regaló su esposo. Durante más de diez años en la lavandería con la ayuda de la Fundación, el negocio le ha dado para comprar otras dos lavadoras, por eso se siente agradecida con la Fundación por la ayuda que le ha otorgado; a nivel personal su negocio le ha proporcionado  independencia y ahora se siente más segura de sí misma.
texts.en:
Blanca Inés C. owns the Blanquiset laundry which is located in her home. She also sells products from specialized catalogues. She lives in Barranquilla's La Ceiba neighborhood with her husband and three children, who range in ages from 24 to 18. She has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for over 10 years. During this time she has seen her business grow thanks to the loans from this organization. Recently, her eldest daughter graduated from university and she is now requesting funding to pay for her second daughter's university education in the field of nursing. She highly values education for her children and is looking for ways to provide for her youngest, who is still under her charge. This is the reason why she moved to the La Ceiba neighborhood because it's more family oriented and more prosperous so the residents there tend to be more studious and set a good example. She used to work in a private home, the owner of which worked for a laundry service. Gradually, he began to fall short of expectations and, because of Blanca's behavior, she was asked to take over the business. Later on, she became independent and opened her own laundry which she started with a home washing machine that her husband gave her. Over these ten years, with help from the Fundación, the business has produced enough to buy two more washing machines. She is grateful to the Fundación for the help it has given her. On a personal level, her business has provided her with independence and now she feels more sure of herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's college education.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom M. N. is twenty-eight years old. She is married to a businessman and they have two children aged eight years and six years to whom they hope to give a quality education.

Naom’s business is located at Embakasi, an established and growing business area in Nairobi. Despite the fact that her business is located in Embakasi,she is served by Kitengela branch. SMEP's clients who have businesses in Embakasi are served from this branch. She has been selling tomatoes, cabbages, carrots and kale to the hotel operators and the local residents for the last seven years. She says that this business is good but at times the income she gets is not enough to take care of all her needs.

Naom is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy potatoes and carrots to expand her business. She hopes to become a wholesale business in future. She is very jovial and respectful.

loans.use: To buy carrots and potatoes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Financing agriculture

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph O. is from the village of San Miguel, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 25 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Joseph owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members. He has been a habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) driver for four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Joseph plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Nancy Birmania

texts.es:
Nancy L. de 46 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es taxista ellos tienen 4 hijos de 27, 22 y dos gemelos de 13 años. 

Debido a falta de ingresos económicos en su familia decidió hace 2 años atrás utilizar una maquina de coser que tenía guardada y utilizarla para hacer ropa de dormir, poco a poco obtuvo ingresos para comprar mas maquinas de coser.

Por la buena decisión que tome ahora tiene muchas maquinas profesionales y gente que le ayuda a repartir la ropa que ella confecciona, trabaja desde las 08h00 am hasta 18:00 pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento y pinturas para readecuar su taller de confección. 

En el futuro Nancy quiere que su negocio de costura se convierta en uno de los más grandes de Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Nancy L., 46 years of age, lives in an urban area in the Guasmo in Guayaquil (it was so named because of the species of tree called Guazuma ulmifolia; the Guasmo is a popular neighborhood, comprised of humble residents, which was previously a hacienda). Her house is made of cement, and has all the basic services. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they have 4 children ages 27, 22, and twins that are 13 years old. Due to the family’s lack of financial resources, she decided two years ago to put a sewing machine she had stored away to good use making pajamas. Little by little, she generated enough income to buy more sewing machines. Thanks to her good decision-making, she now has many machines and people that help her make her products. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. With this loan, she would like to purchase cinderblocks, cement and paint to make improvements to her sewing workshop. Nancy hopes to, in the future, turn her sewing business into one of the biggest in Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cinderblocks, cement, and paint.

loans.name: Priyanka  Ranjani

texts.en:
Priyanka is a 42-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters (ages 15 and 7), in Hikkaduwa, a town in the Galle area of southern Sri Lanka. 

Priyanka manages a food processing business. Priyanka makes 'string hoppers', a food made from rice flour dough and a mainstay of the Sri Lankan diet.  Her husband also provides help to her business.  She prepares breakfast for many of the nearby villagers.  

Priyanka has asked for a loan of 25,000 rupees (LKR) from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy pots and a gas cooker to improve her 'string hoppers' business.  She wants to provide nutritious options for her family through the increased income that she hopes to earn.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy pots and gas cooker for making 'string hoppers'

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun R., 56, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is a food seller for an income of about $3.30 per day. Her husband is employed at the environment department in the town, earning an income of $7.80 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

R. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy fish to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy fish to raise

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn B. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is married and has three young children. To make a living, Marilyn operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos a month from it. In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small-scale entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Lorenzo De la Ciudad De Caaguazú, donde cada integrante realiza una actividad dependiendo de la facilidad con que cuentan.
La señora Zulma quien es la presidenta del  grupo es una mujer muy activa y realiza varias actividades para ayudar a su comunidad y a su familia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en un salon que ella posee en su casa, en el salon atiende su hija mientras ella realiza otras actividades.
Doña Zulma alienta a todas sus amigas a trabajar y salir adelante y al mismo tiempo aprovechar la oportunidad del credito para comenzar con algun trabajo que pueda ayudar  a su familia.
Ella solicita  el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su roperia especialmente para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
This committee organized itself in Caaguazú’s San Lorenzo neighborhood; each group member is involved in a different activity according to her means. Zulma, who is the group leader, is a very active woman who’s involved in a variety of activities to help her community and her family. She sells clothes in a room she has in her home for this purpose; her daughter tends to the store while Zulma is busy doing other things. Zulma encourages all her friends to work and get ahead and she uses the opportunity provided by the loan to start some work that will benefit her family. She is asking for funds to buy stock items for her store, especially winter items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets, sweatshirts, sweaters, jeans and other clothing items.

loans.name: Musahibe

texts.ru:
Musahibe jivet v Absheron regione . Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey . Yey uje 51 qoda. Eyo deti uje kajdiy imeyet svoyu semyu. Musahibe jivet s mujom,s sinom i yeqo jenoy. Na fotoqrafii vi mojete videt sina Musahibi (Elmir) on uje 8 let v etom biznese. 

SEychas oni nujdayutsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit apchasti dlya mashini potomu chto ona isportilas i v smeyu idet ochen malo doxoda. Chtobi uvelichit doxoq on doljen ispravit mashinu v blijaysheye vremya.Tak je oni nujdayutsya v uvelicheniye doxoda pootmu chto eqo jena jdet rebonka.
texts.en:
Musahibe lives in the Absheron Region. She is married and has two children. She is 51 years old. Her children already have own families. Musahibe lives with her husband, their son and daughter-in-law. On the photo you can see Musahibe’s son, Emir, who has been in this business for eight years. At present he needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to buy spare parts for his car because it needs to be repaired, and so he cannot earn enough income for his family. In order to increase his income, he needs to have the car repaired as soon as possible. In addition, he needs to earn a bigger income because his wife is expecting a child.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Faith In Christ Group

texts.en:
Janneh A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of Faith in Christ Group. She is 25 years old and has a 4-year-old child. Janneh completed the 10th grade before leaving school when she had her child.

Janneh sells drinks, fried fish, and chicken at New Georgia Junction. She began her business six years ago when her mother gave her 2,000 Liberian dollars. Her goal is to expand her business to include other areas of town.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour, and coal for her business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap P. (pictured with her loom) and her husband were married in 2002 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Their daughter attends school, but their the son is yet too young to do so. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sopheap has been a silk weaver since 1990 and taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. He is also a fisherman. Sopheap is applying for a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Rosalinda is widowed and has three children. She is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting corn crops for over 10 years now. Rosalinda says it has not been so easy since she lost her husband. She works hard to provide for her children. She was able to put up a sari-sari (variety) store to help with their daily needs. Rosalinda is eager to have all her children finish college and have bright futures.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and additional store inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and additional store inventory

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert G. is a 33-year-old married father of two children, aged 11 and four years. He is a computer and accessories shop owner and has been in the business for two years.

Robert is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD and with the money he plans to increase his stock of various computer accessories in his Kisimani shop. Robert hopes to open up a cybercafe in future and be able to educate his two children well in the best conditions possible.

loans.use: to increase his stock of various computer accessories

loans.name: Kuña Rory Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras D. la Ciudad D. Villa Hayes Chaco actualmente  se encuentra repitiendo el ciclo por motivo D. que 6 D. sus integrantes desertaron por motivos personales.
En su mayoría las clientas se dedican a la  venta D. artículos D. mercerías, ventas D. escobas que los maridos fabrican, despensa  y otras actividades. 
Y gracias al crédito concedido por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo D. superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando. 
Así una D. las integrantes es la señora Karina quien posee una pequeña despensa que provee D. productos D. primera necesidad a todos sus vecinos ya que en la comunidad no hay muchos negocios.
Ella posee una clientela segura, y así ayuda a si familia con el ingreso con la alimentación diaria que es lo más importante comenta ella.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mercaderías para su negocio como, yerba, azúcar, harina, fideos, leche, aceite, y otros.

Estas son las actividades D. cada miembro del grupo:
Karina - Despensa 
Isabel - Venta D. Bebidas 
Prudencia - Venta D. Ropa 
Lorena - Venta D. Carne 
Mirta - Venta D. Articulos D. Merceria 
Crusilda - Venta D. Minutas 
Esmilce - Despensa 
Fidelina - Venta D. Mercaderias D. Consumo Masivo 
Lidia - Venta D. Articulos D. Merceria 
Higinia - Venta D. tortas 
Modesta - Venta D. Escobas 
Dominga - Venta D. Articulos D. Mercerias 
Prissilia - Venta D. Lencerias 
Mercedes - Venta D. Verduras 
Rocio - Despensa 
Elizabeth - Venta D. Escobas
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women of Ciudad D. Villa Hayes Chaco Communal Bank is currently repeating a cycle because six of the members left for personal reasons.  Most of the members sell sewing supplies, sell brooms that their husbands make, have a small store, or have other businesses.

Thanks to the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, they have the desire to improve themselves and to keep going forward.

Karina, one of the members, has a small store.  She sells basic needs products to all of her neighbors because there are not many businesses in her community.  She has fixed customers.  That is how she helps her family get money for their daily food, which she says is the most important thing.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like herbs, sugar, flour, noodles, milk, oil, and other things for her business.

These are the activities of each member of the group:

Karina – Small store
Isabel – Sells drinks
Prudencia – Sells clothes
Lorena – Sells meat
Mirta – Sells notions
Crusilda – Sells food
Esmilce - Small store
Fidelina – Sells food staples
Lidia - Sells notions
Higinia – Sells cakes
Modesta – Sells brooms
Dominga - Sells notions
Prissilia – Sells lingerie
Mercedes – Sells vegetables
Rocio – Small store

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, milk and oil to restock store

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely C. is from the village of Molugan, El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Lovely is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lovely owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing and shoe products, and also dealing Natasha and Avon products in the local community. Lovely has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lovely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lovely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Muhamvi

texts.en:
Muhamvi is a married woman with eight children, six of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to town dwellers and neighbours. Muhamvi faces a challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes hard to get firewood from the forest. She hopes to establish a stall for selling firewood in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of firewood and charcoal for resale. Muhamvi decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Andreah

texts.en:
Andreah is a 33-year-old businessman who sells clothes in a very competitive area of Nairobi. His customers are mostly parents since he mainly deals in children's clothing. 

He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stock of children's clothing.  He is also employed in an engineering company and was previously employed as a casual labourer.  

Andreah is married and is a father to three children who are in school. In five years time, Andreah wants to be an established businessman with several outlets in town and also diversify into real estate in the future. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Andreah has been financially empowered and has also developed a saving culture. He describes himself as a peace-loving and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Bashiran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Bibi lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. She has lived there with her family in a three-room brick house for the last three years. Her husband is a driver by profession, and he drives a tractor in the fields. He works in the fields from day to night but earns very little, which does not allow him to fulfill the basic needs of his family. This is why he has decided to start a grocery store business. He thinks that if he spends his strength on his own business, then it will be returned with good profits. Through the grocery store he will sell daily use items, such as salt, sugar, tea, spice, cooking oil, and rice, to the customers.
This is why Bashiran has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah. She is hopeful that a loan investment will help her husband to start a new business in a positive way, and it will help her family enjoy a better standard of living.
Bashiran is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household work. She has a one-year-old daughter. She takes care of her very well.
Bashiran is a new client of Asasah, and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a grocery store business

loans.name: Mrs. Khann Thul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people make up this village bank loan in Trapeang Khnaor village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khann T. is the village bank president, selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.  

Mrs. Khann T. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she is able to grow rice to sell to support her family.  She is also a chicken breeder. Although she tries to work hard, she only earns a small income.  To improve her family's daily income, Mrs. Khann T. is asking for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy one hundred more chickens. 

She is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Nicasio Arcenio

texts.es: Nicasio Arecenio es una persona trabajadora que le gusta este medio de vida. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de carpintería, hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio lo inicio con unas ganancias que había obtenido de acerrar madera pues anteriormente trabajaba en ese negocio con el paso del tiempo es que decide establecer su propio negocio y empezar este medio de vida. el crédito de que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como madera, herramientas entre otras cosas actualmente quiere aprovechar la temporada festiva ya que tiene algunos encargos.
texts.en: Nicasio Arecenio is a hardworking person who likes his lifestyle. He provides carpentry services. He has had this business for more than six years; he started it with some income that he got through woodwork. Before, he was working in this line of business, and over time he decided to start his own business and begin this way of life. The loan he is requesting is to purchase basic materials such as wood, tools, and other things. He wants to take advantage of the holiday season and he already has some orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is a 48 year old widow with six children. Her children are aged between 10 and 28 years. She runs a grocery business which has been operational for five years and gets a monthly income of Kshs 1,000. 

Esther is borrowing her fifth loan of Kshs 2,000 from KADET LIMITED to purchase more stock for her grocery shop. She plans to open a mitumba (second hand clothes) shop with the anticipated profit from the business. 

She has future plans of opening a clothes shop and developing the family plot.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery shop

loans.name: Eliani

texts.es:
La señora Eliani Domínguez Pérez, vive en la localidad de llano Grande Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada, con el señor Ezequiel Pérez Domínguez, Y apenas  está esperando su primer bebe y está muy  ansiosa por ver lo nacer.
         
        Ella es la primara ves que también solicita el préstamo,  y es para invertirlo en compra de  mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes,  que es la que la ayuda a tener ingresos e n su hogar y con la que espera Salir adelante.
         
        Para iniciar con esta actividad la animo su papa quien fue que le dijo que para poder iniciar un trabajo  es necesario  invertir para poder progresar y luego ver el resultado, lo cual se le está funcionando  pues le está dejando buen ingreso.
   

       De los ingresos  que le va dejando de  toda la semana compra mas mercancía para que su negocio valla incrementado día con día y mejor sea su ganancia. 
        
       Su deseo es que salga adelante con su pequeña familia  que aun está formando, como también a horrar para  lograr construir una casa y ahí vivir más cómoda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eliani Domínguez Pérez lives in the community of  Llano Grande in the town of Coapilla, state of Chiapas, México. She is married to Mr.Ezequiel Pérez Domínguez and she is expecting her first baby and is looking forward to his birth. 
         
This is also the first time that she has asked for a loan. It is to invest in buying merchandise to supply her grocery store, which helps her have income in her home, and with which she hopes to get ahead.  
         
To start in this activity, she was encouraged by her father. He was the one who told her that to be able to start a job it's necessary to invest to be able to progress and later have results. This is working for her, as it is giving her a good income.         

With the income she makes every week, she buys more merchandise so that her business can grow every day and her earnings can improve.        
        
Her wish is to get ahead with her little family that is still being formes, as well as to save to be able to build a house and live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy mechandise to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo R. M., vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y junto a quienes reside en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Alfredo es un padre de familia muy responsable y un esposo muy ejemplar, ya que se destaca por siempre trabajar muy duro con el fin de poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia, la cual es su mayor inspiración para luchar en la vida. Alfredo se dedica a elaborar y vender confeti, el cual esta hecho de papel de colores y se utiliza en diferentes celebraciones y fiestas. Él solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de papel, y así mismo bolsas plásticas y diferentes colores de añelida para tenir el papel. El confeti Alfredo lo comercializa con tiendas y piñaterias, contando con clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo R. M. lives with his wife and their two children, ages 16 and 18.  The children go to school.  They live in the Cuscatlán department.  Alfredo is a very responsible father and an exemplary husband.

It is notable that he always works very hard in order to be able to give his family all of the best.  That is his greatest inspiration as he struggles in his life.

Alfredo makes and sells confetti.  The confetti is made from colored paper, and it is used for different celebrations and fiestas.

He is requesting a loan because he wishes to be able to buy a greater quantity of paper.  He will also buy plastic bags and different colors of aniline to dye the paper.  Alfredo sells the confetti to stores and piñata businesses.  He has fixed customers.

loans.use: To buy paper and aniline to make confetti

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Sufrir el desarraigo D. su tierra debido al desplazamiento por la violencia, así como la pérdida D. su esposo y uno D. sus hijos, han sido algunos D. los fuertes golpes que la vida le ha dado a Luz Marina P. D. O., quien a sus 60 años D. edad, recuerda esta situación con gran nostalgia y la tristeza propia D. quien ha sufrido esta realidad. 

Fue entonces cuando pasando por un momento difícil pero con la obligación D. sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos, Luz Marina, con la ayuda D. una amiga empezó vendiendo legumbres en dos canastas, desD. entonces se ha esforzado por hacer D. su negocio su fuente D. sustento y el D. su familia. 

Gracias a su empuje, Luz Marina cuenta con una legumbrería para la cual necesita D. un préstamo para comprar estantería que le permitirá organizar mejor sus productos para ser ofrecidos a sus clientes. 

Que el negocio crezca cada vez más es el sueño D. esta luchadora incansable.
texts.en:
Being uprooted from her native land due to violence, losing her husband and losing one of her children... these have been some of the heavy blows that life has dealt to Luz Marina P. D. O. who, at 60 years old, remembers the situation with the sadness of one who has suffered this reality.

Passing through this difficult period of her life, Luz Marina was also faced with the need to get her four children ahead.  With the help of one of her friends, she started selling vegetables from two baskets.  Since then, she has worked hard to turn her business into a source of maintenance for herself and her family.

Thanks to her drive and determination, Luz Marina now owns a fruit and vegetable store.  She needs a loan to buy shelves as this will enable her to better organize the products that she sells to her customers.

The dream of this tireless fighter is for her business to keep growing.

loans.use: To buy shelves

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica E., who lost her husband and is the mother of three children, sells both secondhand clothing and local doughnuts in a village near the coastal town of Elmina.  Denied the opportunity of receiving any formal education, Veronica is determined to provide a chance for her children to go to school. In addition to school fees, books and uniforms for her children, she pays for the basic needs of her family. 

With the help of the loan, Veronica hopes to increase her profit by expanding her business. To achieve this goal she wants to purchase more used clothing and extend the variety of clothes she sells.

loans.use: With the help of the loan, Veronica hopes to be able to increase her profit by expanding her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ana is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana is 41 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Ana has been in this business for 24 years.  In the future, Ana would like to sustain the family needs and repair her fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new car and cover house expenses

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda A. is from the village of Carikkikan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a four member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Yolanda is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $47 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es una madre separada de 28 años de edad. El hijo de Viviana tiene 9 años.  Desde el nacimiento de su pequeño hijo, ellos viven en casa de la madre de Viviana en la zona urbano-marginal (condición pobre) del distrito de La Victoria- Chiclayo.

El distrito de La Victoria, es una comunidad de comerciantes y Viviana es uno de ellos. Viviana se dedica, desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa, zapatos y artículos de vestir. Viviana no sólo vende su mercadería en  La Victoria, sino que sus ventas se han extendido a lo largo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, esto se debe a la buena calidad de sus productos y a la venta a crédito que ella realiza. Viviana  también tiene ingresos adicionales por la venta de tamales (alimento tradicional peruano, hecho a base de maíz molido seco) que realiza junto a su madre.

Viviana ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1800 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra de productos de temporada para su negocio, estos productos han sido solicitados por sus clientes. Con la ganancia obtenida de estas ventas, Viviana podrá pagar la educación de su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Viviana is a mother, separated, and 28 years old. Viviana’s son is 9 years old. Since the birth of her little son, they have lived in Viviana’s mother’s house in the peri-urban area (poor) of the district of La Victoria-Chiclayo.

The district of La Victoria is a merchant community and Viviana is one of those.  For the last 5 years, Viviana has been selling clothes, shoes and other items to wear. Viviana not only sells her merchandise in La Victoria, but has also extended her sales throughout the city of Chiclayo.  This is due to the good quality of her products and that she sells on credit. Viviana gets additional income from selling tamales (traditional Peruvian food made from dried milled corn), which she does with her mother. 

Viviana has requested a loan of 1800 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will invest in the purchase of seasonal products for her business. These products have been requested by her customers.  With the profit from these sales, Viviana will be able to pay for her young son’s education.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells kenkey and porridge at Kwaprow, near Abura, in Cape Coast. Demands for the porridge have increased and so, Akjoa needs a loan to buy millet, sugar, pepper and other items to make millet porridge for sale. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa is responsible for helping her husband pay the bills of the home. In this picture she is scooping some of the porridge out with a ladle.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, pepper and other items to make millet porridge for sale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is 31 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Thelma has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Aliaa

texts.en:
Aliaa is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children.

Everyone who knows Aliaa has seen her childlike spirit and has advised her to work in a daycare, which was a tempting idea for her, but she wanted to stay at home and be with her children in their early years. That was one of the reasons that lead her to open a small daycare at her house that will allow her to stay with her children and take care of others’.

Living in an active place in Abu Alanda where a lot of women go out of the home to work is one of the reasons why her daycare has succeeded, and by the word of mouth of those women she has now a good number of clients to serve.

Due to the increase in the number of children, Aliaa now is applying for a loan to buy more toys and mattresses for kids to rest and play, and to add more safety equipment for those kids.

loans.use: To buy more toys and mattresses for kids to rest and play at the daycare.

loans.name: Jenny Rosario

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa interior tanto de damas, caballeros y niños, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  a base de pedidos que sus clientes le realizan, trabaja tres días a la semana de tres a cuatro horas dependiendo del tiempo que tenga, ya que también tiene que estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y del hogar en general. Nos cuenta que lleva un año y medio  y que le ha ido muy bien ya que con estos ingresos ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños.  Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella pudo poner su negocio. 

Su sueño es  tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo Community Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the town of Portoviejo. It’s well known as a business hub, as well as for its traditional festivals and its fun-loving people.

32-year old Sra. Jenny lives there. She is married and has two children aged 9 and 2. The older one attends school. Her husband is a businessman. As well as being a good housewife, Jenny sells men’s, women’s, and children’s underwear door to door. Depending on the orders she gets from her customers and the time she has available, she works three days a week, three to four hours a day, as she also has to attend to the needs of her children and the house in general.
 
Jenny has been doing this work for a year and a half and all has gone very well. She is able to help her husband with household expenses. She goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise whenever new stock is needed. 

With the loan Jenny plans to buy more underwear. This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she enjoys being a member as with one of the loans she was able to start a business. Her dream is own a second business.

loans.use: to buy men’s, women’s, and children’s underwear

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim would like to open a wedding salon to prepare brides and grooms for their wedding and wedding photographs. She will perform hair styling, makeup application and help them prepare their outfits. Preparing for the wedding and photographs is very important in Khmer culture. She has been doing these activities informally for some time but would like to open a shop so that she can serve more clients. This is the reason she is requesting funding from Kiva.

Mrs. Yim resides in Siem Reap province. She is a gasoline seller in her community and is earning approximately US $3 each day to cover her family’s needs. She has a life partner in her husband who provides ferry boat delivery services for all passengers and other villagers. They have a kid who is very young and depends on her care.

loans.use: to open a wedding salon.

loans.name: Asseta

texts.fr:
Mme Asseta est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Tous vont à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle confectionne et vend des chapeaux, des chemises d’homme depuis 1an et demi. Mme s’approvisionne dans les merceries de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont  les membres des Eglises et surtout les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 12 roulots de tissus pour les chapeaux et 10 mètres de tissus pour les chemises.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices et s’occupe aussi de ses besoins personnels. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour son activité et aider son mari à s’occuper de de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Asseta is a married woman and the mother of three children. The eldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 10. All of them go to school. She has one person to support. Asseta has been making and selling hats and men's shirts for a year and a half. She is supplied from sewing stores in Ouagadougou. Her customers are church members and women in particular. 

She wants to buy 12 rolls of cloth for making hats and 10 meters of cloth for making shirts. 

She is saving her profits and also meeting her personnel needs. Her ambition is to open a store for her business and to help out her husband to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 12 rolls of cloth for making hats and 10 meters of cloth for making shirts

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Enkhtur is 42 and divorced. He lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a good driver and has been running a taxi business for 11 years.  He owns a house and a small-sized piece of land. 

He wants to install a low pressure furnace in his house.  If he can do it, his house will become warmer and more comfortable to live in. So he is taking a loan to cover the new furnace payment.

loans.use: To cover the new furnace payment of his house.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with four children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and rice retailing.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is married and has one child. Rafaela is 48 years old and lives in Brgy. Caitican, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Rafaela is engaged in buying and selling vegetables to earn a living. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more bulk vegetables of different kinds so that she can make a bigger profit.

Rafaela has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, she hopes to have bigger income for her family with the help of her husband and will be engaged in buying and selling fruits, too.

loans.use: to purchase more bulk vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: Ken is 22 years old and single. He runs a barber shop so as to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for three years and has employed one person. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Ken hopes to open other branches of his business in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to open another barber shop.

loans.use: to open another barber shop

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha has applied for a loan with Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business of selling animals. He buys goats and sheep, raises them, and then sells on Eid (a Muslim festival) to butchers for a profit. With the loan, he will buy goats and sheep to sell at higher profits. 

Martha herself is a seamstress. She sews very good quality clothes that earn her good profits every month. Her customers are mostly her community members who trust her work and place regular orders with her every month. 

She has given birth to five children; all of them are enrolled in a local school getting their education. She is a very caring mother and she works very hard in her business in order to pay for her children’s education.
 
She is very confident that an investment will be productive for her husband and will improve his business condition. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application with Asasah.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for selling.

loans.name: Еrkinjon

texts.ru: Эркинджон трудолюбивый и ответственный. У него крепкая и дружная семья, жена и 2 детей. Он  уже 11 лет занимается в сфере транспортных услуг. Эркинджон перевозит пассажиров с одного города на другой.  У него много постоянных клиентов, которые обращаются к нему за помощью. Он очень  отзывчивый, поэтому имеет хорошую репутацию. Эркинджон хочет получить займ на сумму 1000$ США для ремонта своей автомашины, впереди зима и он хочет подготовить машину к зимним условиям. Он очень надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарит вас заранее за понимание.
texts.en: Еrkinjon is a hard-working and responsible person.  He has a strong and friendly family - a wife and two children.  He has been involved in the transportation field for 11 years.  Еrkinjon transports passengers from one town to another.  He has many loyal customers, who come to him for help.  He is very responsive and that is why he has a good reputation.  Еrkinjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 to repair his car and prepare it for the winter conditions.  He relies on your support and thanks you in advance for your understanding.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 12 years old. Her husband works as a Barangay official and a chainsaw operator.

Anabella has been in the business of raising hogs for 9 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Anabella would like to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita tiene 36 años, es una mujer alegre, luchadora y emprendedora. Esta separada de su esposo pero vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos, de su hermana y de su tres menores hijos. La actividad que realiza Lita, es la costura, oficio que aprendió viendo a sus amigas. De esa manera decidió hace dos años montar este negocio, y actualmente es muy solicitada por el trabajo que realiza, y por ello ha logrado captar mucha clientela. Además cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor, que también está aprendiendo este oficio, y eso le llena de orgullo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sustanciales con el cual pueda pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Sin embargo tiene mucho trabajo por hacer que no se da abasto, a pesar que su hija la apoya, por lo que tiene que trabajar hasta muy tarde para poder terminar y entregar los pedidos en la fecha solicitada. Su anhelo es ampliar su negocio, instalando más maquinas de costura y contratar personal. Este sería el primer crédito con MFP, se siente contenta poder contar con un capital de trabajo gracias a la institución, así poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Con el préstamo solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos para costura.
texts.en:
Lita is 36 years old and a cheerful, determined, and enterprising woman. She is separated from her husband, so she lives with her parents in their home along with her sister and her three young children. Lita is a seamstress and learned how to sew by watching her friends. She decided to establish her business two years ago. Lita currently receives many orders for her work and has been able to attract many customers. Her oldest daughter helps her and is learning the trade, which makes her proud. What Lita enjoys most about her work is that it has enabled her to earn income by which she can pay for her own household expenses and provide a better quality of life for her children. Even though she has her daughter to help her, Lita has not been able to cope with the large amount of work. As a result, she has had to work late so that she can finish orders in time to be delivered on the dates requested by her customers. Her wishes are to expand her business, install more sewing machines, and hire workers.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Lita is pleased to have operating capital from the organization so that she can deliver her outstanding orders. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and thread for sewing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa  is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She has operated a retail shop in Likoni, in Mombasa, for the last ten years. The business is doing well.

This marks Basilisa’s third borrowing from KADET to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock, such as maize and wheat flours, cooking oil and sugar, for her shop.

Basilisa’s clients are mainly from Likoni. She hopes to use the anticipated profits from this loan to repay her loan and to expand her business. Basilisa hopes to do well in business and to have a happy, healthy family.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flours, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Koli

texts.fr:
Koli est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont  à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.  
Koli travaille comme couturière depuis 2004. Elle est couturière et vend des articles de mercerie pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment elle n’a pas de difficulté. 
Koli a requis son 3ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koli voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit  prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koli is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a driver, and has two children who attend school. The first is 12 years old and the last is 9.

Koli has been working as a seamstress since 2004. She is a trained seamstress and sells sewing supplies to all-comers from her home. She resupplies in Lome. She works alone, and at this time is experiencing no difficulties.

Koli requested her third WAGES credit loan to purchase sewing supplies, as she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Koli would like to open a shop. She said that with the profits she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es: Sindy de 23 años de edad, es una joven empeñosa y trabajadora, además de alegre y sociable, es soltera, vive en compañía de su padre, madre y sus dos hermanos de 24 y 15 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en casa de sus padres. Sindy tiene un negocio familiar que comparte con sus padres y hermanos, siendo ella la administradora de dicho negoico. Pues consiste en la fabricación de cocinas de lata que funciona a carbón, actividad que se inició hace 10 años, y es fue por iniciativa de uno de sus cuñados, quien le enseñó ese oficio a su padre, y del que luego transmitiera estos conocimientos a sus hijos. Actualmente su negocio ha crecido, y tiene mucha demanda del producto, en donde todos los miebros de su familia participan, asimismo cuentan con el apoyo de ayudante al que pagan por cocina elaborada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le ayuda a solventar sus gastos del hogar, así como la unión familiar que se da gracias al negocio. Al contrario lo que le desagrada un poco es el desorden que se ocasiona con los materiales que usan, por eso tienen planes de ampliar su negocio, y mas adelante también incursionar en otros rubros como abrir una tienda de librería y bazar. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para su negocio como parrillas, laminas de lata, pinturas.
texts.en:
Sindy, 23, is an enterprising, hardworking young woman in addition to being very sociable.  She’s single and lives comfortably in her parents’ house with her father, her mother and two siblings who are 24 and 15 years old.


Sindy has a family business that she shares with her parents and siblings; she is the manager.  It consists in manufacturing metal, coal-burning stoves.  She started this activity 10 years ago thanks to the initiative of one of her brothers-in-law who taught this occupation to her father and then he passed down these skills to his children.


The business has grown and the product is in high demand.  All the family members participate and they also have a helper who is paid by the completed unit.  What she likes about her activity is the income which helps to cover household expenses as well as the family unity that the business creates.  On the other hand, she dislikes somewhat the mess the materials they use cause and this is why they have plans to enlarge the business as well as going into other business later on like opening a stationery shop and a store.


This will be the first MFP loan so she hopes that this small loan will lead to her reaching her goals.  She feels good in her communal bank because she knows the members and she considers them to be good people.  She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy materials for the business like grilles, metal sheets and paint.

loans.use: to buy grilles, metal sheets and paint.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and a farmer from the village of Ortabatumi, West Georgia. He lives with his family: his wife, Nargiz, and his 18-year-old daughter, Ilona. Ilona goes to school. David works in a local construction company. He works hard at his job, but still finds time to work on the family farm, which is an additional source of the income for the family. 

They have a dairy cow. Nargiz produces cheese and sells it at the local market. The family also has 0.5 hectares of land, on which they grow tangerines. Nargiz sells the harvested citrus to green grocer retailers. Their total average monthly income is 800 Laris. 

With the requested loan, David will purchase another dairy cow. The family will double their production and sale of cheese and increase their income. They will be able to purchase additional household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tania Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Tania tiene su negocio de venta de plátanos en unos de los mercados de la capital, ella es casada con dos hijos uno de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar y el otro todavía no tiene edad para ingresar al colegio.
Ella trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las siete de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.
Ella acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como es la compra de plátanos verdes y maduros para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Tania owns a business selling plantains in one of the markets of the capital. She is married with two children, one of whom is school aged, while the other is still two young to start school. 

Tania works from Monday to Saturday from 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. She came to the offices of Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase merchandise such as green and ripe plantains for her business.

loans.use: to buy green and ripe plantains.

loans.name: Marcia Isabel

texts.es:
Marcia de 35 años es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere que su servicio de venta de comida mejore. Comenzó su negocio de venta de comida con su esposa hace unos años atrás   

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 12:00 haciendo platos para venderlos a sus clientes. Los platos que cocina son los tradicionales como caldo de pata, caldo de bolas, legumbres, arroz con menestra y carnes etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de continuar con su negocio ya que le ayuda a mejorar su estilo de vida y de sus hijos. Quiere comprar con el préstamo carnes, legumbres, frutas, granos para hacer platos variados.
texts.en:
Marcia, 35, is a hardworking woman who has many aspirations for her business. Consequently, she wants to improve her food selling service. She started her food selling business with her husband several years ago.

Currently she works from 8 a.m. until 12 noon making dishes to sell to her customers. Her dishes are traditional ones such as caldo de pata (cow hooves soup), caldo de bolas (plantain dumplings soup), vegetables, rice with beans and meat, etc. 

She has many aspirations to continue her business since it is helping her to improve her life style and that of her children. She wants to use the loan to buy meat, vegetables, fruit and grains in order to make her varied dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fruit and grains.

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio, el trabaja como profesor de uno de los colegios de la comunidad donde habita, este emprendedor tiene una vivienda en el cual le quiere realizar algunas mejoras pero por falta de dinero no las había podido hacer. Gracia al financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado es que  ha podido realizar sus sueños como es la mejora de su casa para el bienestar de su familia con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: ladrillos, tejas, madera, cemento entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio is 23 years old.  He works as a teacher at one of the high schools in the community where he lives.  He already has years of experience as a teacher.  

This enterprising young man has a house on which he wants to do some repairs, but because of a lack of money, he has not done them.  He needs to finish them because the rainy season is coming and its urgent that he do the repairs.  

Alexander Antonio is asking for this loan to purchase bricks, tiles, wood, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, tiles, wood, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerza, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo, es socia de FINCA Perú más de 1 año, tiene su bodega, estando en Finca logró incrementar su mercadería, también aprendió a ahorrar y a manejar bien su negocio, donde sabe distribuir sus ganancias. Gracias a FINCA Peru pudo comprar los muebles de su casa. Marleny solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, dried vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: 30 años de edad, dos hijos que no superan los 10 años de edad, son algunas de las características que describen a Martha la cual a la hora de buscar un empleo no tuvo éxito y es por esto y más que todo por necesidad que hace un año comenzó con un negocio de venta de productos como jeans, camisetas, lociones con lo que ha podido generar un capital para vivir cómodamente con sus hijos, solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido y ofrecer más variedad pues sabe que la clave del éxito de este negocio está en la innovación y os precios con este crédito espera tener un mejor estilo de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, 30, has two children under the age of ten.  She was unsuccessful when it came to finding a job so a year ago, out of necessity, she started a business selling products such as jeans, shirts and lotions.  With this activity, she has been able to generate an income to live comfortably with her children.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock and offer more variety because she knows that the key to the success of this business lies with innovation and reasonable prices.  With this loan she hopes to have a better lifestyle for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy goods such as clothes, jeans, skirts, perfumes and personal care products.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Doña Aracely, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y es residente de una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.   Doña Aracely realiza tres actividades para generar ingresos, tiene establecida una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar, realiza costura cuando le solicitan y elabora y vende tortillas de maíz. Siempre se ha dedicado a obtener sus propios ingresos para mantener a su familia. El prestamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo con ODEF y es por 25,000 lempiras  para comprar maíz para hacer tortillas y compra de azúcar, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, churros, lácteos, productos de aseo, y otros abarrotes para surtir su pulpería. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio para salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Compra de maíz para hacer tortillas y compra de azúcar, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, churros, lácteos, productos de aseo, y otros abarrotes para surtir su pulpería.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
K. Molly is an active member of Life in Africa who though looks to be almost living in her evening of life but but still capable of looking after her four children without the help of her husband who is actually more aged than her. And to make it worse, he is sick which means that out of the four children, her husband is moreless the fifth child! previously she has been doing charcoal business as the only source of income and she was left destitute because the little she got was spenton the four children and nothing was left for saving.

She is abit happy that since she joined Life in Africa six months ago, there is hope for better life as she is partly working with invisible children bracelet maker and with the help of a loan she is planning to restart her charcoal business because she has experience in it and her son is ready help her attend to the business. To do this businees Molly needs 500,000/= that she wishes to repay in 12 months at a rate of 50,000/=.

Below is her budget:

25 bags of charcoal @ 15,000/= ........375,000/=

Rental for the stall 4 months @ 30,000/=...120,000/=

Others ...................................5,000/=

Total...................................500.000/=

loans.use: Charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoe-making machinery

loans.name: Luma

texts.en: Luma lives in a small Samoan village with her husband and children.  Her husband brings in a very meager income and Luma and her family lives under very poor conditions.  However, Luma joined SPBD because she is confident that combining hard work with loan funds will enable her to bring enough income to dramatically raise her family’s standard of living.  When Luma joined SPBD, the program and the other members spent a lot of time with her and taught her how to create a business budget and account for her business income.  Luma is growing confident in her business skills and will use loan funds to expand her currently small banana crop into a steady income source and reach her dream of financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pest control agents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Edith would like to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Mrs. Arminda is 70 years old, single, and has eight chilren, of whom 7 are female and one male. Four of her daughters live in Argentina for work-related reasons, her three other daughers are married and the son lives with her.

Arminda is from the city of Carapeguá, and has a modest house including farm animals such as pigs and cows. She began to work very young; at the age of 15 she worked as an artisan of elaborate tablecloths of "Encaje jú" (a characteristic of her area) which her mother taught her to enable her to support herself.

The other activities that help her support her family is the making and selling of starch chips, a typical Paraguayan food made from a base of starch and corn. She sells these with the help of her son on the week-ends at the soccer matches in the area.

She needs this loan in order to purchase large quantities of yarn, in order to increase her production quantities and to give work to her married duaghters that have stayed in Paraguay.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Arminda, tiene 70 años de edad, es soltera, tiene ocho hijos, de los cuales siete son mujeres y solo uno es varón. Cuatro sus hijas viven actualmente en Argentina por motivo laborales, tres ya están casadas y el varón vive con ella. Arminda es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene una humilde casa, y cuenta con animales de granja como cerdos y vacas. Empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, 15 años empezó como artesana elaborando manteles de Encaje jú (tejido característico de la zona), que lo aprendió de su madre quien le dejó ese legado eterno para el subsistir diario. Ella cuenta con otra actividad que la ayuda en el sustento de su familia que es la fabricación y venta de chipa de almidón comida típica paraguaya hecha en base a almidón y maíz, y vende con la ayuda de su hijo los fines de semana en los encuentros de Fútbol de la zona. Necesita el crédito para compra de hilo en cantidad, de manera a aumentar su producción, y dar trabajo a sus hijas casadas que quedaron en Paraguay.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of colorful yarn

loans.name: Florci Glodovina

texts.es:
Glodovina is a diligent woman that pushes herself every day to earn the well being of her beloved family. She is the mother of eight children, each of whom she loves and treats equally. The need to give them the best has made her look for activities for their fulfillment and improvement, which is why she decided to devote herself to selling eucalyptus wood 12 years ago. With time her business has grown in spite of competition from the large lumberyards, and now she stocks many types of wood. The incredible physical strength Glodovina has makes is so she has no trouble in her role and can carry large pieces of wood. It's admirable that her daily drive has made it so now her family can build their own house. With her income they can also save for the benefit of her eight children, who are in school so they can make something of themselves and strive for their own self improvement. She dreams of establishing her own sawmill to increase her business and offer more services to her customers. Let's help this self-denying mother to achieve her goals for the benefit of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund

Glodovina es una mujer empeñosa que cada día se esfuerza para procurarle bienestar a su querida familia, es madre de 8 hijos a los cuales trata con mucho amor y equidad; la necesidad de darles lo mejor ha hecho de ella busque actividades para su desempeño y superación, es por ello que decide dedicarse a la venta de madera de eucalipto hace 12 años, con el tiempo ha crecido su negocio a pesar de la competencia de grandes madereras y comercializa ahora varios tipos de madera. La fuerza física increíble que tiene Glodovina hacen que se desempeñe sin ningún impedimento en su maderera y pueda cargar grandes piezas de madera, es admirable como cada día su empeño ha hecho que ahora su familia pueda estar construyendo su propia casa y todas las ganancias que ahora pueda atesorar son en beneficio de sus 8 hijos que están estudiando para que puedan valerse por si mismos y seguir esforzándose por su propia superación.Sueña con establecer un aserradero para poder incrementar su negocio y ofrecer más servicios a sus clientes.Ayudemos a esta abnegada madre a conseguir lo que se propone para beneficio de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery to install a new service in the lumberyard

loans.name: Ana Luisa Reynoso

texts.en:
Ana is a young businesswoman from Yamasá. She has three children that attend school. With her husband’s help, she started a grocery last year. She remodeled a locale and fitted out the space so that she could show the goods. People go to her general store to obtain different kinds of products such as vegetables, spaghetti, a box of matches, toilet paper, rice, milk and other foodstuffs.

Ana wants to supply her business with products which are running low. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks such as beer, juice, and energy drinks like Cyclon, Monster, and Toro which are much demanded by the customers. Ana will also acquire some sacks of rice and beans, and vegetable oil. She wants to obtain the products at the wholesale market in order to have them at very low cost. That way, the businesswoman will increase her sales volume and her income.

This will be the second loan Ana will take from our FSMA. Her first loan was used wisely and repaid on time.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to supply a grocery store

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Two years ago, in the city of Chinandega, Ms. Karla P. decided to begin her own business in food sales. It is for this reason that she used her small savings to start this business.

As all beginnings are difficult, Ms. P. trasversed through situations where her sales were relatively scarce and at the same time her worry grew for the simple fact that she is a single mother with three small children to provide for. Two of these children are school age.

As with all Nicaraguan mothers, Ms. P. has continued motivating herself to improve the situation of her business. She decided to get loans from Ceprodel (she has obtained 15 credits) which have impacted her directly by bringing her benefits with the food that has increased her earnings. She has been an excellent mother to her 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Desde hace dos años, en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Karla P. decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comida. Es por esta razón que utiliza sus pocos ahorros para iniciar este negocio.

Como todo inicio es difícil, la señora P. atravesó por situaciones en las cuales sus ventas eran relativamente escasas y a la vez su preocupación crecía por el simple hecho de que es madre soltera y con tres pequeños a quienes mantener. Dos de estos están en la etapa escolar.

Como toda mujer Nicaragüense, la señora P. ha seguido esforzándose de manera que ha mejorado la situación de su negocio. Decide realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (ha obtenido 15 créditos) los cuales han impactado de manera directa trayéndole beneficios en su establecimiento de comida por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y ha sido una excelente madre para sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Bukasa A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Edith is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells charcoal for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a plot of land and build a house. Zamu and Faridah sell second hand clothes while Rose sells soft drinks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is married, has three children and makes a living preparing and selling food. Demand for her cooking is high, and she believes this is a good time to expand her small business. She is seeking a loan of $525 to buy additional cooking materials.

loans.use: To buy additional cooking supplies.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana margarita Riíos Pérez is a member of the communal bank "Alfonso Ugarte". She lives in the region of San Martín, in the San Martín proviince, Tarapoto district. She prepares and sells pastries; her specialty are empanadas, which she distributes by the dozen and hundreds to the main markets of the city. She is an employee of the Department of Health. She has always been a hard worker, despite all the adversities, she has always known how to succeed. With the loan of 2,000.00 Soles ($725 USD) which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare her pastries such as: sacks of sugar, prepared flour in packages of 10 kilos, crates of eggs, packages of butter, bags of salt, gourds for the distribution, napkins, jam for stuffing and other necessary products for the preparation of sweet and salty goods. She will also purchase a rack to store all these products to keep them better conserved. She lives with her mother, is 63 years old and is a woman with much vision for the future. She plans to create a modern space with everything necessary to sell her goods

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana margarita Ríos Pérez es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia de San Martín , distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la preparación y venta de refrigeR., su especialidad son las empanadas, que diariamente los distribuye en docenas y cientos a las principales bodegas de la ciudad Es empleada cesante del ministerio de salud, y siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora, pese a las adversidades siempre ha sabido salir adelante. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los refrigeR. como: azúcar en sacos, harina preparada en paquetes de 10 kilos cada uno, huevos en jabas, mantequilla en paquetes, sal en bolsas, tapares para la distribución, servilletas, manjar para los rellenos y otros productos necesaR. para la preparación variada de refrigeR. salados y dulces. Así mismo comprara un estante para almacenar todos estos productos y estén mejor conservados. Ella vive con su mamá, tiene 63 años y es una mujer con mucha visión de futuro, piensa implementar un ambiente moderno con todo lo necesario para la venta de sus refrigeR..

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare her pastries

loans.name: Koyuma Group

texts.en: Omaru T. is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is the leader of the group and has 4 hectors of farmland.  The other group members have 3 – 5 hectors each.  All of the group members cannot cultivate all of their land due to a lack of cash with which to purchase fertilizer and hire labour. This has reduced their ability to cultivate sufficient crops for consumption and income generation.  The group therefore approached SMT for a loan of Le. 2,500,000, which amounts to Le. 500,000 each for hiring labourers and purchasing fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to producing sufficient crops to meet their needs

loans.name: Saramatu

texts.en:
Saramatu D., 65, wife and mother of 6 children, is a food vendor selling gari (milled and roasted cassava), beans, and fried plantains, popularly known as ‘red red’. This is a popular local meal enjoyed by many Ghanaians, especially students, because of its affordability. It is tasty and satisfying and very nutritious, too, because of the protein content from the beans. Saramatu also sells groundnuts, beans, and yams at the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy ingredients such as bags of gari, beans, bunches of plantains, and palm oil to increase her production and make good income.
