Out of this business, Saramatu has been able to support five children to finish school, with only one currently in school. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as gari, beans, plantains and palm oil

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen S. H., 26 years old, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Mrs. Pen and her husband are sugar cane dealers who purchase their product wholesale in bulk from a farm and resell it to the market to earn approximately USD $5 each day to support the family. They have two children and all of them are too young to attend school.

Each day Mrs. Pen pays money for a trailer to transfer her sugar cane to sell in the market. To reduce this daily expense she would like a loan to purchase a small truck. This will help her to transfer the cane to the market herself and lower her overhead costs.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck.

loans.name: Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
The association called “Luna Brillante” is part of the Pro-Mujer family. It is located in the Senkata neighborhood in the city of El Alto. To date it consists of 14 members that have proven to be an organized group when it comes to their loan payments and internal activities. Within the group, the majority of the women are married with children, almost all of whom are in school or attending university.

Trade is the principal activity of the "Luna Brillante" Association. In general, they all sell items like condiments and spices, cereals and light clothing. They purchase their products at wholesale prices and then sell to consumers. They want to invest capital to purchase more at wholesale to increase their profits and meet the obligations they each have with their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación denominada “Luna Brillante” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer, esta se encuentra en la zona de Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 14 miembros que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar y también universitarios, el comercio es la actividad principal de la asociación Luna Brillante como ser la venta de condimentos y especies, de cereales ,venta de ropa ligera ,todos en general venden compran sus productos de mayoristas para luego ofrecerlos al detalle. Quieren invertir capital para realizar estas compras al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias y cumplir con las obligaciones que todos tienen con sus familias

loans.use: Purchase products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy N., 47, is a farmer and the mother of two children who are attending school in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. So Mi, is a firewood seller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand, so his wife is requesting a loan to buy a cart in order to transport firewood to sell door-to-door.  

Previously, Mrs. Tuy N. obtained a loan, now fully repaid, to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to transport firewood to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin S. is married and has 2 children. He has received senior high education. Benjamin sells phone credit cards and does 'unit transfer'. He also sells art work such as beads and also owns a grocery store at Pedu in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2005.

Benjamin S.'s wife is a businesswoman. Benjamin uses his income to pay for rent and utility bills and also for his children's school fees. Benjamin will use the loan to add to his capital to increase his stock for re-sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Benjamin plans to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to add to his capital to increase stock for re-sale.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy T., 34, is a farmer and lives about 124 miles from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and makes US$3 per day. The couple has two young children. Kuy typically makes less than US$1 per day, because planting rice is difficult due to bad weather conditions. She uses a lot of labor, but earns too little to support her family. Kuy also faces problems related to water supply, and even during the rainy season there is sometimes not enough water for plantation. Inflation is among the main factors contributing to the low profits from farming in the area, since the prices of fertilizers and rice seeds have skyrocketed. Most of the farmers therefore produce less output. Kuy is currently asking for a loan of US$500 to be able to purchase a motorbike for her husband's motor-taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Kenia Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Kenia tiene 22 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene una niña de 15 meses, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de zona franca como operario, la Sra. Kenia se levanta desde horas tempranas para poder hacer el desayuno a su esposo y aliñarle el almuerzo ya que a el no le resulta comprar el alimento en su empresa por que es muy caro,  ella vende ropa, zapatos y cosmético desde hace dos años pues inicio vendiendo estos productos a una amiga, luego con las ganancias opto vender ella propia, vende al contado y al crédito, ahora esta solicitando préstamo en Afodenic para invertir mas en la venta de ropa ya que para estos meses se vende bastante en la época de navidad y quiere lograr captar clientes como mejorar su inversión. A largo plazo es comprar un terreno para hacer su propia casa ya que habitan en un cuarto donde  la mama.
texts.en:
Kenia is 22 years old, lives in the Reconciliación Villa neighborhood, and she has a 15 month old daughter. Her husband works in a business as an equipment operator in the industrial park. Enia gets up in the early morning hours to be able to make breakfast for her husband and prepare his lunch as he doesn’t buy lunch at his factory as it is very expensive. She has sold clothing, shoes and cosmetics for two years, beginning selling these products for a friend, then with the earnings she opted to become independent and sell for herself, selling on a cash basis as well as on credit. Now she is asking for a loan from Afodenic to invest in selling clothing as during these months she sells a lot during the Christmas season and she wants to be able to gain more customers to increase her earnings. In the long term she plans to buy a plot of land to build her own home as they currently live in a room in her mother’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño que la quiere mucho, ella vive junto a sus padres que la apoyan mucho en su negocio. Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, la cual le gusta mucho porque le permite interactuar con sus vecinos y otras personas que compran sus productos, ella los recibe siempre con una buena atención para que se sientan a gusto. Le es rentable porque su bodega tiene un ingreso diario por la gran concurrencia que tiene, le va excelentemente, nos comenta. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, además de implementar con más productos y ambientarlo adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Delia is 24 years old, a single mother of one small son who she loves very much. She lives with her parents and they support her a lot in her business. She sells groceries and basic needs products daily, work she has been doing for 4 years. She likes the work because it enables her to interact with her neighbors and other people that buy her products, and she treats her customers well so they feel comfortable. Her store is profitable because she has customers daily, and she tells us her business is going well. This is her 4th loand with MFP, and she has been responsible with her payments. With the money she will expand her business, add products, and adequately decorate her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the products that she sells

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah I. is 46 years old and married with five children.

Sarah sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for many years. She hopes to expand her business.

Sarah is an LAPO client. She now needs a loan of N140,000 so she can purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khursheed Begum Group

texts.en:
Khursheed begum baji is a 48 year old married lady who has lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine places, which people visit to make wishes. Her husband's name is N. A. who is a daily wage laborer. She is the mother of one son who works in a factory. Khursheed baji has a fruit selling business, which she runs from home. People of her community come to her to buy fruit. She does this work to share the financial burden of her family, because inflation is increasing day by day. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to earn a good income.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal selling business. Nasreen begum baji wants a loan to buy another video game for her game shop. Nooran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Angela M. es una dama que se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa, decoraciones, cosméticos y productos de belleza en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde atiende su negocio.

Es de importancia destacar que se ha desarrollado grandemente y por esta razón ha logrado salir adelante habiendo adquirido su vitrina para exhibir sus productos. Actualmente ella requiere de la compra de su mercadería y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con un crédito para dicha compra y así mejorar cada vez más las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Angela M. sells clothing, decorative items, cosmetics, and beauty products from a shop in her home in Ciudad Sandino.

It is important to note that Angela has progressed a lot, and for this reason she has been able to get ahead, having recently acquired a display case for her products. She currently needs assistance to purchase more merchandise, and so she has come to Kiva's partner CEPRODEL to request a loan to continue to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. sells hens and cocks and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Susan is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a policeman. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more hens, cocks, and goats to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more hens,cocks, and goats to sell

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en: Loimata I. is twenty-eight years old and married with three children.  She has five years of experience in building thatched roof beach houses (Samoan beach fale). She sells to the public and tourists seven days a week. She has five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $73.  SPBD loans are Loimata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy building materials and pay school fees.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza V. is 49  years old, divorced, and has two  children: ages 30 and 27. She has been a dressmaker in the Mikunguni neighborhood of  Zanzibar for 15  years.She belongs to the Nyota njema  group. Aziza currently earns an average monthly profit of $105. Each day she works at her business for 8 hours.  


Aziza is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to improve her business.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: B. Salamatou  est une femme mariée qui a 02 enfants, son mari est un enseignant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle fait cette activité depuis 2001. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de répondre aux charges de sa famille. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES son premier crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite son second  cycle de prêt pour acheter 30 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
B. Salamatou is a married woman who has two children. Her husband is a teacher. She earns an income from commerce in grains. She has been in this business since 2001. The inventory she presently has is preventing her from meeting family expenses. She has had her first WAGES loan, which she has repaid. She's requesting her second loan cycle to buy 30 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. is 54 years old. She is married and has five children; four of them are in school whilest the eldest has completed senior high school. She lives with her family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku with soup.

Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her business and include the sale of cereals in bags to her customer which she has started on a small scale. She has been in business for thirty years now. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed O., age 54, is a tailor by profession. He works in a shop in the market square. Currently Mohammed has two apprentices. He has been in business for 25 years and is full of rich experiences. He wants a loan to buy materials in bulk.

Mohammed is married and the father of eight children: five sons and three daughters. His wife is a trader. All of Mohammed’s children are still in school. Some are in senior high while others are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita S. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 39 years old. Bernardita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bernardita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bernardita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bernardita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernardita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Bernardita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: God Is Love Group

texts.en:
Mustapha is 23 years old and single. He is a business-minded young chap. He sells phone accessories like phone chips, units transfer, phones and accessories. He identified an opportunity to provide customers with phone products three years ago, and started the business with a small amount of money given to him by his uncle. He is jovial and has a very good approach to his work. He buys his stock of goods from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is requesting this loan to increase his stock.

Mustapha is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God is Love’. He is the one squatting in the front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy phone units, mobile phone chips, phone accessories, etc.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena M. is a 47-year-old woman who lives in the town of Lotofaga Aleipata B. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Filomena runs a banana plantation. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years, and earns about $500 WST a month from her work.

In 2005, Filomena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1,750 WST from SPBD. She used this loan to buy fertilizer. Now she is applying for a new loan of $2,250 WST which she will use to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Filomena plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise
